story:
Pan American Tintype Survey

 

In the spirit of Timmothy O'Sullivan and all other traveling wet plate photographers of 19th century I am going to travel across America and document it as I find it today.  This will be a new comprehensive overview American cultural and physical landscape.  I will be using the timeless wet plate collodion technique, producing tintypes and ambrotypes that will last for centuries to come.  While using this method each created image is completely hand-made and is entirely unique, as no two plates will ever look the same.  There is no negative in wet plate collodion - instead the light is captured directly upon a piece of aluminum or glass that just prior to exposure is prepped with collodion and bathed in silver nitrate and then developed before the emulsion has a chance to dry.  This requires having a darkroom within steps of the place where the photograph is captured and the darkroom inside The Photo Palace Bus is absolutely perfect for that purpose.  

  You might ask – why use this seemingly forgotten form of photography today?  For me the answer is simple: I chose it because of its easthetic beauty, level of concentration and skill required and distinctive quality of each photograph made.   Collodion images are known for their longevity and projected life of a well-crafted plate exceeds 200 years.  While changing owners they will delight many viewers who will experience them in exact same form as they left my hands. 

  While moving across the land I will also educate as many people as possible about history of photography and it's evolution through time.  I will raise awareness about the importance of hand-made images and encourage those who want to pursue artistic photography to continue working with traditional methods and use film.  To do this I will freely present the small, but comprehensive exhibit featuring over 25 different manual printing styles.  I will offer workshops and demonstration in various photo techniques and I will also learn from the more knowledgeable photographic artist I meet, after all – what is life without learning?

  The journey starts on June 9th, so as you are reading this I am already on the road, heading north from San Diego to Seatlle before cutting east toward Maine and then, closer to fall, south to Florida.

  Help me complete this historic journey – I truly appreciate Your support!

 

Major Expenses in Need of Funding

• Diesel - this is the MAIN expense.  It will take at least $7K in diesel alone to complete this run

• Chemistry and plates - shooting at least 200 plates of aluminum and glass and covering the chemistry needed for that is going to run another $1000-2000

Notice that the goal set by in this campaign is lower that the estimate of just the two major items listed above.   Note the absence of food, shelter and any extracurricular activities.  I hope that this campaign takes off and that all the expenses of traveling may be covered thanks to Your support. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Post this campaign to your favorite social media site, call your local radio and TV station, phone your congressman or congresswoman and talk about this art project to the next seventeen people you see!

Contact me at thephotopalace@gmail.com if you would like to donate some equipment or offer a place to stay - sometimes it's nice to get off the road for a night or two, and who better to suggest neat all-American things to photograph than local inhabitants.

 

More

To learn more about Anton and The Photo Palace Bus visit the gallery on this site - there is a video and a few pitcures for You to enjoy.  As I move down the road I will periodically post updates here, so keep an eye out for those.

Visit the BLOG - there You will find entries and photos from on and off the road, pages dedicated to educational programs offered, construction archives, inspritation and mission and much more.  I do my best to keep my audience informed on the progress of the trip by posting updates there a few times a week.

Thank You!

Along with receiving the perks You choose each and every contributor will be immortalized in the Supporters List on our blog - though some can give more than others it all matters A LOT to me and I am equaly grateful for Your support of any size.

story:
This campaign's purpose it acquire the funds to cover the cost of equipment  and accessories for my camera.

Creating original imagery has always been my main desire in life. Isolated within these images prompts the imaginations and experiences that share with an audience. I have produced inspirational pictographic art, documentary photography and Graphic Arts for fifty-three years. These objective recordings have been mostly about the Venice Boardwalk and Westside beaches of Los Angeles, California, and occasionally recreated as conceptual innovative art.

I had compiled and assembled my most well-liked photographs­­ and authored a book about the diversified Venice Beach lifestyle and community from 1968 to 1982 titled, "North Beach 90291, Rich Mann In Venice." It has not been the first ever published of its kind, nor will it ever be the last, but it has successfully served as a perceptive insight and indirect contribution to the contemporary popularity of the Venice Beach environment, and an aesthetic  record of memoribilia for its local residents. There are still a few collectable copies floating around at: http://www.amazon.com/North-Beach-90291-Rich-Ve...

 Other publications, exciting projects and ideas look promising currently and in the near future. 

My education includes an A.A. B.F.A. and M.A. all majored in Fine Art Photography, whereas my graphic arts are self-taught. This campaign provides the funds to equip a recently acquired Canon T3i digital camera with an adequate lens and accessories. The budget for a Tameron aspherical F-3.5.-6.3...18-270 mm lens, tripod, carrying case and supplements cost approximately $800.00, discounted by our sales-friend at Samy's Camera in Culver City, California. The campaign assets collected will be kept in a restricted / closed bank account until enough reserves are raised for the appropriate amount. 

All contributions and acknowledgments will be gratefully invaluable to assist in developing a platform to provide inspirational art, and chronicled photography.

Contributors receive perks in the form of autographed reproductions distinctively chosen from the "Gallery" section (above the Youtube video) or on my present websites at: www.rvmann.biz and www.rvmann.com.

         

 


 Click on any of the thumbnail icons to expand the images. They are the most popular selections amongst friends, colleagues, and collectors locally and abroad. 

This equipment will contribute immensely toward creating high-level up-to-date conventional artistic expertise.

The recognition of this campaign is invaluable. Please assist this crusade by forwarding it on to others like yourself.

Suggested within the "How much would you like to contribute box"

 is $100 that may be over-typed and replaced with any helful offering. 

Thank you,

Richard Mann

rvmann@gmail.com

story:
About Our Trip

In short, following the universal adage "do it while you’re young" we’ve decided to pack all our camping gear into one car and embark on a six-week road trip spanning 21 states, 10 National Parks, and over 9,000 miles of all the best America has to offer in between.

On separate occasions prior to meeting we’ve both been fortunate enough to experience the allure of travel and exploration of the American West. That yearning for freedom, adventure, and the open road has stirred in us once again. This time we’re determined to share the wonder together. We plan to spend these six-weeks driving many miles, living out of our tent and trekking through the wilderness on a photojournalistic mission to archive the current reality of the places and situations we encounter.

Our Route

Beginning Saturday, August 3rd...

Asheville, NC -> Chicago, IL -> Badlands NP -> Yellowstone NP -> Glacier NP -> Seattle, WA -> Olympic NP -> Portland, OR -> Crater Lake, OR -> Redwoods NP -> San Fransisco, CA -> Big Sur, CA -> Yosemite NP -> Zion NP -> Bryce Canyon NP -> Arches NP -> Durango, CO -> Telluride, CO -> Aspen, CO -> Breckenridge, CO -> Denver, CO -> Memphis, TN -> HOME.

________________________________________________________________________

We’re quite sure many of you reading this right now know this same yearning for adventure and exploration, whether it be in reflection of your own past epic adventures or through the planning of those yet to come, and it is in that universal spirit of wonder that we now ask you to share in ours.

Okay, you’ve done it, you've found the catch. Here is the part where we ask for your monetary support. Yes we are trying to recruit some crucial funds for equipment, gas and food. But, before we scare you off, as we do no think this exchange should be one-sided, we’d like to offer you some pretty wonderful items in return for your generosity. Check them out on the right side of this page!

____________________________________________________________________

WONDERING WHAT THESE IMAGES MIGHT LOOK LIKE?

At the conclusion of our trip we will create a curated gallery of images from which you can select your print.

To check out the types of images you will be receiving please check out our storefront: http://society6.com/COASTtwoCOAST

Or check out the Gallery section of this site.

(Note: these are examples from our past adventures, but reflect the style and scope of what you might receive)

____________________________________________________________________


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

A HUGE heart-felt thank you for all the support!

Even if you cannot donate, we implore you to drop us a line with your tips, advice, favorite places, secret spots, scenic drives, unforgettable vistas, philosophical musings, and whimsical anecdotes. Or just say hi!  We’re always up for some extra adventure.

Contact us and follow our photoblog while we are on the road: 

http://c-two-c.tumblr.com/

story:
The Project:

Conversations with Strangers is a work in progress by photographer/painter Kelly Embry. The project is currently in its beginning stages in Atlanta, Georgia, with plans to expand the project to Europe. This project encompasses the idea of entering the minds of complete strangers and allowing them to tell their story. Who they are. What they have lost. What they Fear or Love.

The goal is to find a better understanding of the human condition through imagery and conversation. Everyone has things in their head that they either can not or will not let out. Things that haunt you or drive to become the very person you are. Ideally, I would like to do this by transplanting myself in a foreign location where I myself am unfamiliar. There are several spots that I am interested in visiting, but the location or locations will be determined by funding. On this list currently are: Venice, Salzburg, and perhaps somewhere in Southern France. 

I will travel with both photography and painting supplies to document my travels and the people I meet. Some people will be sought out on the internet to meet with in my destinations, and some will be completely random as I explore these locations. When I return, I will be compiling all materials produced from the trip into a form of book including: photography, paintings, mixed media pieces and writings. I will seek to have this book, my first book, published. With your assistance and contribution, I will be able to fund the production of this project and explore this concept to its full capacity. 


What I Need:

All funds contributed will go directly into the expenses of the project, including: travel expenses, photography supplies, painting supplies, and the production and launch of the book in late 2014/early 2015. 

If the full goal is not met, the project will still go forward, just with minor adjustments to the locations and number of locations that will be visited. 

Contributors will receive items created from the project directly, including limited edition fine art prints and copies of the resulting book, as well as additional items, skype mentorships, and VIP invites to the launch party. 


Other Ways You Can Help:

If you are unable to contribute financially to this project, but would still like to help out, you can do so by helping me spread the word and reach my project goal. Also, if you have access to discounted supplies or travel arrangements, your assistance in this manor is equally as appreciated! 


Thank you so much for any contribution, no matter the size. I really want to see this project get off the ground and am very excited to see how it will shape itself. 

If you have any questions, please email me at:  info@kellyembry.com

Website: www.kellyembryphoto.com

Facebook: www.facebook.com/kellyembryphoto

story:
This campaign finished successfully. Now you have the chance to buy the book Icelandscapes directly on my website.
Diese Kampagne ist erfolgreich zu Ende gegangen. Nun haben Sie die Möglichkeit das Buch Icelandscapes direkt auf meiner Webseite zu erwerben.

Englich description / Englische Beschreibung

--> Zur deutschen Beschreibung

Table of contents

  1. The Project
  2. Why I need your help
  3. What you get
  4. Ways to help me
  5. The Photographer
  6. Ways to contact and follow me
  7. Sample pages of the book

 

I C E L A N D S C A P E S

Icelandscapes is a photo project about the surpassing nature and surreal landscapes of Iceland. Last year I had the pleasure to travel through this unique country and tried to capture the beauty of this fascinating island.

Come with me on a journey through diversified locations full of wild nature. Feel the breath of the Earth at the caldera of Krafla, experience the immense power of water at one of the roaring waterfalls all over the country, immerse into a surreal world of glittering pieces of ice at the black sand beach of Jökulsárlón, get in touch with unbelievable soft moss that covers whole lava fields and watch the most funny and clumsy creatures of Iceland - Puffins.

All these impressions and many more will be part of the photo book Icelandscapes.

Facts about Iceland

Iceland is one of the youngest landmasses on earth, formed at about 20 million years ago due to volcanic eruptions on the Mid-Atlantic ridge. It is 103.000km² in size and has a population of only 322.930 which makes it one of the world's most sparsely populated countries with merely 3.1 people per km². For comparison, Germany has 225 per km², the Netherlands 497 per km² and the United States 35 per km². Around two-thirds of the country's population lives in the capital city Reykjavik and its surrounding areas. The rest of Iceland is wild nature with lots of sand and lava fields, vulcanos, massive glaciers and the lifeblood of the island - glacial rivers flowing to the sea.

What makes Icelands nature so special is that it changes its appearance from one moment to the other. You may stand in between mossy lava fields and as soon as you come around the next 'corner' you may stand right in front of a huge glacier tounge. Your eyes have barely time to rest because of all the impressions they have to deal with.

? back to top

 

Why I need your help

I want to share my impressions of Iceland in a self published photo book and need your help to get it printed.

To get a good price for the book I need to print at least 500 copies, otherwise the production costs will be to much and the final book would be to expensive. Therefore I'm asking for your help to bring this project to life.

? back to top

 

What you get

The Book 'Icelandscapes'

The basis of every perk (except the cheapest one) is the book Icelandscapes of course. Here are some facts about the book:

  • 30 x 20 cm (12 x 8 inch)
  • 160 pages on 170g paper
  • silk mat covered with dispersing varnish
  • professional long-living binding
  • hardcover
  • more than 180 pictures (color and black/white, landscape and portrait and even some panoramas)
  • including GPS coordinates of every location

Acknowledgement

Some of the perks include the funders name in the acknowledgement section of the book. The names will appear in the following format: Forename Surname (Country code) i.e. Stefan Brenner (AUT). They will be sorted in alphabetical order.

Limited Edition

For collectors of limited edition photo books I will sign and number the first 100 copies running of the press. Take your chance and order one as long as they are not sold out. The amount will not be increased no matter how big the demand will be!

Book and Print

A 30x20cm (12x8inch) fine art print will be added to the book. This print will be signed and printed on museum quality Hahnemühle Photo Rag® Matt FineArt 308gsm paper. You can choose one of the pictures in this gallery. Just tell me the number of the picture you'd like to get.

Limited Fine Art Prints

Large high-quality fine art prints give you an even more advanced experience on the magnificent landscapes of Iceland and will be an eyecatcher as well. They will be numbered, signed and printed on museum quality Hahnemühle Photo Rag® Matt FineArt 308gsm papers.

Available in two edition sizes:

90x60cm (36x24inch) each image limited to 20 prints in that size (+2 artists proofs)
150x100cm (60x40inch) each image limited to 10 prints in that size (+2 artists proofs)

You can choose one of the pictures in this gallery. Just tell me the number of the picture you'd like to get.

Add-Ons

You can pimp your perk and add any of the following add-ons:

Postcards

If you wanna add 5 postcards featuring the amazing landscapes and nature of Iceland to your perk, just add an extra 10€.

T-Shirt

If you wanna add one 'Icelandscapes Official Supporter' high quality T-Shirt to your perk, just add an extra 30€. Available in S,M,L,XL,XXL and 3XL.

Signed Print

If you wanna add a signed 20x30 (12x8inch) fine art print to your perk, just add an extra 25€. This print will be signed and printed on museum quality Hahnemühle Photo Rag® Matt FineArt 308gsm paper. You can choose one of the pictures in this gallery. Just tell me the number of the picture you'd like to get.

 

? back to top 

 

Other ways to help me

One of the most important things to finally reach the goal is to spread the word. Therefore I'm asking you to share this campaign with your friends and followers all over the world. Mail it to people you think may be interested in this project and share it on Facebook, Google+, Twitter, ... wherever you like to. Surprise me ;)

Preferably use the indiegogo sharing tools you can find in the upper part of this site to share this campaign to social media plattforms.

I really appreciate every help from the bottom of my heart and thank you very much!

? back to top

 

 

The Photographer

My name is Stefan Brenner and I'm a passionate Photographer and Liquid Artist from Vienna (Austria). I love to travel all over the world, capture the beauty of our wonderful planet and share my experiences and pictures with others.

If you wanna know more about me and my work besides this project please visit www.stefanbrenner.com.

There you'll also find some of my Liquid Art works showing colliding water drops that form spectecular sculptures within a 1000th of a second. If you haven't seen them before, be sure to check it out.

? back to top

 

Ways to contact and follow me 

Feel free to contact and follow me in any way and on every platform you like. Here are the ones that I use most of the time to stay in contact with people.

 

? back to top

 

Sample pages

Here you can find some sample pages from the book Icelandscapes.

? back to top



Deutsche Beschreibung / German Description


Inhalt

  1. Das Projekt
  2. Warum ich Ihre Unterstützung benötige
  3. Was Sie bekommen
  4. So können Sie mir helfen
  5. Der Fotograf
  6. Möglichkeiten mir zu folgen und mich zu kontaktieren
  7. Beispielseiten des Buches

 

I C E L A N D S C A P E S

Icelandscapes ist ein Fotoprojekt über die unvergleichliche Natur und surreale Landschaft Islands. Letztes Jahr hatte ich das Vergnügen, durch dieses einzigartige Land zu reisen und die Schöhnheit dieser faszinierenden Insel festzuhalten.

Kommen Sie mit mir auf eine Reise durch verschiedene Gebiete voller wilder Natur. Spüren Sie den Atem der Erde in der Caldera von Krafla, erleben Sie die immense Kraft des Wassers in einem der rauschenden Wasserfälle im ganzen Land, tauchen Sie ein in eine surreale Welt aus glitzernden Eisstücken beim schwarzen Sandstrand von Jökulsárlón, kommen Sie in Berührung mit dem extrem weichen Moos, welches ganze Lavafelder bedeckt und beobachten Sie die lustigsten und ungeschicktesten Lebewesen Islands - Papageientaucher.

All diese Eindrücke und mehr, werden Teil meines Fotobuches Icelandscapes sein.

Fakten über Island

Island ist eine der jüngsten Landmassen der Welt. Entstanden vor etwa 20 Millionen Jahren durch vulkanische Eruptionen des mittelatlantischen Rücken. Island ist 103.000km² groß und hat eine Bevölkerung von nur 322,930. Damit ist Island eines der weltweit am dünnsten besiedelten Ländern mit nur 3,1 Personen pro km². Zum Vergleich: Deutschland hat 225 pro km², die Niederlande 497 pro km² und die Vereinigten Staaten 35 pro km². Rund zwei Drittel der Bevölkerung des Landes lebt in der Hauptstadt Reykjavik und Umgebung. Der Rest von Island ist wilde Natur mit viel Sand und Lavafeldern, Vulkanen, riesigen Gletschern und der Lebenadern der Insel - eisige Flüsse die Richtung Meer fliessen.

Für mich liegt der spezielle Reiz an Island in der abwechslungsreichen und sich ständig ändernden Landschaft. Du kannst mitten in einem der riesigen mit Moos bewachsenen Lavafelder stehen, sobald du um das nächste Eck kommst, kann es sein, dass sich vor dir plötzlich eine gigantische Gletscherzunge auftut. Die Augen haben kaum Zeit zu rasten auf Grund der vielen Impressionen die diese wunderbare Insel zu bieten hat.

? back to top

 

Warum ich Ihre Unterstützung benötige

Ich möchte meine Impressionen von Island in einem selbst publizierten Fotobuch veröffentlichen und benötige Ihre Hilfe bei der Finanzierung der Druckkosten.

Um den Preis für ein Fotobuch möglichst niedrig zu halten, muss ich mindestens 500 Bücher drucken lassen. Daher bitte ich um Ihre Hilfe um dieses Projekt ins Leben zu rufen.

? back to top

 

Was Sie bekommen

Das Buch 'Icelandscapes'

Bei jedem Perk (ausser beim billigsten) ist das Buch Icelandscapes inkludiert. Hier nun einige Fakten über das Buch:

  • 30 x 20 cm
  • 160 Seiten auf 170g Papier
  • Beidseitig lackiert mit Dispolack seidenmatt
  • Fadenheftbindung
  • Hardcover
  • Mehr als 180 Bilder (in Farbe und Schwarz/Weiss, Quer- und Hochformat und auch einige Panoramas)
  • inklusive GPS Koordinaten jeder einzelnen Location

Acknowledgement

Einige der Perks beinhalten den Namen des Unterstützers in der Danksagung des Buches. Die Namen werden in folgendem Format erscheinen: Vorname Nachname (Landeskürzel) z.B. Stefan Brenner (AUT). Sie werden in alphabetischer Reihenfolge sortiert sein.

Limited Edition

Für Sammler von limitierten Fotobüchern werde ich die ersten 100 Kopien die von der Presse laufen signieren und nummerieren. Nutzen Sie Ihre Chance und bestellen Sie sich ein Exemplar solange diese noch nicht ausverkauft sind. Die Anzahl wird nicht erhöht, ganz egal wie hoch die Nachfrage sein wird!

Book and Print

Zusätzlich zum Buch erhalten Sie einen 30x20cm Fine-Art-Druck. Dieser Druck wird von mir signiert und auf Hahnemühle Photo Rag® Matt FineArt 308gsm Papier in Museumsqualität gedruckt. Sie können eines der Bilder in dieser Galerie wählen. Sie brauchen mir dazu nur die Bildnummer des gewünschten Bildes mitteilen.

Limited Fine Art Prints

Große hoch qualitative Fine-Art-Drucke geben Ihnen einen noch besseren Eindruck der großartigen Landschaften Island's und stellen auch ein Blickfang in jedem Raum dar. Diese werden nummeriert, signiert und auf Hahnemühle Photo Rag® Matt FineArt 308gsm Papier in Museumsqualität gedruckt.

Erhältlich in 2 Größen:

90x60cm, jedes Bild auf 20 Exemplare in dieser Größe limitiert (+2 artists proofs)
150x100cm, jedes Bild auf 10 Exemplare in dieser Größe limitiert (+2 artists proofs)

Sie können eines der Bilder in dieser Galerie wählen. Sie brauchen mir dazu nur die Bildnummer des gewünschten Bildes mitteilen.

Add-Ons

Sie können Ihren gewählten Perk mit folgenden Add-ons erweitern:

Postcards

Wenn Sie 5 Postkarten mit einem Foto der faszinierenden Landschaften Island's zu Ihrem Perk hinzufügen wollen, addieren Sie einfach 10€.

T-Shirt

Wenn Sie ein T-Shirt 'Icelandscapes Official Supporter' in hoher Qualität zu Ihrem Perk hinzufügen möchten, addieren Sie einfach 30€. Erhältlich in den Größen S,M,L,XL,XXL und 3XL.

Signed Print

Wenn Sie einen signierten 30x20xm Fine-Art-Druck zu Ihrem Perk hinzufügen möchten, addieren Sie einfach 25€. Der Druck wird signiert und auf Hahnemühle Photo Rag® Matt FineArt 308gsm Papier in Museumsqualität gedruckt. Sie können eines der Bilder in dieser Galerie wählen. Sie brauchen mir dazu nur die Bildnummer des gewünschten Bildes mitteilen.

 

? back to top 

 

So können Sie mir helfen

Eines der wichtigsten Dinge um die Kampagne erfolgreich beenden zu können, ist die Verbreitung. Daher bitte ich Sie, diese Kampagne mit Ihren Freunden und Bekannten auf der ganzen Welt zu teilen. Mailen Sie den Leuten die dieses Projekt interessieren könnte, teilen Sie es auf Facebook, Google+, Twitter, ... wo auch immer Sie Kontakt mit Leuten pflegen. Überraschen Sie mich ;)

Vorzugsweise verwenden Sie bitte die indoegogo sharing tools, welche Sie im oberen Bereich dieser Seite finden um diese Kampagne auf den diversen Social Media Plattformen zu teilen..

Ich schätze wirklich jede erdenkliche Hilfe die ich kriegen kann aus tiefstem Herzen und danke Ihnen recht herzlich!

? back to top

 

 

Der Fotograf

Mein Name ist Stefan Brenner und ich bin leidenschaftlicher Fotograf und Liquid Artist aus Wien (Österreich). Ich liebe es über die ganze Welt zu reisen, die Schöhnheiten unseres wunderbaren Planeten zu dokumentieren und meine Erlebnisse und Bilder mit anderen zu teilen.

Wenn Sie mehr über mich und meine Arbeit erfahren wollen, besuchen Sie doch meine Webseite unter www.stefanbrenner.com.

Dort können Sie auch einige meiner Liquid Art Bilder sehen. Diese zeigen kollidierende Wassertropfen welche im Bruchteil einer Sekunde spektakuläre Skulpturen und Formen bilden.

? back to top

Sie können mich gerne auf einer der folgenden Plattformen kontaktieren oder meine Aktivitäten verfolgen.

story_txt:
This campaign finished successfully. Now you have the chance to buy the book Icelandscapes directly on my website.
Diese Kampagne ist erfolgreich zu Ende gegangen. Nun haben Sie die Möglichkeit das Buch Icelandscapes direkt auf meiner Webseite zu erwerben.

Englich description / Englische Beschreibung
--> Zur deutschen Beschreibung
Table of contents

The Project
Why I need your help
What you get
Ways to help me
The Photographer
Ways to contact and follow me
Sample pages of the book
 

I C E L A N D S C A P E S
Icelandscapes is a photo project about the surpassing nature and surreal landscapes of Iceland. Last year I had the pleasure to travel through this unique country and tried to capture the beauty of this fascinating island.
Come with me on a journey through diversified locations full of wild nature. Feel the breath of the Earth at the caldera of Krafla, experience the immense power of water at one of the roaring waterfalls all over the country, immerse into a surreal world of glittering pieces of ice at the black sand beach of Jökulsárlón, get in touch with unbelievable soft moss that covers whole lava fields and watch the most funny and clumsy creatures of Iceland - Puffins.
All these impressions and many more will be part of the photo book Icelandscapes.

Facts about Iceland
Iceland is one of the youngest landmasses on earth, formed at about 20 million years ago due to volcanic eruptions on the Mid-Atlantic ridge. It is 103.000km² in size and has a population of only 322.930 which makes it one of the world's most sparsely populated countries with merely 3.1 people per km². For comparison, Germany has 225 per km², the Netherlands 497 per km² and the United States 35 per km². Around two-thirds of the country's population lives in the capital city Reykjavik and its surrounding areas. The rest of Iceland is wild nature with lots of sand and lava fields, vulcanos, massive glaciers and the lifeblood of the island - glacial rivers flowing to the sea.

What makes Icelands nature so special is that it changes its appearance from one moment to the other. You may stand in between mossy lava fields and as soon as you come around the next 'corner' you may stand right in front of a huge glacier tounge. Your eyes have barely time to rest because of all the impressions they have to deal with.
? back to top
 

Why I need your help
I want to share my impressions of Iceland in a self published photo book and need your help to get it printed.
To get a good price for the book I need to print at least 500 copies, otherwise the production costs will be to much and the final book would be to expensive. Therefore I'm asking for your help to bring this project to life.

? back to top
 

What you get
The Book 'Icelandscapes'
The basis of every perk (except the cheapest one) is the book Icelandscapes of course. Here are some facts about the book:

30 x 20 cm (12 x 8 inch)
160 pages on 170g paper
silk mat covered with dispersing varnish
professional long-living binding
hardcover
more than 180 pictures (color and black/white, landscape and portrait and even some panoramas)
including GPS coordinates of every location

Acknowledgement
Some of the perks include the funders name in the acknowledgement section of the book. The names will appear in the following format: Forename Surname (Country code) i.e. Stefan Brenner (AUT). They will be sorted in alphabetical order.
Limited Edition
For collectors of limited edition photo books I will sign and number the first 100 copies running of the press. Take your chance and order one as long as they are not sold out. The amount will not be increased no matter how big the demand will be!
Book and Print
A 30x20cm (12x8inch) fine art print will be added to the book. This print will be signed and printed on museum quality Hahnemühle Photo Rag® Matt FineArt 308gsm paper. You can choose one of the pictures in this gallery. Just tell me the number of the picture you'd like to get.
Limited Fine Art Prints
Large high-quality fine art prints give you an even more advanced experience on the magnificent landscapes of Iceland and will be an eyecatcher as well. They will be numbered, signed and printed on museum quality Hahnemühle Photo Rag® Matt FineArt 308gsm papers.
Available in two edition sizes:
90x60cm (36x24inch) each image limited to 20 prints in that size (+2 artists proofs)150x100cm (60x40inch) each image limited to 10 prints in that size (+2 artists proofs)
You can choose one of the pictures in this gallery. Just tell me the number of the picture you'd like to get.
Add-Ons
You can pimp your perk and add any of the following add-ons:
Postcards
If you wanna add 5 postcards featuring the amazing landscapes and nature of Iceland to your perk, just add an extra 10€.
T-Shirt
If you wanna add one 'Icelandscapes Official Supporter' high quality T-Shirt to your perk, just add an extra 30€. Available in S,M,L,XL,XXL and 3XL.

Signed Print
If you wanna add a signed 20x30 (12x8inch) fine art print to your perk, just add an extra 25€. This print will be signed and printed on museum quality Hahnemühle Photo Rag® Matt FineArt 308gsm paper. You can choose one of the pictures in this gallery. Just tell me the number of the picture you'd like to get.
 

? back to top 
 

Other ways to help me
One of the most important things to finally reach the goal is to spread the word. Therefore I'm asking you to share this campaign with your friends and followers all over the world. Mail it to people you think may be interested in this project and share it on Facebook, Google+, Twitter, ... wherever you like to. Surprise me ;)
Preferably use the indiegogo sharing tools you can find in the upper part of this site to share this campaign to social media plattforms.
I really appreciate every help from the bottom of my heart and thank you very much!
? back to top
 
 

The Photographer
My name is Stefan Brenner and I'm a passionate Photographer and Liquid Artist from Vienna (Austria). I love to travel all over the world, capture the beauty of our wonderful planet and share my experiences and pictures with others.
If you wanna know more about me and my work besides this project please visit www.stefanbrenner.com.
There you'll also find some of my Liquid Art works showing colliding water drops that form spectecular sculptures within a 1000th of a second. If you haven't seen them before, be sure to check it out.
? back to top
 

Ways to contact and follow me 
Feel free to contact and follow me in any way and on every platform you like. Here are the ones that I use most of the time to stay in contact with people.

I C E L A N D S C A P E S
Icelandscapes ist ein Fotoprojekt über die unvergleichliche Natur und surreale Landschaft Islands. Letztes Jahr hatte ich das Vergnügen, durch dieses einzigartige Land zu reisen und die Schöhnheit dieser faszinierenden Insel festzuhalten.
Kommen Sie mit mir auf eine Reise durch verschiedene Gebiete voller wilder Natur. Spüren Sie den Atem der Erde in der Caldera von Krafla, erleben Sie die immense Kraft des Wassers in einem der rauschenden Wasserfälle im ganzen Land, tauchen Sie ein in eine surreale Welt aus glitzernden Eisstücken beim schwarzen Sandstrand von Jökulsárlón, kommen Sie in Berührung mit dem extrem weichen Moos, welches ganze Lavafelder bedeckt und beobachten Sie die lustigsten und ungeschicktesten Lebewesen Islands - Papageientaucher.
All diese Eindrücke und mehr, werden Teil meines Fotobuches Icelandscapes sein.

story: I obtained my Photography Diploma and joined as a partner with an established business, however, I am still using the Nikon D70 that I got used to start classes.  I have student loans that got me through my classes.  In pursuing my career choice and passion, I find that I need new equipment to get up to speed with my partner and the market.  I have my first wedding shoot upcoming and have determined that I would like Alien Bees lighting and a new camera so I have my older one for a backup in this circumstance.  We need money to put the commercial I am showing you back on the air, as it is expensive.  We are in line for great things to come our way and grow our business, just need a little kick start to get me up to the level of professional I want to be at.

story:
MACEDONIA, a land of glistening lakes and bright tall mountains, a land of unexpected waterfalls and villages hidden in canyons, a land of monasteries hanging on the edge of tall rocky cliffs, a land of loving and shiny people with big warm hearts… Our Homeland.


"My Homeland" is a project that uses pictures to tell a story about all of Macedonia's cities, villages, monasteries, churches, mosques, mountains, rivers… This is a project about the magical beauty hidden in this land, about the people who live here and their identity, their beliefs and traditions that have been passed on for generations and lost in time.

I have created a website -www.mojrodenkraj.com.mk- where all of my photography work can be found. Simply by choosing the desired area on the map, you will be able to find pictures and stories of the desired community with all the significant places and monuments in it, plus pictures of people’s everyday life in each community.

This project is part of my long term photography journey, and my great love for nature that has been instilled in me ever since I was a little boy. But this project is not only about photography and art. This project is about:

- Memories – the lives that people lived in these beautiful pieces of land and the events that forced these people to abandon their beautiful homelands.


- Time – The story each of these places preserve for thousands of years.



- Tradition – The folklore and customs that have been pasted down for decades.


- Beauty – The breathtaking mountains, landscapes, and untouched nature.


- People – The Macedonians that live all over the world, should have access to pictures of the place, where they or their ancestors were born and lived.



How it all started?

I was raised to love and respect Mother Nature my whole childhood. My love for outdoors was natural to me, from a very young age when my dad began taking me and my little sister hiking every weekend when we were very young. My father is a photographer as well, but my passion for photography started along with my passion for outdoor sports like mountain hiking, rock climbing and paragliding.

In the past 10 years I've spent many days and nights at gorgeous places around Macedonia. This is a project where I want to show the simple beauty that gives love and asks for nothing in return. It is about the untouched nature that can surprise us over and over again, it can never bore us, it can comfort us when we feel the loneliest, and it can warm us in the coldest of winter days.

With my lens I've captured many moments from glorious sunrises behind tall mountains, to abandoned beautiful villages and lovely people. 



Every single place in Macedonia has its own story, and every story deserves to be shared.

I've walked miles and miles and met many lovely people who never hesitated to invite me over for a hot drink, food, and nice talk. The people have warm hearts and have many stories to share. My goal is to share the story of every village, every church, every monastery, every mosque, every single mountain, every city and everything that makes this country unique in its own way.

This is a place where we can discover our curious nature, while exploring every part of this land. In search of inner peace, in search of our roots, in search of undiscovered lands... This is a place for all of us.


Why this project is important?

The reason why I really feel like I need to do this now is because a lot of the houses and religious places in the abandoned villages around Macedonia are being destroyed by time and they are slowly deteriorating. The roofs are starting to fall down and even little storms can completely flatten them to the ground. 

The other sad thing is that even some of the villages where there are few people left living in them, there are only senior citizens and their children have moved away to find more work opportunities. 

These elderly people in these few villages are the last people left that can teach us about the customs and traditions in these specific areas, as well as the amazing techniques of dehydrating home-made sausage, sun ripened peppers and many other traditional ways of growing and preserving food. 

They have survived their whole lives on self-sustainability and it will be really sad to not learn their ways and techniques that have been used for years. 


Why do I need funding?

Even though I have been able to start this project with the equipment I already have, I will need some additional help to reach the entire country and do the project with the utmost focus on quality.

One of the crucial tools for the project is an off-road vehicle that will be able to take me places where a regular car cannot. There are many villages that don’t have paved roads, and getting there without the appropriate vehicle could be a challenge and dangerous. My promise to you is that you will be able to find pictures of every single community in Macedonia. Being able to get to these places is an important step that I need funding for.

Other costs that I will have include purchasing a Quadcopter that will allow me to take pictures from above. For the villages that are settled in the valley, that would be the only way to take a picture of the whole village. Pictures taken from the sky are spectacular and they show a whole new angle of the beauty that we have in Macedonia. 

This little tool will allow me to attach my Go-Pro camera to it and send it up in the sky to take pictures of places where no human could go.

Other essential needs to be able to get to every single community in Macedonia include money for gas, occasional accommodation costs (most of the time I will sleep in my tent), purchasing a laptop to work on the pictures when I’m on the road, website maintenance, and some additional photography equipment. The $5,000 I am asking for will only help me get started for the first year, and if I raise more than that, I will be able to direct the extra funds for the following years. I am hoping that after having the initial funds to start, this project bring income on its own, so I can continue my journey to reach the whole country.  

I have completed photographing 80 villages in the country. There are about 1650 villages and 35 towns in Macedonia, and I am estimating it will take me about 5 years to photograph them all. I am only asking for funding for the costs that I will have during the first year. If I don’t manage to raise the full amount, I will be still able to start and find other ways to fund the project as I go. That is why I decided to use flexible funding. 


What do you get?

Apart from the regular updates on the project, which you will get by e-mail or in a video format, I’m also offering you an exciting set of perks. Depending on the amount you decide to donate you can get a full HD photograph in your e-mail, a laminated photograph sent to your home address, a unique present from Macedonia, a T-shirt with our logo, as well as travel book about Macedonia.

For our most enthusiastic contributors we are offering a free stay with a host family in Bitola, Macedonia, trips around the mountains and villages in the Bitola region and further, local home-made food and much more. Don't miss your chance to have a very unique vacation next summer!

For details see perks.



Other ways you could help

If you can’t contribute, that doesn't mean you can’t help.

Please share this campaign with your friends on Facebook, twitter or send the project to your email contacts who you think might be interested in this idea.

The Indiegogo share tools on this site can help get the word out!
story_txt:
MACEDONIA, a land of glistening lakes and bright tall
mountains, a land of unexpected waterfalls and villages hidden in canyons, a
land of monasteries hanging on the edge of tall rocky cliffs, a land of loving
and shiny people with big warm hearts… Our Homeland. "My
Homeland" is a project that uses pictures to tell a story about all of
Macedonia's cities, villages, monasteries, churches, mosques, mountains,
rivers… This is a project about the magical beauty hidden in this land, about
the people who live here and their identity, their beliefs and traditions that
have been passed on for generations and lost in time.I have created a website -www.mojrodenkraj.com.mk- where all of
my photography work can be found. Simply by choosing the desired area on the
map, you will be able to find pictures and stories of the desired community
with all the significant places and monuments in it, plus pictures of people’s
everyday life in each community. This project is part of my long term photography journey,
and my great love for nature that has been instilled in me ever since I was a
little boy. But this project is not only about photography and art. This
project is about:- Memories – the lives that people lived in these beautiful
pieces of land and the events that forced these people to abandon their
beautiful homelands.- Time – The story each of these places preserve for
thousands of years.



- Tradition – The folklore and customs that have been pasted
down for decades.
- Beauty – The breathtaking mountains, landscapes, and
untouched nature.


- People – The Macedonians that live all over the world,
should have access to pictures of the place, where they or their ancestors were
born and lived.How it all started?
I was raised to love and respect Mother Nature my whole childhood.
My love for outdoors was natural to me, from a very young age when my dad began
taking me and my little sister hiking every weekend when we were very young. My
father is a photographer as well, but my passion for photography started along
with my passion for outdoor sports like mountain hiking, rock climbing and paragliding.In the past 10 years I've spent many days and nights at
gorgeous places around Macedonia. This is a project where I want to show the
simple beauty that gives love and asks for nothing in return. It is about the
untouched nature that can surprise us over and over again, it can never bore
us, it can comfort us when we feel the loneliest, and it can warm us in the
coldest of winter days.With my lens I've captured many moments from glorious
sunrises behind tall mountains, to abandoned beautiful villages and lovely
people. Every single place in Macedonia has its own story, and every story
deserves to be shared.I've walked miles and miles and met many lovely people who
never hesitated to invite me over for a hot drink, food, and nice talk. The
people have warm hearts and have many stories to share. My goal is to share the
story of every village, every church, every monastery, every mosque, every
single mountain, every city and everything that makes this country unique in
its own way.This is a place where we can discover our curious nature, while exploring every part of this land. In search of inner peace, in search of our roots, in search of undiscovered lands... This is a place for all of us.
Why this project is
important?
The reason why I really feel like I need to do this now is
because a lot of the houses and religious places in the abandoned villages
around Macedonia are being destroyed by time and they are slowly deteriorating.
The roofs are starting to fall down and even little storms can completely
flatten them to the ground. The other sad thing is that even some of the villages where
there are few people left living in them, there are only senior citizens and
their children have moved away to find more work opportunities. These elderly
people in these few villages are the last people left that can teach us about
the customs and traditions in these specific areas, as well as the amazing techniques
of dehydrating home-made sausage, sun ripened peppers and many other
traditional ways of growing and preserving food. They have survived their whole lives on
self-sustainability and it will be really sad to not learn their ways and
techniques that have been used for years. Why do I need
funding?
Even though I have been able to start this project with the
equipment I already have, I will need some additional help to reach the entire
country and do the project with the utmost focus on quality.
One of the crucial tools for the project is an off-road
vehicle that will be able to take me places where a regular car cannot. There
are many villages that don’t have paved roads, and getting there without the
appropriate vehicle could be a challenge and dangerous. My promise to you is
that you will be able to find pictures of every single community in Macedonia.
Being able to get to these places is an important step that I need funding for.Other costs that I will have include purchasing a Quadcopter
that will allow me to take pictures from above. For the villages that are
settled in the valley, that would be the only way to take a picture of the
whole village. Pictures taken from the sky are spectacular and they show a
whole new angle of the beauty that we have in Macedonia. This little tool will
allow me to attach my Go-Pro camera to it and send it up in the sky to take
pictures of places where no human could go.
Other essential needs to be able to get to every single
community in Macedonia include money for gas, occasional accommodation costs
(most of the time I will sleep in my tent), purchasing a laptop to work on the
pictures when I’m on the road, website maintenance, and some additional
photography equipment. The $5,000 I am asking for will only help me get started for the first year, and if I raise more than that, I will be able to direct the extra funds for the following years. I am hoping that after having the initial funds to start, this project bring income on its own, so I can continue my journey to reach the whole country.  I have completed photographing 80 villages in the country. There are about 1650 villages
and 35 towns in Macedonia, and I am estimating it will take me about 5 years to
photograph them all. I am only asking for funding for the costs that I will have during the first year. If I don’t manage to raise the full amount, I will be still able to start
and find other ways to fund the project as I go. That is why I decided to use
flexible funding.  
What do you get?
Apart from the regular updates on the project, which you
will get by e-mail or in a video format, I’m also offering you an exciting set
of perks. Depending on the amount you decide to donate you can get a full HD
photograph in your e-mail, a laminated photograph sent to your home address, a
unique present from Macedonia, a T-shirt with our logo, as well as travel book
about Macedonia.
For our most enthusiastic contributors we are offering a
free stay with a host family in Bitola, Macedonia, trips around the
mountains and villages in the Bitola region and further, local home-made food
and much more. Don't miss your chance to have a very unique vacation next summer!For details see perks.
Other ways you could
help
If you can’t contribute, that doesn't mean you can’t help.
Please share this campaign with your friends on Facebook,
twitter or send the project to your email contacts who you think might be
interested in this idea.
The Indiegogo share tools on this site can help get the word
out!

story:
CARA NICOLE 2021 COS-LINGERIE CALENDAR CAMPAIGN

Love lingerie and cosplay? Well I have got the calendar for you! For a year of intimate cosplay inspired boudoir extravaganza, Cara Nicole Presents brings you the TWENTY TWENTY ONE COS-LINGERIE CALENDAR  <3 

First, about me: I cosplay, make videos, do comedy, and color comic books professionally. I do monthly cosplay photo-sets, convention appearances across the country, and I always enjoy bringing you a successful yearly calendar.

 This is my 10th anniversary of cosplay and I wanted to step it up and bring you my first super sassy, super sexy, super fun, cos-lingerie calendar. I have had success with many calendars in the past, plus my smash hit book Confessions of a Cosplay DIVA, and now I bring you my pièce de résistance, 13 months of cherry picked goodness. These are some of my favorite images and I wanted to bring them to you right here. Choose your favorite cover or better yet, get them all. Don't forget to snag some exclusive prints as well as other excellent add ons such as variant cover editions of my most recent books. Thanks again for joining me and taking me home in 2021 ;)  

 Don't hesitate and get yourself the gift of me for your new year <3

Aiming for going to production asap and trying to ship next month. Stay tuned.

VARIANT COVERS Available in their own tiers and can be added on to any pledge for the price listed. 

13 MONTHS of high resolution Cos-Lingerie will keep you envigorated throughout the year and looking forward to the next month! Check out some samples below.  *final images will vary slightly

Perks

Feel free to check out some of the incredible perks that I have created for this campaign. You can also add-on some extra fun goodies! I also made sure to include a few bundle perks that I think are great deals. 

ADD ON EXCLUSIVE PRINTS Included in the following tiers: Producer, VIP, Ultimate and Deluxe. Also on Exclusive Print Tiers. Exclusive prints can be added to any pledge for $20 each. 

Powergirl was shot for this campaign in an intimate setting. Hope you enjoy!

Silver Red look for you all. A little bit of slippage happened. Rolling with it. 

 ADD ON MOUSEPAD Included in the following tiers: Producer, Ultimate and Deluxe and VIP. Also can be added to any tier for $10 each. 

  I LOVE bringing it all together so I am offering something really unique with this campaign: my two smashing success books with cos-lingerie themed BLACK LINEN COVERS. That's right, the paper itself is black pigment linen and through the magic of modern printing, a beautiful effect is acquired. The logos printed in gold color to match the calendar campaign, these will be the envy of everyone! These books can be added to any order.

 You know I do cosplay photoshoots year round and in case you missed them, here are some of my favorites from the last few months. Feel free to add them to your collection by adding $20 to your pledge per print and let me know which you selected ;)

 SONG Do You See Me re-recorded re-release! Wanted something special for you this time around and we went a little overboard but I think you will enjoy this. 

 Do You See Me becomes an EP with two more original awesome songs: Way It's Meant To Be and In Between. Also adding Why Don't You Do Right sung by me as well as a Lo-Fi version of Do You See Me.

 This Black Cat mini-print is now FREE with every calendar purchase as my special thank you to you :)

We had quite a few stretch goals that were met through the kickstarter campaign and will be distributed with orders while supplies last.

While your order can be fulfilled with the information provided through IGG, you will have the opportunity to snag some sweet swag through the Crowd Ox survey.

story:
7/1/2013

About the Crossing The Arctic Circle (and me) :

I am Thomas Moon – a professional landscape photographer, avid explorer, and newly “ex-corporate” wilderness lover. After over a year of planning and overcoming a bit of fear, I took the leap last week to follow a new path and pursue my passion for landscape photography. Since this passion took hold in 2008, I have traveled over 200,000 miles exploring distant places around North America. Photographing nature and being in the wild has always excited me and I love sharing distant places with others. I am working hard to transition my career into photography with this first project and together we will be helping wilderness conservation groups with a portion of the proceeds from the project. I have saved up some money to get me started, but I can’t do this without your help.

Last week, the chains from my cubicle wall were officially unshackled and I have been working feverishly since to start this project!  I would LOVE for you to come along on this journey with me so that I can share the experience with as many people as possible and help protect the environment for other nature lovers.  Five percent of all proceeds will go to the Alaska Conservation Foundation (alaskaconservation.org) and Canadian Parks and Wilderness Society (cpaws.org) to help support efforts to protect the wilderness there for future generations.

In return for your contribution, I will be sharing blog updates and digital galleries along the way, as well as other unique photo perks below. Your support will make this project a reality!

For Updates on Crossing the Arctic Circle, including a photo journal, please visit the updates tab above.

 Digital Gallery: samples

  •  16x20 Wood Panel w/ High Gloss Finish 

 

Come Along For The Adventure!

Crossing the Arctic Circle is a 45 day photo project about exploring the vast stretches of untouched wilderness in Alaska and Northwestern Canada and sharing the experience with photo enthusiasts, wanderers and daydreamers at heart. I will be shooting with a Canon Rebel and a GigapanPro to take panoramic shots. This adventure will encompass pictures from British Columbia, Yukon, and Northwest Territories in Canada, all the way above the Arctic Circle to Inuvik, NWT.

 

 

This project is the first part of a series that will also encompass many of the National Parks in Canada including Banff/Jasper National Parks and the Gaspe Peninsula in Quebec later this summer/fall.

  • This journey is extremely important to me because it represents a gigantic shift in my life - from working in Corporate America and leaving a steady pay check, to following my passion for landscape photography and sharing it with people like you. The project coincides with my 30th birthday, a self-imposed deadline I gave myself to take this leap.
  • My goal is to visit some of the more remote parks in Alaska and Yukon - by way of car, plane, ferry, and on foot. I will be traveling through Wrangell-Elias National Park, Denali National Park, Gates of the Arctic National Park, Kenai Fjords, and Kluane National Park (Canada), at a minimum. Photos from all locations will be shared in an online blog during and after the trip, as well as separate online galleries of landscape and panoramic images. Perks for larger contributions will include 8x10 and 16x20 prints on stained/sanded wood panels.
  • The trek to Wrangell Elias National Park will share scenes from the area that has one of the largest collections of 14,000 ft. peaks in North America. If this projected is fully funded, I will also be sharing photos from Katmai and Lake Clark National Parks which will involve flying above and landing somewhere in both parks.

Note: I have already completed one portion of the project in early July, traveling up the Dempster Highway in Yukon and Northwest Territories to Canada’s northernmost city, Inuvik. This was an epic journey and the most beautiful place I have been to date. (Pictures directly below) 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

The total budget for this project including incurred costs to date and money from my savings = $7,050

  • $80 US National Park Pass and $70 Canadian National Park Pass
  • $1500 from my own budget to defray some of the photo making costs
  • $500 supplies to prep for production include the following:

Plywood, canvas, stain for wood panels, resin for finish, blowtorch for removing bubbles from resin, paint brushes, industrial powered saw to cut wood to size.

Projected Expenses:

  • Gas costs for 12,000 + miles of driving  = $2,000 or more
  • Airplane and ferry costs once in Alaska = $1,200 or more

This is a low end estimate. Average costs for a 90-180 min flightseeing tour are between $400 and $800 per person and $200-300 for ferry travel per person. This expense will include flightseeing tours and stops in Katmai, Lake Clark, and summit to Mt. McKinley in Denali National Park – places that cannot be reached by car.

  • 3% Credit Card fee = $200
  • Donation of portion of proceeds to Environmental Non-Profits = $150 or more
  • 4-9% Indiegogo Fee = $270-600   ($450 avg)
  • Shipping Costs to mail photo books, wood panels, canvas prints = $300 or more (low end)
  • Professional carpentry work  spent creating perks = $500

Thank you for supporting my first project! I look forward to sharing other projects to come.

Sincerely,

Tom Moon

story:
Short Summary

  As an amateur photographer working and living in Big Bend National Park, in Texas, I was excited I found a way for me-- for us-- to use photography to help the tiny community across the newly opened border. Closed for over a decade, and still developing their ecotourism since the opening a month ago, Boquillas certainly holds some little seen beauty; here's a way to expose the beauty in a fun way, and help some good folks, as well!

 Using the thirty disposable cameras (and two waterproof ones) the people of Boquillas have been taking pictures of what they love about Boquillas, what they'd like to show the world. Using these images, I'll create a photobook--or, lacking enough usable images, postcards-- that can be sold by the people of Boquillas to benefit the community, to pay for school computers/make a community room.   Even better: we'll be able to see a Boquillas most tourists will never see! (Towards that aim, and at the suggestion of some knowing folks close to me, I'll be posting them online, along with text, and will include a preview of that as a perk!) 

 

What We Need & What You Get

  My goal is to reach a minimum of two thousand dollars; that will repay me for the cameras and pay for the processing (we'll get two prints of each, so they'll be able to keep one, plus put the images on CD to manipulate for further use). On top of that is gas/housing as I commute to Boquillas (only an hour away from where I live, in the park, plus camping fees). I'd like to hire one of the young women to translate for me, as I interview the people who took the pictures; and, finally, money for a "first run"of the product, whatever that is, photo book or postcards. 

  Of the course, the most important perk is knowing you've helped put something in the hands of the village that can help them to become sustainable...but a little something is always welcome to show thanks, and so there are some cool little perks, from a printed image from the collected photos, to a handmade bracelet, to a special "tour"of Boquillas for the most adventurous!

  Even if we don't reach the goal, the Project will move forward with my own funds: I'm too excited to stop!

 

The Impact

  My first impulse towards creating this project was solely curiosity; what was there to see? As it developed, however, I became more excited about helping the village by facilitating a product that they could then produce, themselves, and generate funds for the community. From all my contact with the people of Boquillas, I have been of the impression that they are most interested in sustainability, and have worked hard at being independent; those are qualities I personally admire and wish to support. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for taking an interest! If all you do is help spread the word, by reposting in Facebook or emailing a friend, you've made a valuable contribution. Thank you!

story:
Hello!

As many of you probably already know, I am very fortunate to be in New Zealand right now, living out my dream of becoming a professional photographer.  I’ve been here since November working with two of the top New Zealand photographers in the wedding photography business, as well as getting the chance to work with different models and modeling agencies in Auckland (all while enjoying the perfect summer and beaches of Waiheke Island). Unfortunately my camera is slowly breaking and I know that soon it's just going to give out on me all together. While here I've been able to work with some of the best cameras and gear that are on the market right now. I've seen such a change in my work while using better equipment, and I can only imagine how much I might continue to improve if given the chance to upgrade my gear! So I've decided that instead of sending my camera in to be fixed, its time to bite the bullet and completely start over with my collection of gear (as well as switch from being a Nikon girl to a Canon… GASP!).  I'm so excited to be able to use what I've learned here and continue building up my own portfolio of work when I return from New Zealand in May.

 

To view my website click the link below!

www.jennamahr.com


My senior year of high school I got the chance to work on a super fun and creative project of setting up and photographing 8 different fairytales. It was an absolute blast working on, and I've received such amazing feedback on them. In fact, one photo from the series was recently chosen to be on the Vogue Italia web site.  I've decided that over the coming summer I will continue that project and create 16-20 more stories. I'm going to open up the project to more than just fairytales because there are so many other children's stories I would love to photograph.

Here is a list of the Fairytales I have already created - To view the original set click the link below
 
http://www.jennamahr.com/f-a-i-r-y-t-a-l-e
 
Peter Pan
 
Alice In Wonderland
 
Rapunzel
 
The Princess & The Pea
 
Hansel & Gretel
 
Sleeping Beauty
 
Snow White
 
Little Red Riding Hood

 

Once I have created another set of these photographs I am going to create a book out of all 20-30 of them. It will have my photographs, along with small written snippets from each story.

Click on the link below to see some sample pages as I envision them, and click the photos to enlarge them.

http://www.jennamahr.com/book-preview

 

The bad news is, I might not have a working camera by this summer.  Photography is not the cheapest profession around, so this is where you all come in!!

I'm asking you to help me raise money towards the purchase of a new camera body, a few lenses, as well as production costs for this second installment of Childrens tales. This project really means SO MUCH to me, and I can't even begin to explain how excited I am to start using everything I've learned here to realize my vision.

 

The stories I plan to create will be taken from the following list - 

Cinderella

Beauty and the beast

The little mermaid

Aladdin

Rumpelstiltskin

Thumbelina

Jack & Jill

The Frog prince

Goldilocks & the Three Bears

Pinocchio

Robin hood

Jack and the beanstalk

The Sword in th Stone

Mary Poppins

The Jungle Book

The Wizard of Oz

Peter Peter Pumpkin Eater

Jack & Jill

There was an Old Woman Who Lived in a Shoe

Pocahontas

James & the Giant Peach

The Hunchback of Notre Dame

Atlantis

The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn

101 Dalmations

 

What your'e funding -

A new camera - A Canon 5dmark iii around $3,000 dollars

A new lens - A Canon 85mm 1.2 around $2,000

A new lens - A Canon 50mm 1.4 around $400

A new lens - A Canon 100mm 2.8 around $500

Production costs to finish up my collection of Story Photographs

 

Thank you so much for taking my fundraiser into your thoughts and considerations, but most of all thank you all for the amazing support I have received for my photography. It has inspired me to keep working hard at what I love.
story_txt:
Hello!
As many of you probably already know, I am very fortunate to be in New Zealand right now, living out my dream of becoming a professional photographer.  I’ve been here since November working with two of the top New Zealand photographers in the wedding photography business, as well as getting the chance to work with different models and modeling agencies in Auckland (all while enjoying the perfect summer and beaches of Waiheke Island). Unfortunately my camera is slowly breaking and I know that soon it's just going to give out on me all together. While here I've been able to work with some of the best cameras and gear that are on the market right now. I've seen such a change in my work while using better equipment, and I can only imagine how much I might continue to improve if given the chance to upgrade my gear! So I've decided that instead of sending my camera in to be fixed, its time to bite the bullet and completely start over with my collection of gear (as well as switch from being a Nikon girl to a Canon… GASP!).  I'm so excited to be able to use what I've learned here and continue building up my own portfolio of work when I return from New Zealand in May.
 
To view my website click the link below!
www.jennamahr.com
 My senior year of high school I got the chance to work on a super fun and creative project of setting up and photographing 8 different fairytales. It was an absolute blast working on, and I've received such amazing feedback on them. In fact, one photo from the series was recently chosen to be on the Vogue Italia web site.  I've decided that over the coming summer I will continue that project and create 16-20 more stories. I'm going to open up the project to more than just fairytales because there are so many other children's stories I would love to photograph.

Click on the link below to see some sample pages as I envision them, and click the photos to enlarge them.

The bad news is, I might not have a working camera by this summer.  Photography is not the cheapest profession around, so this is where you all come in!!

story:
SPONLI is an innovative astronomical project in which users are provided with online access to professional telescopes. There are also unique interactive materials for the study of astronomy, scale encyclopedia, news and events, database of astronomical catalogues.

Astronomy is one of the oldest sciences, whose interest in the “heated” rumors of the existence of extraterrestrial life, controversial and difficult to explain cosmic phenomena, objects, whose nature is not fully known.
In fact, the level of public awareness is unacceptably low. We want to fix it.

With your help we will get: research and development equipment for observatories and maintaining possibility.


FUNDING AND PERKS
- There are 3 months left before we launch the project, and SPONLI needs to be financed for the following purposes: 

1. Rent of the lodgment for the observatory (2000$/month)

2. Maintenance of the observatory, electricity, water, internet, security  (1500$/month)

3. Crew salaries, 3 people (3000$/month)

If we reach the goal of 78000$, or even if we collect a part of the mentioned sum, every person, who invests to help the project, will be provided with different perks, depending on the amount, you invest.


PROJECT'S COMPETITIVE ADVANTAGES

- Remote access to the telescope – this is an opportunity for all users to conduct their observations and studies.
- 6 observatories will be located in places with the best astronomical climate (locations selected based on the analysis of light pollution, conducted by French expert in this field – Brice Grassin).
- Availability of professional equipment of last generation, providing the ability to cover all space objects (from the solar system to the deep-sky objects).
- A large number of telescopes that will provide full coverage of the audience and a 24-hour operation of the project (regardless of the weather conditions).
- Having our own easy-to-use software for remote control telescopes.
- Availability of its software for search and discovery of comets, asteroids and supernovae.
7. The presence of various modifications Multiplatform “Client” for all user groups (educational institutions, research organizations, research centers, amateur astronomers, professionals and people that are not related to astronomy).
8. Multi-website and software.
9. The project will combine: *A database of astronomical objects, *Blogging platform for users, *Social Network,  *Sharing,  *Educational materials,  *News Resources, *Photo gallery of works of users, *The resource to store raw data.
Our Strengths: 
  • Unmet demand in the market 
  • Lack of competition 
  • The original concept of open access in three languages (English, Russian and Spanish)

RISKS & CHALLENGES: 

At the moment the project is under the danger, because the financing was stopped a few months ago. There is, therefore, a menace of losing the lodgment of the observatory. Anyway we're going to continue developing the project, as the future demands more and more Cosmos discoveries. 


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP: 

We'll be grateful for any help, if you are a web-designer, developer, astronomer or if you could consider helping the SPONLI project in any possible way. 


Meanwhile, watch our online translations here https://en.sponli.com/lx200-121/

story:
*FOR ENGLISH SEE BELOW

*TÜRKÇE İÇİN AŞAĞIYA BAKIN

PÊŞNÛMAYA ROBOSKIYÊ YA BI WÊNEYÊN CIWAN Û ZAROKAN

 Di 28 ê berfenbara 2011 an de,li rojhilatê Tirkiyeyê li gundê Roboskiyê ku girêdayî Şirnexê ye,mirovên ku bazirganiya xwe li ser tixûban dikir,19 ji wan zarok 34 kes ji aliyê hêzên leşkeriya Tirkiyeyê ve bi bombebaranê hatin kuştin. Em, wênekêşên dildar piştê komkujiyê li gundê Roboskiyê bi 60 ciwan û zarokên ku temenên wan di navbera 7 û 17an de ne, di nava 6 mehan de me kargeheke wêneyan afirand. Ji Stenbol, Amed û Wanê nêzî 25 wênekêşên dildar tev li kargeha me ya wêneyan bû. Ciwan û zarokan çîrokên ku nivîsîne bi wêne kirin û bi wana şahidiya jiyana piştî komkujiyê ya li Roboskiyê kir. Digel bi hezaran wêneyên ku kişandibûn,ji hêla zarokan ve antolojiya çîrokan bi alikariya rêveberiya wênekêşên kargehê hat amadekirin.

Çi ji me? Çi ji we?

Me ew kargeha wênekêşên ciwan û zarokan bi awayekî hevkarî(îmece) da destpêkirin û bi alîkariya hin mirovên hestiyar pêk anî. Hin ji wan mirovan makîneya wêneyî ji me re şand, hin ji wan jî di çûnehatan da alîkarî dan.Niha jî armanca me parvekirina bi raya giştî re ya li gellek bajaran ya wan 43 heb çîrok û 600 heb wêneyên ku ji hêla 60 ciwan û zarokî ve hatine nivîsîn û kişandin,e.Em ê van xebatan wek pirtûkek bi sê zimanan ( Kurmancî, Îngilizî û Turkî) 4000 hebî çap bikin û em ê çîrok û hevpeyvînên ku me bi zarokan re kirine wek dvd bi pirtûkê re bidin. Bingeha kar û xebatên vê kargeha me dildarî ye û pêdiviya me bi alîkariyên we heye.

Bandora alîkariyên we dê çi bibe ?

 Bi xêra alîkariyên we yên ku ji bo xebatên me,em ê dvd û pirtûkê çap bikin. Herwiha bi wan makînayên wêneyî yên ku bi alîkariya we dê bên kirrîn,ciwan û zarok dê bikarin bi wan makîneyan wêneyan bikşînin û pêşnûmayên xwe pêk bînin.Çawa ku me ew kargeh bi alîkariyên wek îmece pêk anî , dê bi alîkarî û tevkariyên we,em ê vê xebatê biqedînin û ji bo careke din li Roboskiyê komkujî pêk neyê em ê ji dengên wan re bibin deng.

Ji bilî vana hûn çawa dikarin alîkariya wan bikin ?

 Ku derfetên we ji aliyê bûjenî ve tune bin ku hûn alîkariyê bikin,ji bo ku ev helmeta me pirrtir bigihîje mirovan hûn dikarin ji der û dora xwe re bibêjin û malpera me pêşniyar bikin,an jî hûn dikarin bi me re bikevin têkiliyê û ji dengê me re bibin deng.

Semra Yeşil – semrayesil@gmail.com +90536 636 69 08

Selim Yıldız- selimolawo@gmail.com +90545 432 22 21

Mala we ava. 



------------------


GENÇLERİN ve ÇOCUKLARIN FOTOĞRAFLARI ile ROBOSKÎ PROJESİ

Türkiye’nin en doğusunda Şırnak’a bağlı Roboskî köyünde 28 Aralık 2011 tarihinde sınır ticareti yapan 19’u çocuk 34 insanımız; Türk Silahlı Kuvvetleri tarafından hava saldırısı sonucu katledildi. Katliamdan sonra biz gönüllü fotoğrafçılar olarak Roboskî’de yaşları 7 ile 17 arasında değişen 60 genç ve çocukla 6 ay boyunca fotoğraf atölyesi yaptık. İstanbul, Diyarbakır ve Van’dan 25’e yakın gönüllü fotoğrafçı atölyeye katıldı. Gençler ve çocuklar kendi yazdıkları hikayeleri fotoğraflayarak katliam sonrası Roboskî’de yaşama tanıklık ettiler. Çektikleri binlerce fotoğraf içinden atölyeyi yürüten fotoğrafçıların da desteğiyle çocuklar tarafından hikaye seçkileri yapıldı.

Bize? Size?

Fotoğrafçı gençler ve çocuklar atölyesini tamamen imece usulü ile başlattık, bu konuya duyarlı insanların küçük katkılarıyla bitirdik. Kimi fotoğraf makinası gönderdi, kimi ulaşımlarımızı karşıladı. Şimdi ise; 60 genç ve çocuğun yazdığı 43 hikaye ve çektikleri 600 fotoğrafı birçok şehirde sergilerle kamuoyu ile paylaşmayı hedefliyoruz. Aynı içeriğe sahip üç dilli bir kitabın (Kürtçe, Türkçe, İngilizce) 4000 adet basımı yapılacak ve 60 çocuğun kendi hikayelerini anlattıkları mini - röportajların olduğu film dvd’si kitap içerisinde yer alacaktır. Gönüllülük temelinde yürüttüğümüz atölye çalışmasının sonuca ulaşması için yardımlarınıza ihtiyaç duymaktayız.

Desteğinizin etkisi ne olacak?

 Çalışmaya vereceğiniz desteklerinizle; dvd içeren kitap basımı gerçekleşmiş olacak. Ayrıca; alacağımız fotoğraf makinalarıyla gençlerin ve çocukların bundan sonra çekecekleri fotoğraflarla yapacakları projeler için bir katkı yapmış olacaksınız. Nasıl ki atölyeyi imece yardımlarla tamamlamış isek, yapacağınız katkılar ile bu çalışmayı bitirmiş olacağız ve Roboskî’de yaşananların bir daha yaşanmamasına ses vermiş olacaksınız.

Bunun dışında nasıl yardımcı olabilirsiniz?

Eğer maddi olarak destek olma imkanınız yoksa, bu kampanyanın daha fazla kişiye ulaşması için; çevrenizdekilere duyurabilir, sitenin linkini gönderebilirsiniz. Daha fazla bilgi almak için bizimle iletişime geçebilirsiniz.

Semra Yeşil – semrayesil@gmail.com +90536 636 69 08

Selim Yıldız- selimolawo@gmail.com +90545 432 22 21

Çok teşekkürler ederiz.


------------------



ROBOSKÎ PROJECT WITH PHOTOS OF YOUNGSTERS AND KIDS

In the easternmost of Turkey, in Roboskî, a village of Şırnak, 34 citizens of ours, 19 of whom are kids and who do border trade were murdered by Turkish Armed Forces as a consequence of an airstrike on 28th December 2011. After the massacre we, volunteer photographer, did a photographer’s workshop with 60 youngsters and kids of whom the ages are between 07 and 17 for 6 months in Roboskî. Almost 25 volunteer photographers who came from Istanbul, Diyarbakır and Van attended the workshop.

Youngsters and kids witnessed the life in Roboskî after the massacre by photographing the stories they wrote themselves. Anthologies of stories are created within thousands of photos they took by youngsters and kids themselves with support of photographers who carried out the workshop.

TO US? TO YOU?

We started workshop for photographer youngsters and kids completely as a collective work and finished with little contributions of people who are sensitive to this issue. Some sent cameras, while some paid for our transportation.

Now we are aiming at sharing 43 stories written and 600 photos taken by 60 youngsters and kids with public opinion in many cities and exhibitions. 4000 press of a multilingual book (in Kurdish, Turkish and English) with the same content will be printed and a DVD film in which short interviews with 60 children that they tell their stories will be included in the book. We need for your support in order to complete this workshop that we held based on voluntariness successfully. 

What will be the reflection of your support?

With the support you give for this Project, printing of the book including DVD would be achieved. Additionally, you will be contributing for the projects of children which they would carry out with their photographs in the future. We will complete this Project with the help of your contributions you will make just as we end the Project with collective and voluntary work. YOU WILL BE A VOICE AGAINST THE RECURRENCE OF WHAT WAS ENCOUNTERED IN ROBOSKÎ!

Apart from these, how can you help us?

If you cannot give financial support, you may let your acquaintances know about the Project and send the link of this website to whom around you in order to help us to announce this campaign to more people. You can contact us for detailed information.

Semra Yeşil – semrayesil@gmail.com +90536 636 69 08

Selim Yıldız- selimolawo@gmail.com +90545 432 22 21


We present you our heartfelt thanks.
