ulaşması için yardımlarınıza ihtiyaç duymaktayız.
Desteğinizin etkisi ne olacak?
 Çalışmaya vereceğiniz desteklerinizle; dvd
içeren kitap basımı gerçekleşmiş olacak. Ayrıca; alacağımız fotoğraf
makinalarıyla gençlerin ve çocukların bundan sonra çekecekleri fotoğraflarla
yapacakları projeler için bir katkı yapmış olacaksınız. Nasıl ki atölyeyi imece
yardımlarla tamamlamış isek, yapacağınız katkılar ile bu çalışmayı bitirmiş
olacağız ve Roboskî’de yaşananların bir daha yaşanmamasına ses vermiş
olacaksınız. 
Bunun dışında nasıl yardımcı olabilirsiniz? 
Eğer
maddi olarak destek olma imkanınız yoksa, bu kampanyanın daha fazla kişiye
ulaşması için; çevrenizdekilere duyurabilir, sitenin linkini gönderebilirsiniz.
Daha fazla bilgi almak için bizimle iletişime geçebilirsiniz. 
Semra
Yeşil – semrayesil@gmail.com +90536 636 69 08
Selim
Yıldız- selimolawo@gmail.com +90545 432 22 21
Çok
teşekkürler ederiz.
------------------


ROBOSKÎ PROJECT WITH PHOTOS OF YOUNGSTERS AND KIDS
In the easternmost of
Turkey, in Roboskî, a village of Şırnak, 34 citizens of ours, 19 of whom are
kids and who do border trade were murdered by Turkish Armed Forces as a
consequence of an airstrike on 28th December 2011. After the
massacre we, volunteer photographer, did a photographer’s workshop with 60
youngsters and kids of whom the ages are between 07 and 17 for 6 months in
Roboskî. Almost 25 volunteer photographers who came from Istanbul, Diyarbakır
and Van attended the workshop. 
Youngsters and kids
witnessed the life in Roboskî after the massacre by photographing the stories
they wrote themselves. Anthologies of stories are created within thousands of
photos they took by youngsters and kids themselves with support of
photographers who carried out the workshop. 
TO US? TO YOU?
We
started workshop for photographer youngsters and kids completely as a
collective work and finished with little contributions of people who are
sensitive to this issue. Some sent cameras, while some paid for our
transportation. 
Now
we are aiming at sharing 43 stories written and 600 photos taken by 60
youngsters and kids with public opinion in many cities and exhibitions. 4000
press of a multilingual book (in Kurdish, Turkish and English) with the same
content will be printed and a DVD film in which short interviews with 60
children that they tell their stories will be included in the book. We need for
your support in order to complete this workshop that we held based on
voluntariness successfully. 
What will be the
reflection of your support?
With
the support you give for this Project, printing of the book including DVD would
be achieved. Additionally, you will be contributing for the projects of
children which they would carry out with their photographs in the future. We
will complete this Project with the help of your contributions you will make
just as we end the Project with collective and voluntary work. YOU WILL BE A VOICE AGAINST THE
RECURRENCE OF WHAT WAS ENCOUNTERED IN ROBOSKÎ!
Apart from these, how can you help us?
If you cannot give financial
support, you may let your acquaintances know about the Project and send the
link of this website to whom around you in order to help us to announce this
campaign to more people. You can contact us for detailed information. 

Semra Yeşil – semrayesil@gmail.com +90536 636 69 08
Selim Yıldız- selimolawo@gmail.com +90545 432 22 21

We present you our heartfelt
thanks.

story:
A Little Info

Hey there! I'm Naomi Figueroa, a wife, photographer, youth leader, traveler, follower of Christ, and lover of Latin America. I grew up in Maine, live in Pennsylvania, and love traveling to Central America whenever I can. 

I'm so excited about this awesome opportunity that I have! I've been looking for ways to serve others and make an impact using my photography skills. This October (20th-27th), I’ll be heading to Guatemala for a week to do humanitarian photography work for CasaSito, a non-profit organization whose mission is to increase educational opportunities in rural areas so that those living in poverty can attend school and obtain skills they need to improve their lives.

What Difference Will It Make?

I’ve had the chance to visit Guatemala 3 times and have been to various parts of the country. It is such a beautiful and unique country with one of the highest indigenous populations in Central America. While I’ve been struck by its unique beauty, I’ve also met some really beautiful people who lack access to clean water, health care, and education. According to the CIA World Factbook, “More than half of the population is below the national poverty line…poverty among indigenous groups, which make up 38% of the population, averages 73%.” In addition, the literacy rate among adults is only about 70%. 

 

I can write all these things, but what connects us is knowing individuals, not statistics.

I believe that photographs that tell a story can have an impact that reaches deep into a person’s heart. Images capture more than just a visual representation of a person or place; they give the viewer a sense of what it feels like to experience that moment or know that individual. Photographs are an integral part of communicating the needs of a non-profit and encouraging supporters to take part in their mission. My vision in working with CasaSito is to connect potential supporters to the impact of their work by communicating stories of hope and transformation through genuine, compelling photographs.

Your support of this project can continue multiplying as CasaSito uses the images to tell stories on their website, newsletters, and other communications and to connect people from around the globe to the impact of their work. In other words, through your support and my partnership with CasaSito, we’ll be helping to provide education for many children who need it.

What I Need & How You Can Help

In order for me to be able to go and serve, I need your help! I know that not everyone is able to GO, and not everyone is able to GIVE. However, if you are someone who has the means to give towards my trip and/or equipment costs, however large or small, it would mean so much to me to be given the chance to go.

If you would like to give towards equipment costs, you can donate online RIGHT HERE on IndieGoGo! (Be sure to check out my facebook page if you want details on giving towards my travel costs). 

If I don’t raise all of these funds, I will still be able to go and do some great work. However, the following items are things that will make my work much easier, safer (being able to backup files while I’m there), and will be used for many future trips as well.

  • $1000--point and shoot cameras to be donated to the schools I'll be teaching workshops at
  • $400-700—laptop and/or additional backup memory
  • $100-$150—additional memory cards
  • $120—2 backup camera batteries
  • $500—lens, travel bag, and/or miscellaneous
  • $2500 total
  • If I have additional funds come in through this campaign, I will be using it for additional gear or to fund future humanitarian trips.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that not everyone can give, but I sincerely, from the bottom of my heart, genuinely, appreciate your support in other ways:

  • I would love, love, love it if you would share this campaign with your friends, family, and social network. You know many people that I don’t know, and some of them might be in a position to help. You can easily share this page on facebook, twitter, or email by clicking one of the share buttons below the video or just copying and pasting the link.
  • Keep me in your prayers! I want to sharpen my Spanish, be able to connect and build relationships and trust, share God’s love through my love for others, and stay safe!

Thank you so much for taking the time to read all this info! Your support and encouragement means so much, and I'm so excited to have the blessing and honor of being able to go and serve using my unique gifts!

story:
Short Summary

This book is a collection of portraits and interviews from my time spent volunteering in Puerto Rico with several micro-NGOs.  It is an important representation of this story and my way of offering my talent for photography to a good cause.  Buying this book makes you a part of the recovery effort in Puerto Rico, since I intend to put the profit toward charity. 

In September, after I saw the devastation of Hurricane Maria in Puerto Rico, and especially with the awful political/cultural rhetoric being thrown around, I felt I had to do something meaningful, so I began to visit and interview Puerto Ricans on the mainland and aid workers for churches, private citizens, and micro-NGOs, such as Human Rights Festival, Inc.  From there I was given the opportunity to actually go to the island and assist as a volunteer on sustainable water projects while continuing my documentary project.  So far I have taken two trips in the last two months and fully intend to continue visiting P.R. to shoot as the situation progresses.  My intent is to raise awareness and continuing support from the public on the mainland by exposing the conditions that many Puerto Ricans are STILL living in, without electricity, running water, and in the more central parts of the island, basic services.  I also hope to raise money to donate to the groups that I have worked with personally since I really believe in the work that they are doing on the island.  I intend to return to Puerto Rico throughout the next six months to keep shooting.

I have been a photographer for over twenty years, with a B.F.A. in photography from Maine College of Art, and an M.A. in photography from Barry University.  Part of my studies have included documentary and the concept of the documentary has always been a thread in my work as an artist.  I have also spent a lot of time in the tropics, including Puerto Rico, and really love the Caribbean. 

What We Need & What You Get

Between selling editions of the book and prints I hope to raise a substantial amount of money to give to charity.  Since I have pledged to give profits to charity, I will be keeping an excel spreadsheet of everything I sell, the costs and profit, and anyone who contributes to this campaign has a right to request to see my accounting and where the donations went.  

The Impact

This book will not only help more people to understand what has happened in Puerto Rico, but to raise some money for aid workers who are working hard to help those in need.  On my own trips to Puerto Rico with these aid groups, I witnessed first hand their dedication to the tasks at hand.  We installed water filtration systems for whole communities, bought people new beds, shoes and food, and provided generators to those with medical conditions.  Even being present in Puerto Rico is important as an aid worker, as it gives people hope for better future, for improvement and the knowledge that there are people out there that care.

Risks & Challenges

As an artist, I face the challenge of formatting the book to my satisfaction.  I hope that when you receive your book you are satisfied with your purchase. There is no real risk since the photos have already been made.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share my project, at least to raise more awareness. If anyone would like to volunteer to copy edit the text of this book, the extra eye would be appreciated.

story:
Updates! A sneak preview of the layout!


About

Horticultured Cities is a book about urban and community gardens by a Helsinki based photographer Maija Astikainen and Beirut based writer and researcher Aischa Berg. It provides a broad overview of the gardens with over 50 photos from at least 17 urban gardens in London, Helsinki, Madrid and Berlin. Besides the photos, there will be an essay about community gardens by Aischa, who has done research on London's community gardens. The book is beautifully designed by graphic designer Rebekka Gröhn.

About us

We got to know each other when studying in Madrid 2010 and found out that we both share a passion for gardening, specially urban gardening. Maija had already started her community garden photography project then, and Aischa was working with research on the gardens. We decided that we should make a book together.

After Madrid, we met again in London and Berlin to visit community gardens and collect material for the book. We visited numerous gardens, met beautiful people and found out about the benefits and social impact of the gardens.

Besides own projects, Maija works as a freelance photographer in Helsinki and does assignments for various magazines and companies. Aischa has worked in different fields of art and culture and is currently occupied by a design company in Beirut.

The gardens & the book

Community gardens have many benefits. They serve as a place to grow vegetables and flowers and provide a green space in the heart of the city. They function as a living room-like space with no entrance fee, and organize also a lot of gardening courses, happenings and parties. The gardens have also a social aspect. Everyone is welcome, and things are often done together. Many of the people who'd not otherwise have met will meet. 

The purpose of this book is to make urban gardening more known to a broader public and promote the activities and benefits of community gardens. It's also a beautiful high quality coffee table photo book.

The book includes photos of various types of gardens from a flowery paradise in the middle of urban London to the container gardens of Tempelhof airport in Berlin and plantations in the yard of a market hall in Madrid.

The perks

The book will be about 21x27 cm, hardcover, 120 pages and printed on high quality Munken or similar paper.  It includes over 50 photographs of the gardens, both landscapes and portraits of the people that we met in the gardens. You can see some of them in the video above and in the gallery. 

Besides the book, the perks include high quality prints of 3 of the photos. They are printed on Canson Rag Photographique 310g museum longevity grade photo paper. The size is A4. See the gallery for examples.

If you choose the option "Book and Print", we will e-mail you after the campaign and ask which print do you want to have.

With the money, we are able to

  • finish the design
  • print the book
  • make the photo prints
  • cover IndieGoGo and PayPal expenses
  • send the items to you in international mail (as shipping is included in all the perks)

Other ways you can help

Every bit helps! Even if you wouldn't want to get one of the perks, please like and share our campaign in Facebook at www.facebook.com/horticulturedcities

If you have a blog or would otherwise like to promote the campaign, we'll be more than happy to send you some material. Please e-mail maija.astikainen@gmail.com

We've been working on the project now for several years and really want to materialize it. Now we need your help to make it happen!

Maija & Aischa

story:
The plan...

I'm an amateur nature photographer with too many dreams and too little money!

Last fall I went to the Pacific Northwest and had a blast - this spring the destination is California. More specifically I plan to hit the big spots such as Joshua Tree, Death Valley and Mono Lake.

By helping me fund the trip you will contribute to my further development as a photographer, bringing me one stop closer to my ultimate dream of one day being able to live off my hobby. And you even get one or more beautiful prints sent directly to your home after the trip!

A few pictures from my latest adventure:

Below are a few examples of my work from the Pacific Northwest trip. You can expect the pictures to be of at least the same quality - but of course the goal is also to try out new things and experiment!


What will all this cost?

$1000 will pay for a flight ticket from Copenhagen to Los Angeles and a small car for two weeks. That's it. 

Obviously this won't cover all my expenses and any extra funding will be used towards gas, motels, campgrounds, food etc.

In the unfortunate event that I don't meet my goal of $1000, the money will still go towards paying for travel expenses.

Other Ways You Can Help

It's completely OK if you are not able to contribute with funding - just share my campaign with all of your friends, colleagues - even your mom! Who knows - maybe you know someone who is able to help!

story:
Short Summary

  • Hello, my name is Star Montana and I am a photo-based artist from Boyle Heights, California. I have been working on my Masters of Fine Art at USC for the past two years, which has been an emotional rollercoaster. I am the first person in my family to graduate from college and I will be the first in my family to get a Masters degree.
  • For the completion of my Masters of Fine Art (MFA), I am required to create an MFA solo exhibition, in which I create a whole new body of work that has required me to put in many hours for the last two years to conceptualize this new exhibition.
  • In order to fully execute the exhibition, I realize I would need to seek out the help of my community for more funding than I have. I have dedicated myself mostly to my education these last two years and slowed down my freelance career.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I am creating a photo exhibition that has installation throughout it so I will need to frame many of my images. Right now my framer estimate's a minimum $2,000 for my frames. I will need atleast $1000 for photo printing and $500 for material to build part of my installation (that is a surprise). 
  • I will be adding different Perks for Donations that are above $10 asap.

The Impact

  • I really believe in this exhibition and I am so proud of myself for making it this far through my education, the hardest part now is finishing my exhibition and getting the funding to achieve this goal.

Risks & Challenges

  • It's always super hard to create a campaign for me because I am a prideful person that feels she's can do it alone but realistically, I cannot fund this exhibition alone. I am a struggling student/artist/human. I have so much love from my family but we are poor and as much as they would love to help me right now, they cannot help me financially at all. I am super grateful I have a large network that has helped me in the past and I hope can help me this time. 
  • My biggest risk and challenge is that if I cannot get funded, my exhibition will be low quality and not be up to my standard. I have worked so hard for the past two years in Graduate school to get here at the finish line and now that I am here I want to finish with an amazing exhibition that I have dreamed of for years. The most beautiful part is I will be finishing my Master's Degree in Los Angeles so many of you can come to see and witness my show first hand in person, which wasn't possible during my first graduation in New York.

If you have a little money help my MFA dream come true with a contribution.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, No worries. There have been many times I wanted to help and I can't. Sharing is one way you can Help!

If You can Contribute, the smallest amount helps, seriously!

Regardless Join me for my Exhibition on May 23, 2019.

You can also Venmo me (Star Montana) or Paypal

https://venmo.com/StarMontana

paypal.me/starmontana

I am a struggling student/artist/human. I have so much love from my family but we are poor and as much as they would love to help me right now, they cannot help me financially at all. I am super grateful I have a large network that has helped me in the past and I hope can help me this time. 
My biggest risk and challenge is that if I cannot get funded, my exhibition will be low quality and not be up to my standard. I have worked so hard for the past two years in Graduate school to get here at the finish line and now that I am here I want to finish with an amazing exhibition that I have dreamed of for years. The most beautiful part is I will be finishing my Master's Degree in Los Angeles so many of you can come to see and witness my show first hand in person, which wasn't possible during my first graduation in New York.

If you have a little money help my MFA dream come true with a contribution.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute, No worries. There have been many times I wanted to help and I can't. Sharing is one way you can Help!
If You can Contribute, the smallest amount helps, seriously!
Regardless Join me for my Exhibition on May 23, 2019.
You can also Venmo me (Star Montana) or Paypal
https://venmo.com/StarMontana
paypal.me/starmontana

story:
Short Summary

My name is Amira Abusrour, I'm a Palestinian refugee living in Palestine, I'm 26 years old and I have a BA from Birzeit university in business administration. I work in Alrowwad Cultural and Theater Society (ACTS) which was established in 1998 in Aida refugees camp-Bethlehem, Palestine, as a project coordinator.

www.alrowwad.org

In ACTS we work with Palestinian children, youth and women. We have five units one of which is Images for life (IFL) - the media unit.

IFL is a great unit representing a backbone activity in ACTS which started in 2001. It provides training in photography and video for children and youth, and produces photos and films that are shown and exposed locally and internationally. This unit includes training courses as well as a diploma training certified by the Palestinian Ministry of Media.

 ACTS has partnered, among others, with the French Consulate in East Jerusalem, the Hoping Foundation, the Holy See and UNRWA, The Netherlands Representative Office, ArtVenture (ArtAction) and Ashoka. In addition, ACTS was the first to start

- Annual outdoor film festival in Palestine since 2005, with screening on the Wall of separation surrounding Aida camp,

- Moving movies with cinema screening tours in the Occupied West Bank refugee camps and villages since 2007.

- A monthly and weekly Film screening in Alrowwad.

At  ACTS we believe that media is a powerful communication channel to tell the people the truth, that's why in Images For Life,  we give the Palestinian people the chance to be behind the cameras telling their own story instead of being always in front of it and others telling the story according to what they feel or see, in IFL we give the human being the chance to express oneself and to show one’s life, frustrations but also hopes and dreams.

Why I need your help?!!

At ACTS we offer most of our services and trainings for free for the people in Aida refugee camp, and this is the case for IFL courses, we have a new group of student from the UNRWA school in Aida camp, who are participating in a training in photography. We have the cameras and the trainer and the place but what we miss is the money to make a photo exhibition for the kids' work at the end of the training, since most of the children feel disappointed when they finish the training without having a ceremony with a photo exhibition to show their good work to their friends, families and for everyone. We sometime have a funded photography courses but not within the last three years, and that's why we stopped making the photo exhibitions because of lack of funding.

I believe that these talented kids have a lot to give and they are really great. 

You can see a lot of the photos taken by our students here: 

http://www.alrowwad.org/index.php/photo

https://picasaweb.google.com/imagesforlife/FinalExhibitionUsImagesForLifeAlRowwadCenter?authkey=Gv1sRgCKbSqvbZz-DS2QE&feat=directlink#

http://www.alrowwad.org/index.php/photo

  I'm doing this to create a chance for the Palestinian refugee kids in Aida camp and surrounding areas to help them go over all the ugliness of violence by the Israeli occupation incursions in a place that lack playground or green spaces or entertainments facilities, to help those kids show their beauty, express themselves and be the first strong step towards changing the stereotyped images about Palestinians and Palestine.

Be our partner in drawing a smile of pride and dignity on the faces of our talented young children.  

 Be a Change maker and help us in continuing to create a change in the world.

What We Need & What You Get

To make this dream happen, I need at least $4000, to cover :

*The rent for the place ( a hall ) for a week , we need nearly $500.

* The cost of printing out the photographs:

- 15 photos with the size of 30*45 cm ($10/per photo)

- 40 photos with the size of 50*70 cm ($28/per photo)

- 5 photos with the size of 50*140 cm ($83/per photo)

- 20 photos with the size of 20*60 cm ($17/per photo)

A total of $2025

* The decoration materials for the photo exhibition we need nearly $250.

*The publicity and  advertisement  for the photo exhibition ( Posters, Banners, ext...) and the invitations we need nearly $1500.

* The  reception  in the opening of the exhibition we need nearly $225.


The Impact

If you decided to be part of this , you will create a chance for the Palestinian refugee kids in Aida camp and surrounding areas to help them go over all the ugliness of violence by the Israeli occupation incursions in a place that lack playground or green spaces or entertainments facilities, to help those kids show their beauty, express themselves and be the first strong step towards changing the stereotyped images about Palestinians and Palestine.

You will be a partner in drawing a smile of pride and dignity on the faces of our talented young children.  

You will be a Change maker and you will help us in continuing to create a change in the world.

Making this photo exhibition happen will help in giving those kids the opportunity to celebrate their success and to see their efforts turned into real work which is seen and noticed by everyone. This will encourage them and other kids to join the photography courses and improve their skills instead of wasting their time in doing nothing in the streets. 

 on this website you will see more of our work and you will know more about us, we are working in the field of culture and art since 1998, and we have a lot of success stories and events www.alrowwad.org


Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can’t contribute with your money, that doesn’t mean You can’t help:

You can get the word out and make some noise about this campaign, use the Indiegogo share tools and let everyone know about it, contribute with your time and help us in  transferring the efforts of these kids into real work that makes them feel proud of it. 

Everybody is a change maker, No one can say I cannot do anything, everybody can do something!

story:
About Stolen Dream:

During 2014, Venezuela plunged into a series of constant protests because of the discontent against the government, resulting in a political crisis, street fighting, wounded, prisoners, political prisoners and deceased.

At that time, I discovered two great personal realities: my passion for photojournalism and how painful it is to lose a friend, my camera.

As a student of Social Communication and audiovisual producer, I decided to play the role of a photojournalist, being a broadcast support for Venezuelan society about the lack of coverage by the national media controlled by the government.  For four months I suffered tear gas aggressions, blows, shoves, insults and threats, but in the end I was satisfied to achieve my goals, do what I love; inform my community and take photos.

Unfortunately, on April 12, 2014 while working as a photojournalist, I was unjustly detained and stripped off my audiovisual equipment by the military forces of the Venezuelan government -> Canon 60d + Canon EF-S 17-55mm f/2.8 IS USM Lens + Accessories

For a long year, with the support of my family, I decided to get my audiovisual equipment through the legal channels. Failing in the attempt, it came the necessity for doing campaign.

Through Stolen Drem, I will return to do my role as a photojournalist, seeking to let people know the situation Venezuela lived last years protest through my camera lens; being this campaign a reference of my abilities as a social communicator.

I'm not the only Venezuelan who has been through a similar situation, but I'm one of the few that makes his misfortune an opportunity.


    

 Canon 60d + Canon EF-S 17-55mm f/2.8 IS USM Lens + Accessories.


-

I invite you to follow us on our social networks @StolenDreamVe

www.Instagram.com/StolenDreamVe

www.Facebook.com/StolenDreamVe

www.Twitter.com/StolenDreamVe


Sobre Stolen Dream:

Durante el 2014, Venezuela se sumergió en una serie de constantes protestas debido al descontento contra el Gobierno. Como consecuencia: crisis, enfrentamientos, heridos, detenidos, presos políticos y fallecidos.

En aquel momento descubrí dos grandes realidades personales: mi pasión por el fotoperiodismo y lo doloroso que es perder una compañera, una cámara. 


Como estudiante de Comunicación Social y Realizador Audiovisual, decidí ejercer el rol de fotoperiodista, siendo un apoyo de difusión para la sociedad venezolana ante la falta de cobertura por los medios nacionales. Durante cuatro meses, sufrí del humo lacrimógeno, recibí golpes leves, empujones, insultos y amenazas, pero al final quedando satisfecho por lograr mis objetivos, hacer lo que amo; informar a mi entorno y tomar fotografías.

Lamentablemente el 12 de abril  del 2014 mientras ejercía el rol de fotoperiodista, fui injustamente privado de libertad y despojado de mis equipos audiovisuales por las fuerzas de seguridad del Gobierno venezolano. -> Canon 60d + Canon EF-S 17-55mm f/2.8 IS USM Lens + Accesorios. 



Durante un largo año, con el apoyo incondicional de mi familia, decidí recuperar mis equipos audiovisuales por la vía legal. Fracasando en el intento, nace la necesidad de crear esta campaña. A través de Stolen Drem, retomaré mi rol como fotoperiodista, buscando dar a conocer la realidad que vivió Venezuela durante las protestas del 2014 a través de mi lente fotográfico; siendo la campaña una referencia de mis capacidades como comunicador social.

No soy el único venezolano que ha pasado por una situación similar, pero soy uno de los pocos que hace de su infortunio una oportunidad.


     

 Canon 60d + Canon EF-S 17-55mm f/2.8 IS USM Lens + Accesorios.

   

-

Los invito a seguirnos a través de nuestras redes sociales @StolenDreamVe

www.Instagram.com/StolenDreamVe

www.Facebook.com/StolenDreamVe

www.Twitter.com/StolenDreamVe

story:
Dragster Photography Aim for 2015 


Video.

Each event will have a 15 to 25 minute video clip including a flycam ride through all areas, start line action, pit lanes, boxes, atmosphere, crowd, event highlights and standings. These clips can be expected days after each event.

At the end of the season there will also be an All Events Documentary covering the season from start to finish, with backstage and season highlights. expected 90min.

Photography.

Each team will have their very own gallery featuring all of their images throughout the season at each of the events. So each teams gallery will grow as the season moves on. Team on my "To Watch List" are edited and uploaded first.

Why pledge you when I edit and publish for free?

There are 2 reasons....the first is the size.

        640px - 70% quality - large logo VS  6000px - 100% quality - small logo

 

The second is that there will simply be no more images created as its impossible for me to carry on without some sort of funding

2015 calendars will be sent during and immediately after campaign ending

  

Small Pledges Make Big Things Happen!

Choosing a Pledge will also get you perks in return. All perks have calendars and passwords to thousands of full size posters. These are good as full size prints (1,5m orig) for your garages or as gifts for team members.



Here are some samples of images from 2014 where I covered my first three races. Bechyne - Hoskovice - Hockenheimring (There are currently 208 individual galleries from three races plus a further 100+ teams still in sorting and editing)

The Beauty of Raw Files

The advantage of a RAW or NEF  Format Image over Jpeg is that it contains a lot more information. The disadvantage is that a RAW file ranges in the 25-30mb per image! A full event can easily amount to over 20-40 gigabytes of RAW images. Add to that video, several export formats plus back ups.....memory rapidly doubles up.

A RAW file is always recoverable, it is adjustable to many extents and can be modified to take on a number of different looks and styles. Raw files allow the images to be manipulated in many different ways and is generally the preferred shooting format for photographers.

About Damian Walker

I have loved photography since I was 11 and started shooting full time in 2012 with. Since then I have shot daily, I never leave my camera behind, it s a part of me.

I have been published in the National Geographic Daily Dozen on the 23/08/2013

Born in the UK, raised in Spain, schooling in Germany and currently live in the Czech Republic. I speak 4 languages and have shot many subjects from city-scapes, landscapes, night photography, slow shutter speeds, composites, HDR, models, rock bands, events and more.

I have fell in love with the races. It involves lot travelling, dealing with many people in various languages, meeting Europe's top teams and being presented with some of the best scenes for photography that I could ever wish for.

My goals for the future is dedicate myself to photography full time, grow and expand my business into a static and mobile gallery and create a unique workflow and collection of thousands of impacting racing images.

Your contributions make this possible!

Each contribution is a huge help and really is the only way for me to make it happen. I have aimed for the minimum amount needed to attend each race, if the goal is reached a surpassed the extra pledges made will be reinvested back into the project in the form of equipment, (Drone for overheads) extra perk surprises for those who made it all possible.

There is only 30 days to make the goal to see if this method works! look at the top right of the campaign to see how many days are left, act now so you don't miss out and please share this campaign with your friends who would be interested.

Thank you all and hope to see you again very soon!

All the best

Damian Walker

story:
Life of a singularity...

... is my first photographic book. 

Through nude and erotic portraits I will show you a fictional biography of a singularity. The story of human beings, of separate singularities who try to conceal the differences that divide us.
The story is broken into three acts: Mimesis, the act of resembling and presenting the self, in which I tried to mimic normality, to conform. The Clinic, in which I was diagnosed and conditioned to fit in. And lastly, the Circus, where I discovered the potential of being a singularity. 

200 copies of the book will be printed, format 24 cm x 34 cm and it contains 120 pages of b/w photographs. All photos are reproductions of vintage gelatin-silver prints, as I only work with analog photographic equipment, as back in the old days.



The book is now in its final stages...

... but I need your help to finish this project.
I am aiming to raise 1000 € to cover part of the printing costs for the 200 copies. All the dedicated work done by the graphic designer, models, writers and all people who collaborate at the project is demanding a further effort from all of you.
Even though the work of all the people involved was volunteering, I still have to cover the printing and production cost of 2600 €. 
You can find information about my work and this project on my website
www.yashimamishto.com
Please feel free to contact me with any remaining questions via
net@yashimamishto.com


No funds available but you like my project?

Please help me and spread the word! I would be grateful for any promotion and advertisement via social media, forums, blogs and other websites.
My website: www.yashimamishto.com



Collaborators

Lulù Bramante, Sara Sperling, Anita Blond, Christine, Jule Pasolini, Angela Barretta, Eleonora Manto, Marta Mantovani, Ira von Vampira, Laetitia, M+N+O, Mia Toshie, Natalie Robertson, Manuela Morales,  Martina Altieri and all others who prefer to remain anonymous.

  • Martina Altieri:   Bondage
  • Laetitia:   Flesh sewing
  • Jule Pasolini:   Project development
  • Alessandro Lamberti-Castronuovo:   Medical consultants
  • Shauna Blackmon:   Text writing
  • Alberto Dell’Acqua:   Printing
  • Gabriella Fiore:   Graphic design and video
  • Fernando Poo - Tom Ass: music - audio


From the book...

Mimesis


The clinic 


The circus



... and many more!


Please contact me before donating, if you are interested in perks that require shipping (books, vintage prints, equipment). Shipping costs are not included, exception is the shipping cost for the book inside Germany, UK and Italy. For all other countries please contact me before donating.

... is my first photographic book. Through nude and erotic portraits I will show you a fictional biography of a singularity. The story of human beings, of separate singularities who try to conceal the differences that divide us.
The story is broken into three acts: Mimesis, the act of resembling and presenting the self, in which I tried to mimic normality, to conform. The Clinic, in which I was diagnosed and conditioned to fit in. And lastly, the Circus, where I discovered the potential of being a singularity. 
200 copies of the book will be printed, format 24 cm x 34 cm and it contains 120 pages of b/w photographs. All photos are reproductions of vintage gelatin-silver prints, as I only work with analog photographic equipment, as back in the old days.
The book is now in its final stages...... but I need your help to finish this project.I am aiming to raise 1000 € to cover part of the printing costs for the 200 copies. All the dedicated work done by the graphic designer, models, writers and all people who collaborate at the project is demanding a further effort from all of you.Even though the work of all the people involved was volunteering, I still have to cover the printing and production cost of 2600 €. You can find information about my work and this project on my websitewww.yashimamishto.comPlease feel free to contact me with any remaining questions vianet@yashimamishto.comNo funds available but you like my project?Please help me and spread the word! I would be grateful for any promotion and advertisement via social media, forums, blogs and other websites.My website: www.yashimamishto.com
CollaboratorsLulù Bramante, Sara Sperling, Anita Blond, Christine, Jule Pasolini, Angela Barretta, Eleonora Manto, Marta Mantovani, Ira von Vampira, Laetitia, M+N+O, Mia Toshie, Natalie Robertson, Manuela Morales,  Martina Altieri and all others who prefer to remain anonymous.

Martina Altieri:   Bondage
Laetitia:   Flesh sewing
Jule Pasolini:   Project development
Alessandro Lamberti-Castronuovo:   Medical consultants
Shauna Blackmon:   Text writing
Alberto Dell’Acqua:   Printing
Gabriella Fiore:   Graphic design and video
Fernando Poo - Tom Ass: music - audio





From the book...
Mimesis



The clinic 




The circus












... and many more!Please contact me before donating, if you are interested in perks that require shipping (books, vintage prints, equipment). Shipping costs are not included, exception is the shipping cost for the book inside Germany, UK and Italy. For all other countries please contact me before donating.

story:
Bio:
I was born in Kingston, Jamaica, in 1952, and arrived in London ten years later to reside with my mother. After leaving school in 1968 my first job was with Kodak where I developed a deep and passionate love for the craft of photography. In 1974 I returned to Jamaica on a short visit and by a stroke of luck was hired as second-assistant stills photographer on the movie The Marijuana Affair which was produced by Lucien Chen a wealthy Chinese-Jamaican who in 1973 promoted a world heavyweight title fight between George Foreman and Joe Frazier in Kingston. 


It was during this time in Jamaica I made close acquaintance with Bob Marley at his home, and after a year in Jamaica, I left on travels to west Africa. I crossed the Sahara Desert from Algeria into Niger, unto Burkina Faso, Ivory Coast and then into Ghana where I would live for one year. After leaving Ghana I made further travels to Togo, Benin and in January 1977,  I arrived in Lagos, Nigeria, to attend the black arts festival, FESTAC. 

During this time in Lagos I became friends with the legendary Afro-Beat King Fela Ransome Kuti and whilst spending time in his home, renegade soldiers arrived and infamously burnt the house to the ground. They brutally abused everyone including Fela's mother, Fela and myself and I would spend five months being detained by the military government on the pretext of being a CIA spy but specifically because of my friendship with Fela. 

In late 1977 I returned to Jamaica and assisted in managing Diplomat, a major photographic studio in Kingston. The following three years were dramatic in the history of Jamaica and during this period I captured a wealth of images.  I also became the unofficial house photographer at the Marley's home with the assistance of Mr Neville Garrick and Mr Colin Leslie, two of Bob Marley's closet confidantes. I worked on Survival the worlds first Rastafari newspaper published by Marley in the summer of 1980 and in September that year I left for the United States with Bob on his final tour Uprising. This though was short lived due to his illness and after his demise in 1981, I spent the following three years freelancing in New York and Los Angeles. I would also attend the West Los Angeles Community College to study media studies but did not finish the course. 


In 1985 I returned to London and began working with the Caribbean Times newspaper. I also taught photography on the Broadwater Farm Estate in Tottenham, north London, scene of an infamous and notorious civil riot. 

The next fifteen years I worked exclusively as a freelance photographer with my work being published in the Daily Mail, Time Out magazine, the Observer, The Voice, West Indian Digest and Which magazine. 

In 2012 I was asked to submit photographs which were prominently featured in the Kevin Macdonald feature documentary, MARLEY. 

In August 2013 I successfully self-published Portrait of a Legend and other Folks which represents thirty five years of work. This book probably features some of the last unpublished photographs of the legend Bob Marley and is a testament to my vision and a personal reflection of my photographic culture.

I ask for your support in what has been a long campaign and I thank you in advance.

One Love.

Lindsay Oliver Donald.


Preface:

In logic, it is accepted that an assumption is a proposition that is taken for granted as if it were true based upon presupposition without preponderance of the facts. The answers given herein will be taken therefore as logical statements that will be assumed to be true.


Executive Summary: 

POALAOF [Portrait of a Legend and other Folks] is a self publishing venture for the book Portrait of a Legend and other Folks. The book has had an initial print run and is directed at lovers of photography, Bob Marley, reggae music, Jamaican culture and other folks. POALAOF is targeting a total sale of 4,900 copies during three years. Publishing is a high profit and high margin business and the key to success will be successful marketing. Therefore, with the successful execution of this plan, sales revenue will exceed in excess of £300,000 GBP by the end of year three.


Objectives: 

  • To raise production capital of £65,000 GBP.
  • To ensure the printing of 5,000 copies. 
  • To upgrade poalaofthebookdotcom website. 
  • To market 1,500 copies in year one. 
  • To market 3,000 copies in year two.
  • To market 4,900 copies by the end of year three. 



Mission: 

Portrait of a Legend and other Folks is for the lover of portraiture, Bob Marley, Jamaican culture, reggae and music at any level. The book also has a commitment to be a platform to profile Jamaican artistry and features a variety of international musicians and iconic celebrities. The book will encourage and provide role models representing artistic and professional excellence. Income generated from the sale of 4,900 copies will exceed £300,000 GBP and will be shared with those contributing £1,000 GBP or more. 100 copies will be withdrawn to be used for promotion, book reviews and as promotional gifts to selected world leaders. I recently visited Jamaica and presented a copy each to the Jamaican National Archive and to the Bob Marley Museum in Kingston.


Start-up Summary: 

Start-up capital has been achieved and Portrait of a Legend and other Folks was successfully launched in the presence of the Jamaican High commissioner to London, Her Excellency Mrs.  Aloun Ndombet-assamba, at the Jamaican High Commission in August 2013. Capital is now required for the production of 5,000 copies and this pitch is being made to positive investors and the finance raised will enable full-scale production and marketing of 4,900 copies of Portrait of a Legend and other Folks. It can be assured that additional capital will not be required in the future.


Ownership and Location Facilities: 

As the founder of POALAOF, a sole-trader self publishing venture, I currently own ninety percent of its value and use my home as an office which is located at:

50 Burlington Gardens 

Acton 

London

W3 6BA

UK

Tel:+4407535901630 

e-mail: linkuplindsay@yahoo.co.uk 

My home/office is equipped and functional and it is not anticipated that expanded facilities will be needed for this plan. All business and management functions will be performed here. 

Management Summary: 

With printing services outsourced, I am capable and proficient in carrying out general management, editorial, artistic, sales & marketing by myself. I also have the excellent services of Ms Tammy Beveridge my researcher, Ms June Walters Aust my assistant who wrote the Foreword and Ms Patrice Hartle Arias my publicist. In addition there are Ms Tiffany Nelson, Mr Hesketh Benoit, Ms Jeri Blackburn, and Dr. Roscoe Howells, who all contributed with start-up capital.

Keys to Success: 

  1. The attainment of start-up capital which was successfully secured and implemented. 
  2. Attaining production capital.
  3. Achieving targeted sales levels.
  4. Controlling costs. 
  5. Follow-on marketing of a second title at the end of year two.
  6. Making all on-line distribution dates in a timely fashion.


Product:

POALAOF has successfully launched and published Portrait of a Legend and other Folks. The book is of high quality containing 300 pages, 240 black & white photographs, over 4,000 words transcribed from Bob Marley interviews and contemporary in look and appeal. Quality is the goal. The book is entertaining, newsworthy and thought-provoking and will appeal to a broad readership because no book like it is available on the market today. The manufacturing or printing cost was agreed between Bookbinders of London Ltd and myself. Bookbinders of London is a family-owned printing company which has been in business for over 150 years and who are still working in the same building. The company has unique abilities unmatched by many European and Far Eastern competitors and are specialist in Hardback finishing which adds impact to the perceived value of this publication. I was offered the "New Deal" and the cost per book is economically attractive. Portrait of a Legend and other Folks is a unique book and Bookbinders of London have created a beautiful printed work that will inspire.


Specifications: 

Size is 330mm x 280mm. 

Hardback bound in black Colorado. 

300 pages. 

240 black and white photographs printed on 170 gsm silk paper. 

4,200 words. 

Case binding. 

Gloss laminated Dust Jacket. 

Gold embossed cover and spine. 

End paper grey. 

Published by PoaLaoF.

Cover Price £65 GBP.

ISBN:978-0-9576518-0-7


Market Analysis Summary: 

The target market is broadly based. Once one wears a Bob Marley t-shirt, buys a Bob Marley album or has ever been to a Bob Marley concert one is an admirer and a potential purchaser for this book. Currently, there are over 37 million Bob Marley admirers on the social network site Facebook. It is therefore a rational belief based on the given law of probabilities that 4,900 copies of Portrait of a Legend and other Folks will be sold worldwide to this target market within 36 months of being printed.


Strategy and Implementation Summary: 

The strategy of POALAOF is based on serving a clearly defined niche market. I believe I can exceed industry standards for a first time self-publishing venture and after thirty-five years of photojournalism, I am committed and passionate about my work. A thirst exists for unpublished photographs featuring Bob Marley, Michael Jackson, Jesse Owens, James Brown, Ziggy Marley, John Lydon, Mike Tyson, Peter Tosh, Stevie Wonder, Ringo Starr, James Baldwin, Jimmy Cliff, Gladys Knight, Nina Simone, Lee Scratch Perry, Harry Belafonte, Lennox Lewis, Rita Marley, Muhammad Ali and other folks who all are featured in Portrait of a Legend and other Folks. The task therefore, will be to reach and inform this target market and the strategy is to build sales through the social media network channels which will maximize the potential reach of this book.


Marketing Strategy: 

A sample print run of twenty copies has been achieved with the successful marketing of fifteen copies. 

Distribution Strategy: 

Contracting with distributors can be difficult and costly because distributors buy books at a discount of the retail price which can be 40% or more. This will substantially cut into POALAOF's ability to earn income. The distribution of Portrait of a Legend and other Folks will be achieved through direct sales over the Internet from the website poalaofthebookdotcom. Sales will be billed to credit and debit cards and drop shipped.


Strategic Alliances: 

A strategic alliance based in London with Uncle Syd Basefm and his Heartoflove Internet radio station has been established. Syndicated broadcasts regarding Portrait of a Legend and other Folks are planned and this alliance holds great potential.


Promotion Strategy:

Public relations exposure will benefit Portrait of a Legend and other Folks significantly. I have already appeared on a soon to be broadcast television arts programme and have also been interviewed on four Internet radio shows. In one instance, over twenty calls were received requesting information about the book. The utilization of all social media platforms will be aggressively targeted. 


Pricing Strategy: 

Portrait of a Legend and other Folks will be sold at the cover price of £65 GBP

 Important milestones so far: 

  • Raising start-up capital and the successful launch of Portrait of a Legend and other Folks. 
  • A first print run of twenty copies with the successful marketing of fifteen copies. 
  • The presentation of copies to the Jamaican archive and also to the Bob Marley Museum in Kingston, Jamaica. 
  • The launching of Indiegogo crowd-funding campaign to raise capital for the production of 5,000 copies.

Conclusion:

The successful conclusion of this campaign will result in obtaining £65,000 GBP, the production of 5,000 copies of the book Portrait of a Legend and other Folks and reaching the sales target of £300,000 GBP at the end of year three through the website poalaofthebookdotcom. 



Please support this campaign:

story:
Short Summary

I am raising funds to hit the road with a team: a videographer, writer, producer, and photographer (me!). We will take each subject up to the highest hills and mountains near their homes, recording their stories and photographing them with a large format camera. We will keep our living expenses as low as possible.

Funds raised will cover the cost of renting an SUV, fuel, food and photographic expenses.

The stories and documentation we collect during the two month expedition will be published with the new Aperture edition of Living with the Enemy as the final and most critical part... I Am Unbeatable...as well everything will be told in stories from the road with a blogger traveling with me and the team on the road. WE will update live from the road, connecting our contributors with every mile traveled by the team, essentially bringing you on the road with us. A videographer will document the entire trip in HD, culminating in a short film to accompany the release of I Am Unbeatable. 

For thirty years I have been dedicated to educating and raising awareness about the problems of domestic violence through photography.  Other than the Library of
Congress, which recently purchased a few images, none of the  photographs from Living with the Enemy have been privately sold. Any compensation I received for editorial purposes and lectures was put back into doing more work.

In offering your support, you are helping to continue the work of a lifetime. I give you heartfelt thanks for investing in the rights and wellbeing of battered women and children. I have encountered some of the most idealistic, funny, passionate

and determined people over the years. It is difficult to fully convey the way this journey has defined and impacted me. Without question, it is one I would take again and again and again.

Inspiration

In 1991 I published the book “Living With The Enemy,” the culmination of 10 years documenting domestic violence. Since then, I have remained in touch with many of the people whose stories comprise the book. Their strength encouraged me to continue photographing, adding video to create several pieces aimed at honoring them and educating others.

Recently I met Margo, who left her abuser before irreparable damage was done to her daughters. She could not continue to raise her girls in the hell that her angry, abusive and wealthy husband created. Despite what seemed from the outside an enviable lifestyle, Margo took the most difficult and vital step -- without much money, taking her daughters,  Margo left Jack, knowing that any alternative would be better than accepting a life of abuse.

Her amazing courage has inspired me to create a body of work that captures the fulfillment many women find after leaving their oppressors and taking control of their own destinies. I want to make portraits and record more stories of people who bravely struggle to transform their reality. 

Credentials

For two decades my photographs and voice have inspired campaigns to stop domestic violence.  The photographs have improved public awareness and raised much needed funds for direct services, public policy advocacy and, the chance for a better life. I have worked with governors, senators, police chiefs, the U.S. Army, numerous foreign governments including the Czech Republic, Germany, Italy, Bolivia, Portugal, Peru, the American Medical Association, and, hundreds more grassroots groups to galvanize people across the world to take a stand against domestic violence.

In 1992 the Childcare Action group in NYC was auctioning off a tea party with Hillary Rodham Clinton. It was the month before the 42nd presidential election. I am not
a wealthy woman, but, I've been known to be able to raise funds for something that matters. In a heartbeat, I convinced every person of means to open their pockets and help me win that meeting with Hillary.    

Bringing notable leaders from the domestic violence community, I used the opportunity to talk with Hillary about what I'd witnessed and what needed to change.  What Hillary Clinton said to us back then has taken me twenty plus years to fully digest -- "while we can change laws and try to provide protection from abusers, significant change will only really occur when women themselves take responsibility to break free of their violent lives."

There. I said it. This is what it's all about.

Everyone must step up to the plate.  I believe by raising up the voices of the bravest and most inspirational examples, like Margo, we will show that life with plenty of love without abuse is possible.

For all these reasons I'm asking for your support. It's degrading to all if we choose to do nothing.

Impact

Everything I know comes from taking pictures which have helped real good people in real bad situations see the positive results of changing their lives. "I Am Unbeatable" the book project, is about the power of photography.

When the Unbeatable book is finished it will inspire a social change in the way we think and talk about domestic violence. It will encourage more decisive action. The book will feature stories and images of courageous people who jumped out of the frying pan into the cool waters of love and acceptance. There is nothing better than being loved for who you are, not the "thing" somebody else wants you to be. I believe this project will inspire a radical change in self awareness and show the way to walk like an Egyptian.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you find yourself financially incapable of supporting our cause, but still believe in it, there are other ways to help! Please, please, please, share this link and information about our project with your friends. Find stories of empowerment in lives around you and share them with us. Finally, the greatest way to help our movement without donating is to live it - protect yourself and others, love unselfishly, and help yourself and those you love with your whole heart to become unbeatable.

Recently I met Margo, who left her abuser before irreparable damage was done to her daughters. She could not continue to raise her girls in the hell that her angry, abusive and wealthy husband created. Despite what seemed from the outside an enviable lifestyle, Margo took the most difficult and vital step -- without much money, taking her daughters,  Margo left Jack, knowing that any alternative would be better than accepting a life of abuse.
Her amazing courage has inspired me to create a body of work that captures the fulfillment many women find after leaving their oppressors and taking control of their own destinies. I want to make portraits and record more stories of people who bravely struggle to transform their reality. 
Credentials
For two decades my photographs and voice have inspired campaigns to stop domestic violence.  The photographs have improved public awareness and raised much needed funds for direct services, public policy advocacy and, the chance for a better life. I have worked with governors, senators, police chiefs, the U.S. Army, numerous foreign governments including the Czech Republic, Germany, Italy, Bolivia, Portugal, Peru, the American Medical Association, and, hundreds more grassroots groups to galvanize people across the world to take a stand against domestic violence.

In 1992 the Childcare Action group in NYC was auctioning off a tea party with Hillary Rodham Clinton. It was the month before the 42nd presidential election. I am nota wealthy woman, but, I've been known to be able to raise funds for something that matters. In a heartbeat, I convinced every person of means to open their pockets and help me win that meeting with Hillary.    
Bringing notable leaders from the domestic violence community, I used the opportunity to talk with Hillary about what I'd witnessed and what needed to change.  What Hillary Clinton said to us back then has taken me twenty plus years to fully digest -- "while we can change laws and try to provide protection from abusers, significant change will only really occur when women themselves take responsibility to break free of their violent lives."


There. I said it. This is what it's all about.
Everyone must step up to the plate.  I believe by raising up the voices of the bravest and most inspirational examples, like Margo, we will show that life with plenty of love without abuse is possible.
For all these reasons I'm asking for your support. It's degrading to all if we choose to do nothing.



Impact
Everything I know comes from taking pictures which have helped real good people in real bad situations see the positive results of changing their lives. "I Am Unbeatable" the book project, is about the power of photography.

When the Unbeatable book is finished it will inspire a social change in the way we think and talk about domestic violence. It will encourage more decisive action. The book will feature stories and images of courageous people who jumped out of the frying pan into the cool waters of love and acceptance. There is nothing better than being loved for who you are, not the "thing" somebody else wants you to be. I believe this project will inspire a radical change in self awareness and show the way to walk like an Egyptian.  

Other Ways You Can Help


If you find yourself financially incapable of supporting our cause, but still believe in it, there are other ways to help! Please, please, please, share this link and information about our project with your friends. Find stories of empowerment in lives around you and share them with us. Finally, the greatest way to help our movement without donating is to live it - protect yourself and others, love unselfishly, and help yourself and those you love with your whole heart to become unbeatable.

story:
My Story

Hello, my name is David E. Kelly, and I am a sports and entertainment photographer who has been involved in a copyright violation law suit where a person(s) committed business identity theft by making a business card that said he owned my legal business name "Big League Photos." Then he scanned one of my creative works and printed over 50,000 counterfeit posters, t-shirts and other products without my consent and distributed them throughout retail vendors across the United States. I could not get law enforcement in Arizona to stop these criminals.They all seemed to pass the buck and left me alone to do their investigative work where I spent 5 years uncovering the copyright thief's paper trail and found the counterfeits being sold in over 100 vendor locations throughout the USA where they reaped millions of dollars from the sales and distribution of the Photo-Poster "Remembering September 11, 2001." (Please visit the website http://www.thestolenimage.com)


The Impact

The impact is that my equal protection rights were violated by legal authorities, as well as a violation of copyright infringement by the criminals and their enjoined associates.This incident negatively affected my career as a photographer. I had to spend a great deal of time (9 years), energy and money to track down the criminal and the vendors, while being disrespected by law enforcement agencies during this entire ordeal. My business has lost millions of profits that were earned from the illegal counterfeiting and sales by the vendors and copyright thief.This crime has exhausted me, and caused a great deal of hardship. However, I am recovering with spiritual counseling and the help of God Almighty. I have since produced thousands of other photographs that are worthy of sharing with the rest of the world, and hope to start publishing more of them soon.


What Is Needed To Help Seek Justice

I have decided to file a federal lawsuit in the United States Federal District Court of Arizona to protect my copyright from further being violated, and to help protect United States citizens from criminal frauds who operate as "angels in disguise." Unfortunately, I cannot afford attorney fees, so I have to file "Pro Se", which means to represent myself. There are costs associated with filing this case and incidental expenses that must be met as the case moves along in the federal courts. However, to reach this goal I must accumulate funds to print and frame some of the other photography works that I have captured over the years to auction and sale to raise the capital I need to represent myself in court. Your help will allow me to register and apply to festivals as a vendor to display my creative photography art. A good copyright lawyer is hard to find in Arizona, especially one that will work on a contingency basis or file this case as a pro-bono one. If you know of any lawyer that is interested in helping me to seek justice, feel free to contact me asap. 


Other Ways You Can Help

I have started to write about my story and hope to someday complete a book about the copyright theft. You can go to http://www.thestolenimage.com to read the introduction and also view the original photo-poster and see the counterfeit print. Also, if you have seen this sports photo-poster and happened to have purchased one, please let us know where, when and how much you paid for the counterfeit for it is high time to settle accounts with the vendors and printers who were engaged in this criminal activity. You can email any correspondence to counterfeitcopy@thestolenimage.com. Thank you for your help and support!

story:
Year 3

Here we are, in the tail end of the craziest year ever and I am returning with my calendar. 

This year has some special challenge like not being able to do photoshoots for most of the year due to social distanciation, but thankfully, I had gotten started early with our beautiful and badass cover lady. 

So what it's in here this year you ask? 

14 photos as usual (12 months, front cover, back cover), horror peeps and adding the action Queen! Yeah, you read that right, this year's cover lady is none other than Cynthia Rothrock!

As usual, the calendar is paid for and your pre-order will help me pay myself back for the cost of it. So really, you run no risk! The calendar is with the printers right now and I should have it shortly. 

The goal is to ship by Halloween, but given the state of things, I ask for your understanding with potential shipping delays. 

Order your calendar and get photos of Cynthia Rothrock, Tiffany Shepis, Nick Principe, filmmakers Jamie Farthing, and a slew of other models.

story:
Photography has continuously been a keen interest for me, and for the last eight years, I have developed myself into a professional photographer. I could not be more enthusiastic to give back to the photography community. With my experience and education in business and photography, I opted to share my knowledge and support others. Love Made Studios will be a fully equipped photography rental studio. It will provide the artist with the possibility and properties to grasp their goals and cultivate them as a better creator.

Working in the photography field, I observed there are not a lot of spaces available for photographers to shoot. Typically, photoshoots take place at a location inconvenient for the photographer, or the photographer is not able to afford all the equipment required. Not having all the tools to construct an impressive shot or video can be problematic for any photographer to achieve.

story:
5 Artists 1 Gallery 2 Support

5 photographers in Austin, Texas are gearing up for a group gallery showing on February 17th. We will have an opening party on the 17th from 6-8pm at Lewis Carnegie Gallery and the show will stay up until February 23rd. To make this show happen we have to come up with $800. We would love some support from our friends, family, and anyone who is interested, as this would be a great opportunity for our creative careers. 

Artists Involved:
Kasey Kay
Jordan Sanchez
Shanna Hickman
Barbara FG
Mauro Carrera

story:
Our Story

Here I am today.

Two passports in my pocket and a yearning… all I’m missing is a ticket to the border and some extra for the show for you when I return.

As an artist, the border of exchange of heritage, art and culture within the context of unifying Europe, is the place to be. 

My goal is to document the landscape of cultural diversity on the Polish eastern border with Lithuania.

In my recent work, I returned to simple forms of line, light and color.

The inspiration for this project comes from the images of where the water stops and the line begins.  From the edge of the water, through the line set in motion, I arrived at the borderline.  It is the process of creative discovery, the confrontation of my memory, and images of the past with today’s reality. 

I plan to visit  the remote town of Sejny where the Borderland Foundation has been an active voice since1990 and through the direct experience of working at the border make a personal connections with people.  The Borderline Foundation is an ideal place to start, and participating in the opening of the International Center for Dialogue in Krasnogruda, the family estate of the Nobel prize winning Polish poet Czeslaw Milosz would give me an understanding of changes along the border.

The International Center for Dialogue in Krasnogruda was donated and supported by Czeslaw Milosz and will open on June 30, 2011 which marks the hundredth anniversary of his birth. It is about 10km from the Lithuanian border. 

The landscape of cultural diversity experienced by Czeslaw Milosz has been transformed by history, but it ‘s still embraces Polish, Lithuanian, Belarusian and Jewish traditions of the region.

  I plan to spend two weeks documenting the community along the border. As a fluent Polish speaker and experienced documentary photographer I will focus on a small local community as an example of microcosm for more global coexistence.

In response to global threats arising from the rebirth of old ethnic and religious conflicts and a growing hostility to the “Other,” the Borderline Foundation serves as a worldwide model for cross-cultural dialogue. I want to know more about them.

For over 20 years I have worked as a professional photographer in documentary, journalism, portraiture and fine art photography.  My commitment to documenting the diverse communities in Chicago stands from my strong belief that through art and cultural exchange we can break down the forces that separate us.

When I photograph, I am searching for meaning. The resulting image goes beyond remembrance.  A photograph has the powerful ability to expose hidden truths in the everyday world. It points to a detail and asks the viewer to extrapolate the mystery, or simply to find what is human in all of us.

Many thanks for your financial support in making this trip and exhibition possible.


 


The Impact

As a Polish American photographer and artist, my hope is to extend Milosz’s celebration in Poland to America, the country that was his home away from home. His influence on my life as an immigrant, artist and intellectual has profoundly informed my journey. I’m confident that an exhibition will enhance the ideas of Milosz’s dialog and contribute to an understanding of a global vision of tolerance and respect for “otherness.”  There are many forces that separate us from each another.  The microcosm of one community or one event can impact the larger world by serving as an example or as a possibility of what may be. It is my belief that images, in their universal appeal and ready recognition, can help bridge these boundaries of the mind. 

"…jakby to co minęło nie było całkiem minione dopóki trwa w pamięci pokolen  - czy tylko w pamieci jednego kronikarza.”

 (Czesław Miłosz)

…the past is never lost as long as it remains in memory of generations – or just memory of a single observer.”

 


What We Need & What You Get

My goal is to prepare 20 photographs for an exhibition in Chicago and Poland. 

 

The $4000 Budget is divided into two parts.

  The first is for travel and related expenses for visiting Poland during the month of June and July 2011. The second is for printing, framing and mounting an exhibition in Chicago in October 2011.


$2000  airfare and travel expenses

 

$2000 printing, framing and gallery expenses








































Other Ways You Can Help

Let’s get the word out.
Please share this information with everyone you know.  
Facebook, emails,  blogs, it's all helpful.
To share, click on the share tools at the top of the page.

Thank you so much.

story:
My Factfile

My name is Ulyana Batyuk. I am from Western Ukraine and live in a small town Terebovlya. I am 17 years old and I am studying right now and having a part-time job. I study at the School of Culture in my native town. My major is Art at the Art Department and I do excellent in all academic subjects. I am really excited about photography, it’s not only my great passion, but also a part-time job. Even though I started taking photos quite recently , just since the summer of 2015, but I was pretty soon noticed by good model agency called ‘Selfie Models Group’ from the City of Ternopil.


What I Am Doing Is…

What I Am Doing Is…

This model agency offered me a part-time gob – to take model photos and to do test shoots for models which will be included into their portfolio. For a model, the model tests are definitely regarded to be the first step in her future career as this is a must for any models agency. By the way, management of the agency said, that I do quite well and they suggested me teaching photography lessons at their school. I have a big dream, I want to take photos for world-known magazines and brands because I love that photography style, it is my favorite, and I am pretty sure I am good at it! My working day starts at 7 am. On weekdays I combine school and work, and I have to work at the weekend and on days-off as I am short of time during the week.



The Photography Equipment I Own

3 years ago my parents presented me one of the cheapest and simplest digital single-lens reflex camera Canon 1100d , the one I am taking photos now. The EF 50mm lenses with the f/1.4 made by Canon I bought by myself on my own money.

 

What I need

All good photographer need to have own studio. Own rule and no time limit.  I need everything to make it - from lamps to background material.

 

Why Just Me Ask Your Help?

Because of the high inflation rate in this country, it will take me at least 2 years to achieve my goal, the time I just don’t have now…I have so much new opportunities to be promoted and be employed at a higher level, but it can’t be done just with all my passion and inspiration!...At the moment I need approximately $5,000.00 by my rough estimate. 



Why Am I Not Able to Raise Money by Myself?

Despite the fact I get the Academic Excellence Scholarship which equals to $25 per month. While the price of one modeltest shoot makes up $$11-13. Why such a price? I reckon, the fashion industry has not been developed yet in Ukraine, therefore models and agencies demand the very price.


I hope I find like-minded people as I have great confidence that there are a lot of such supporters who share my ideas and trouble.

I do believe I can rely on your help.

For any aid, regardless of the amount, everyone is going to be thanked a lot.


Also follow me on MY INSTAGRAM: ulianabatiuk :))
