story:
INTRO: 

Mea Shearim was established in 1874 as the fifth settlement outside the walls of the Old City of Jerusalem. Its name is derived from a verse in the weekly Torah portion that was read the week the settlement was founded: "Isaac sowed in that land, and in that year he reaped a hundredfold (מאה שערים, Mea Shearim); God had blessed him" (Genesis 26:12). Today, Mea Shearim remains an insular neighborhood in the heart of Jerusalem. With its overwhelmingly Hasidic population, the streets retain the flavor of an Eastern European shtetl. Life revolves around strict adherence to Jewish law, prayer, and the study of Jewish religious texts. For men, traditions in dress code include black frock coats and black hats. Long, black beards cover their faces, and many grow side curls, called payots. Women and girls are urged to wear what is considered modest dress – knee-length or longer skirts, no plunging necklines or midriff tops, no sleeveless blouses or bare shoulders. Some women wear thick black stockings all year long, even in summer, and married women wear a variety of hair coverings, from wigs to head scarves. The residents speak Yiddish in their daily lives, as opposed to the Hebrew language spoken by the majority of Israel’s population. The only use of Hebrew for residents is in prayer and religious study, as they believe that Hebrew is a sacred language to be used only for religious purposes.


 

ABOUT THE PROJECT: 

I began documenting the area of Mea Shearim in late 2014. In the course of the past 3.5 years, I took more than 15,000 photographs and while compiling this book, I managed to narrow it down to a beautiful 77 of them. This 77, translate the uniqueness of the area and its people. As a Self publisher, It took me more then 6 month to find the best quality to make this book. In that time frame i haven't compromised on any aspects, no detail was small enough. I had to change two designers and a higher number of book designs as an effect of production failures. I also visited a number of printing houses throughout my country, investing enormous financial efforts in order to reach the highest levels of color printing accuracy.

This investment of my personal funds regarding the project was based on the complete belief that the finalize product in one hand would have the highest quality available while the other was to maintaining lowest cost as possible for the product. There were a lot of delaying factors along the way, but I am finally happy to announce that I have managed to achieve the highest quality result for both levels - print and cost and now i'm continuing to move forward.

Project production currently stands in its last alignment as the layout of the book, binding, test prints and so are all over. The print house and the final format for the book is ready. One thing remains the same, and is my own financial capital for producing the book. In order to achieve the best result I mentioned earlier, I need your help believing that together we could make this project successful.

this project would set as the starting point for a trilogy about religion in the city of gods - the city of Jerusalem.

 

BOOK DETAILS:

Publisher: Self published 
Photographs and Text: Ofir Barak
Language: English
layout and print : Artplus
Hardcover: 164 pages 
Book binding - Sewing
Size: 30 cm high X 21 cm wide
Photographs: 77 Black and white images
Anticipated publication date: July 2017

* All details of book may vary a bit and are not final *

 

REWARDS:

  • As stated in some perks, backers are able to choose photos from this selection-

  • A sample of a single contact sheet from the "- ULTIMATE EDITION -" that contains a set of 77 contact sheets (hand marked)-

 

TIMEFRAME:

Early may 2017 : Start of indiegogo campaign
Early june 2017 : End of indiegogo campaign
Mid june 2017 : Start of the printing, binding and book compiling
Mid july 2017 : Receiving final books and backers rewards 
Late july 2017 : Shipping  rewards to backers

 

FINAL WORDS:

You can find more about the project at my website , instagram and my facebook.

Please be advise that if you are interested in a perk hit it (if not the money you would contribute would be conceder as a donation).

Some people can't contribute donations, but that doesn't mean everyone can't help. Please consider spreading the word around regarding the "MEA SHARIM - THE STREETS" book campaign. You can use the share buttons located on top. I would like to thank you all from the bottom of my heart. Lets make it happen.

Music in video: november - Bensound.com
story_txt: INTRO: Mea Shearim was established in 1874 as the fifth settlement outside the walls of the Old City of Jerusalem. Its name is derived from a verse in the weekly Torah portion that was read the week the settlement was founded: "Isaac sowed in that land, and in that year he reaped a hundredfold (מאה שערים, Mea Shearim); God had blessed him" (Genesis 26:12). Today, Mea Shearim remains an insular neighborhood in the heart of Jerusalem. With its overwhelmingly Hasidic population, the streets retain the flavor of an Eastern European shtetl. Life revolves around strict adherence to Jewish law, prayer, and the study of Jewish religious texts. For men, traditions in dress code include black frock coats and black hats. Long, black beards cover their faces, and many grow side curls, called payots. Women and girls are urged to wear what is considered modest dress – knee-length or longer skirts, no plunging necklines or midriff tops, no sleeveless blouses or bare shoulders. Some women wear thick black stockings all year long, even in summer, and married women wear a variety of hair coverings, from wigs to head scarves. The residents speak Yiddish in their daily lives, as opposed to the Hebrew language spoken by the majority of Israel’s population. The only use of Hebrew for residents is in prayer and religious study, as they believe that Hebrew is a sacred language to be used only for religious purposes. ABOUT THE PROJECT: I began documenting the area of Mea Shearim in late 2014. In the course of the past 3.5 years, I took more than 15,000 photographs and while compiling this book, I managed to narrow it down to a beautiful 77 of them. This 77, translate the uniqueness of the area and its people. As a Self publisher, It took me more then 6 month to find the best quality to make this book. In that time frame i haven't compromised on any aspects, no detail was small enough. I had to change two designers and a higher number of book designs as an effect of production failures. I also visited a number of printing houses throughout my country, investing enormous financial efforts in order to reach the highest levels of color printing accuracy.This investment of my personal funds regarding the project was based on the complete belief that the finalize product in one hand would have the highest quality available while the other was to maintaining lowest cost as possible for the product. There were a lot of delaying factors along the way, but I am finally happy to announce that I have managed to achieve the highest quality result for both levels - print and cost and now i'm continuing to move forward.Project production currently stands in its last alignment as the layout of the book, binding, test prints and so are all over. The print house and the final format for the book is ready. One thing remains the same, and is my own financial capital for producing the book. In order to achieve the best result I mentioned earlier, I need your help believing that together we could make this project successful.this project would set as the starting point for a trilogy about religion in the city of gods - the city of Jerusalem. BOOK DETAILS:Publisher: Self published Photographs and Text: Ofir BarakLanguage: Englishlayout and print : ArtplusHardcover: 164 pages Book binding - SewingSize: 30 cm high X 21 cm widePhotographs: 77 Black and white imagesAnticipated publication date: July 2017* All details of book may vary a bit and are not final * REWARDS:As stated in some perks, backers are able to choose photos from this selection-A sample of a single contact sheet from the "- ULTIMATE EDITION -" that contains a set of 77 contact sheets (hand marked)- TIMEFRAME:Early may 2017 : Start of indiegogo campaignEarly june 2017 : End of indiegogo campaignMid june 2017 : Start of the printing, binding and book compilingMid july 2017 : Receiving final books and backers rewards Late july 2017 : Shipping  rewards to backers FINAL WORDS:You can find more about the project at my website , instagram and my facebook.Please be advise that if you are interested in a perk hit it (if not the money you would contribute would be conceder as a donation).Some people can't contribute donations, but that doesn't mean everyone can't help. Please consider spreading the word around regarding the "MEA SHARIM - THE STREETS" book campaign. You can use the share buttons located on top. I would like to thank you all from the bottom of my heart. Lets make it happen.Music in video: november - Bensound.com

story:
Recently, I was inspired to start a community photography project, which I named FOCAL POINTS.  FOCAL POINTS is a collection of both color and black & white photography, which documents everyday citizens of the city of Syracuse, their thoughts, and their photographic interpretations on violence, injustice and/or racism in America.  FOCAL POINTS also includes captivating black & white photography from the “1 Million Hoodie March” from Armory Square to Clinton Square on Friday, March 30, 2012 in Syracuse, which was sparked by the outrage surrounding the Trayvon Martin case.

I am humbled by the positive responses from the Syracuse community.  FOCAL POINTS has been selected for display with several organizations in the Central New York Region.  The Crowne Plaza Hotel  & Conference Center Syracuse has also graciously agreed to be the sponsoring hotel for the Opening Reception, which will take place in their Lafayette Room on Thursday, May 31, 2012 from 5:30-8:30 PM.

I would be grateful you would be willing to sponsor the FOCAL POINTS exhibit as a patron with a donation of $20.00.  The names of all patrons will be listed in the opening reception program. 

Thank you for your consideration and support.

story:
BRINN has decided that the days of boring camera bags are over because you, my dear, are far from boring. You're chic. Our mission at BRINN is to create an ethical luxury camera bag & accessory line for the movers and thinkers of the world. Created by a photographer, for photographers, every aspect of our first prototype has been consciously and purposefully thought out. Our products were designed to solve a problem - BRINN is an idea, a space for style to meet functionality. We strive for authentic and genuine design and what sets us apart is our approach. Unlike our competitors, our androgynous line has a style for everyone. No more bulky, masculine or one of the same design camera bags. Our products are always designed with YOU in mind. Now we need your help to bring it to life.

The interior of our bags are padded with a deluxe faux fur and lined with velvet for a soft padding and luxe look & feel. With plenty of space for your 15" laptop, notebooks, extra batteries and most importantly, your cameras and lenses, BRINN will carry the workload for you. Going on a weekend getaway? All camera compartments are completely adjustable and removable, making your bag adaptable for any adventure. 

Our products are made from a durable and water-resistant vegan leather to keep your belongings dry and concealed no matter where you go. Our padded straps come equipped with a pocket to hold your metro card or train ticket and another to carry spare change. Our quick access side pocket allows you to grab what you need when you need it. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • So far, we at BRINN, have our first prototype made. We want you along the ride with us and to watch us grow. The bag you are seeing pictured is the Rebel Rebel bag. It is the first out of five designs from our very first collection. It's more than we can ever have imagined and we love it so, but as all first prototypes, there are a couple of changes to be made. We have been field testing the bag for months and know exactly what tweaks need to be done to make it just right for you. We will be personally paying for all the fabrics and materials needed but we still need $12,000 to adjust the bag and as well as have all 5 samples produced. The funding will be going to altering our patterns, having new patterns made as well as actually making all of the samples. 
  • As a photography brand, we always want to support upcoming and established artists! Our founder, Ciara Perrone, is a photographer, Asbury Park local as well as a Parsons the New School for Design graduate. It is important to her to use this campaign to showcase great talents that she has met along her journey by offering photographic prints by a curated group of photographers as one of the perks (coming May2017). There are only a limited number of these perks available, so please act fast and check out our featured artists work further!
  • Should we not reach our goal, the funds will still be directly used for the advancement of BRINN. If the money we raise during this campaign only slightly covers our costs for samples, that is still where the money will go toward. We will not stop no matter what happens and in the end, will not disappoint any of you. Should we exceed our goal, the extra money will be put towards getting our first collection manufactured! If you have any questions during or after this campaign about where exactly the money will go, please feel free to reach out to us anytime at hello@brinnbags.com and we promise to respond to you promptly.

The Impact

  • Lets face it: When we look good, we feel better. But don't write BRINN up to be just a fashion accessory. BRINN is changing the way we feel about work gear. It's fun, stylish, ethical, functional and always evolving to fit your needs. 
  • Know what you wear: BRINN is made from all vegan materials. Our products are cruelty free and while sourcing materials, we are always looking for the next best solution to be more sustainable.
  • Our samples will be produced by one of the top handbag manufacturers in NYC and we have worked closely with them since day 1 of our prototype to ensure the fabric choices and decision to detail are what will work best for our designs. We will remain by their sides throughout the sample making process.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you've read this far, we want to thank you from the very bottom of our hearts for showing interest in a project that means so much to us. If all we have is a dream and the support of you all, then we already consider ourselves beyond successful. 

We understand and respect if you cannot make a donation. However, if you believe in this project and want to see us thrive, please share this campaign with everyone you know! Literally everyone - your parents, the cashier at your favorite bodega, your dog.

Please share this page, our Instagram, our Facebook page, our website, share it all! Use the IndieGoGo sharing tools, all you have to do is click a button. It's that simple. And you'll make us very happy. xoxo.

 

Listed below are the artists that contributed to our campaign by donating prints! Please check out their work and always support local art.

story:
This Indiegogo preorder campaign ends 10/31/20. After that, starting 11/1/20, you can order here: https://www.facebook.com/commerce/products/3421...

2021 Finger Lakes Region Scenic Calendar benefiting The Autism Nature Trail at Letchworth State Park

The calendar combines scenic images, historic narrative, and also supports the premier of an original and model approach in engaging the Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) community.

    Calendar

    2019: Last year, we made our first calendar.

    2020 Calendar Images

    And, we donated a significant portion of the proceeds to United Way of Greater Rochester.

    Facebook 1-24-20: United Way of Greater Rochester

    "A HUGE thank you goes to John Kucko Digital and Omnidon Productions for the incredibly generous $10,000 donation to United Way today. John came to us last spring to share that he was planning a Finger Lakes Region 2020 Calendar Featuring John Kucko Digital Images with his stunning images of beauty in our community and surrounding region. He asked if we were interested in being the community partner, and we said YES YES YES. Fast forward just a few months with nearly 3,000 of John’s calendars hanging on your walls, and this generous donation as a part of the proceeds of the calendar sales to benefit this community we all call home. Thank you, John!" - United Way of Greater Rochester

     

    2020: This year, we will produce another spectacular scenic Finger Lakes Region calendar featuring John Kucko Digital images and will donate a significant portion of the proceeds to the Autism Nature Trail (ANT).  Our initial goal is to reach 1000 calendar pre-sales so we can afford to print. You can help make this happen and receive your own Finger Lakes Region 2021 Calendar featuring John Kucko Digital images.

     

    Preorder now until 10/31/20 and save 20%.

    Inquire about additional bulk savings for groups/companies/organizations.

     

    Calendar Specs:

    • 9” x 12”, full color, wall calendar.
    • Landscape orientation, 9" x 12" when closed  (18" x 12" when flipped open).
    • Full color, full page John Kucko Digital exclusive images (suitable for framing).
    • Hole punch for easy hanging.
    • Includes interesting Finger Lakes region and autism narratives and information.

     

    Who is ANT?

    The Autism Natural Trail (ANT) is 'groundbreakingly' amazing! The ANT will become a unique national treasure for the ASD community and for all visitors to Letchworth. Your support will help reach the goal to permanently endow the Trail.

    From autismnaturetrail.com -“The Campaign To Build the Autism Nature Trail (The ANT) at Letchworth State Park is a public-private partnership to provide a recreational Trail within the park that allows visitors with autism and other developmental disabilities to push boundaries, explore new activities and develop skills.  To date, the campaign has raised over $2 million of the projected $3.9 million needed to construct the Trail and aid in ongoing maintenance, operations and programming. The public phase of the Campaign now is active, with plans to raise the full amount before 2021."

     

    Letchworth State Park is among New York’s premier scenic destination, attracting nearly 850,000 visitors each year.

    This is a one of a kind, new model in inclusiveness for all.

    Nature Trail and Sensory Stations

    Finger Lakes

    If you are not familiar with the Finger Lakes Region of New York State, you are missing towns, villages, hills, fresh-water lakes, waterfalls, award-winning food / wine / trails that national and international travelers, locals, vacationers, naturalists, and the tourism industry call:

    • “Top lakeside retreat in the world” (Sherman’s Travel)
    • “America’s Coolest Small Town” (Budget Travel Magazine)
    • “One of the 50 Best Cities to Bike” (Bicycling Magazine)
    • “Best Cities” in lists of some 30 national publications
    • “Best State Park in the United States” (USA TODAY 2015 Readers' Choice Award, chosen from more than 6,000 parks across the nation)

     

    Ordering - What You Will Receive. When Will You Receive It.

    You'll receive a beautiful, limited edition, commemorative Finger Lakes Region 2021 Calendar featuring John Kucko Digital images mailed to you in November 2020.

    ALL INCLUSIVE. Tax and mailing included for USA addresses. Surcharge for addresses outside USA. We'll mail it to you in a sturdy cardboard envelope - just like this one pictured here.

    ***  Multiple calendar orders mailed separately.  ***

    BONUS 1  First 500 calendars ordered also receive one (1x) exclusive John Kucko 5” x 7” postcard of one of John's iconic images. Suitable for framing or mailing. It will be included with the calendar mailings.

    BONUS 2  First 5000 calendars ordered will be a hand signed calendar by John Kucko!

    BONUS 3  Periodically throughout the campaign and throughout the summer development of the calendar, you’ll also receive email links to exclusive John Kucko Digital downloads that you can print and use (non-commercially).  Print it out, frame it, hang it, use as a screen saver, etc.

    Timeline

    • This pre-order campaign begins April 25, 2020. We have 60 days to reach the minimum of 1000 calendars pre-sold. If we don't reach 1000 within 60 days, we will not print and you will be refunded. If we reach 1000, we will continue the preorder campaign until  Oct. 31, 2020.  Starting Nov. 1, 2020 you can order online here: https://www.facebook.com/commerce/products/3421...
    • You are charged now, at the time you pre-order this calendar.
    • We plan to finalize design in late summer and go to press in September. (Update: Calendars designed and are now being printed, started 10/16.)
    • Mailings are scheduled for late October, 2020.
    • Our donation to ANT will be in early 2021, after campaigns and sales have effectively ended. (Update, we'll likely make the donation in November or December, 2020 afer the preorder campaign ends.)

    Updates

    We’ll post updates on this Indiegogo site as we select images, work with the designer, go to press, etc. We’ll also involve you in the process, asking you to vote for images that might be used in the 2021 calendar. Even after the campaign ends, we will continue to post updates throughout the development, printing, and shipping process.

    After the Campaign Ends and Communication with Us

    Follow John on his Facebook page for information on additional ordering after the campaign ends, updates, in-person appearances, calendar signings, reselling, etc., or contact us at omnidonproductions@gmail.com

    www.facebook.com/JohnKuckoDigital                                  

    Risks and challenges

    We need 1000 calendar orders to make this possible. Our goal is 50,000!  If we do not receive 1000 pre-orders by the time the campaign ends, you will be refunded within 5-7 days after the end of the campaign and we will not print.  

    We are working with the same professional designer and local professional commercial printer we used for the 2020 calendar to minimize risk. We have the photos, we have a printer, we have the U.S. Post Office. Even with prudent, conservative planning, issues always arise. There are always risks of unforeseen delays, accidents, catastrophes, meteor strikes, alien invasions from the 2nd galactic quadrant in the Milky Way Galaxy, etc.  Thus, there may be delays in mailing the calendar to you. We have built in a lot of time to the project to make sure you have the calendars in-hand before the winter 2020 holiday season. Also, if this blows up, and we obtain 20,000 or 50,000 or 100,000+ supporters, that may delay the fulfillment and shipping. Rest assured, we are preparing for that blessing if it happens, but just in case delivery is delayed, please forgive us.

    We are committed to this printing. If for some reason we are unable to print the final product, you will be refunded. Contact anyone who has worked with us or endorsed us. We are upstanding guys and will take a loss ourselves if needed to make anyone whole.

    COVID repercussions? Who knows at this time. Our lives are changing daily and we have no idea what conditions will be in September during our planned time to print.  Will costs go up/down? Will we be able to print? Will there be significant delays? We will plan for those contingencies as best we can and deal with them as they arise. Worse comes to worse, we refund everything and we don't print. 

    About Us (the people creating and selling the calendar)

    L-R: Don and John

    The Seneca People honored William Pryor Letchworth with the name Hai-wa-ye-is-tah, "he who does the right thing." We aim to do the same. We certainly want to produce a wonderful product that promotes the region and put some US currency in our pocket, but we also want to give back in a large, meaningful way.

    Photographer

    John Kucko - A 30-year TV sports anchor who traded one passion for another four years ago when he left sports to pursue digital photography. In a short time, John has been fortunate to capture several viral and iconic images ranging from Ice Houses seen across the world to Finger Lakes Region waterfalls and so much more. John treasures living so close to so many Finger Lakes Region landmarks and loves to showcase them on his digital Facebook page where his reach routinely tops the two million mark each month. John’s images capture the beauty of the Finger Lakes Region and surrounding counties as no other. His images elicit emotions of awe, pride, remembrance, and beauty. His captivating images and historical narrative have been used by regional, domestic and international media regularly. A viral sensation due to a love of the Finger Lakes beauty & history and a passion for photography & drone flying (both self-taught). John's images and descriptions tell a story - a story rich in beauty, history, and traditions of today and yesterday.

    "John Kucko, as an ardent fan of Letchworth State Park, was an early supporter of The Autism Nature Trail (The ANT).  He believes -- as we do -- that natural beauty should be shared, which he accomplishes through his stunning photography. John shows integrity in his profession as a journalist, his visual story-telling as an influencer and his inclusive philanthropy as a human being.  We are so grateful for John's generosity in directing proceeds from the sale of his 2021 calendar to The ANT, a nature trail for all in the #1 state park in the country!"

    -Loren Penman, Co-Chair for The ANT, Genesee Region Parks Commission

    Follow John:

    • Facebook (@JohnKuckoDigital)
    • Twitter (John_Kucko)
    • Instagram (#johnkuckodigital)

     

    Project Creator and Manager

    Donald M Sirianni - Webster, NY born and raised. Lived and worked in Kuwait, Korea, New Zealand, England, China, Philippines, Mexico as a teacher, award-winning author, engineer, pilot, flight instructor, and entrepreneur. A thirst for learning, helping others and exploring.

     

    Why did we do this and why are we doing it again?

    Thousands of John’s followers asked for a calendar, book, etc. of his photos. So, what better way to answer the call than with a beautiful calendar? John and I formed Omnidon Productions, Inc., a NYS formed S-Corp designated company. Integral to this is the desire to give back to those in need. We were taught to share and help. We were very successful with our first run out of the gate ( donated $10,000 to United Way of Greater Rochester from 2020 calendar proceeds) and wanted to build on that and donate more this your with the 2021 calendar.

     

    Thanks. Together we'll support the building and maintenance of the Autism Nature Trail, and you get a heck of a nice looking calendar.

“Best Cities” in lists of some 30 national publications
“Best State Park in the United States” (USA TODAY 2015 Readers' Choice Award, chosen from more than 6,000 parks across the nation)
 Ordering - What You Will Receive. When Will You Receive It.You'll receive a beautiful, limited edition, commemorative Finger Lakes Region 2021 Calendar featuring John Kucko Digital images mailed to you in November 2020.ALL INCLUSIVE. Tax and mailing included for USA addresses. Surcharge for addresses outside USA. We'll mail it to you in a sturdy cardboard envelope - just like this one pictured here.***  Multiple calendar orders mailed separately.  ***BONUS 1  First 500 calendars ordered also receive one (1x) exclusive John Kucko 5” x 7” postcard of one of John's iconic images. Suitable for framing or mailing. It will be included with the calendar mailings.BONUS 2  First 5000 calendars ordered will be a hand signed calendar by John Kucko!BONUS 3  Periodically throughout the campaign and throughout the summer development of the calendar, you’ll also receive email links to exclusive John Kucko Digital downloads that you can print and use (non-commercially).  Print it out, frame it, hang it, use as a screen saver, etc.Timeline
This pre-order campaign begins April 25, 2020. We have 60 days to reach the minimum of 1000 calendars pre-sold. If we don't reach 1000 within 60 days, we will not print and you will be refunded. If we reach 1000, we will continue the preorder campaign until  Oct. 31, 2020.  Starting Nov. 1, 2020 you can order online here: https://www.facebook.com/commerce/products/3421...
You are charged now, at the time you pre-order this calendar.
We plan to finalize design in late summer and go to press in September. (Update: Calendars designed and are now being printed, started 10/16.)
Mailings are scheduled for late October, 2020.
Our donation to ANT will be in early 2021, after campaigns and sales have effectively ended. (Update, we'll likely make the donation in November or December, 2020 afer the preorder campaign ends.)
UpdatesWe’ll post updates on this Indiegogo site as we select images, work with the designer, go to press, etc. We’ll also involve you in the process, asking you to vote for images that might be used in the 2021 calendar. Even after the campaign ends, we will continue to post updates throughout the development, printing, and shipping process.After the Campaign Ends and Communication with UsFollow John on his Facebook page for information on additional ordering after the campaign ends, updates, in-person appearances, calendar signings, reselling, etc., or contact us at omnidonproductions@gmail.comwww.facebook.com/JohnKuckoDigital                                  Risks and challengesWe need 1000 calendar orders to make this possible. Our goal is 50,000!  If we do not receive 1000 pre-orders by the time the campaign ends, you will be refunded within 5-7 days after the end of the campaign and we will not print.  We are working with the same professional designer and local professional commercial printer we used for the 2020 calendar to minimize risk. We have the photos, we have a printer, we have the U.S. Post Office. Even with prudent, conservative planning, issues always arise. There are always risks of unforeseen delays, accidents, catastrophes, meteor strikes, alien invasions from the 2nd galactic quadrant in the Milky Way Galaxy, etc.  Thus, there may be delays in mailing the calendar to you. We have built in a lot of time to the project to make sure you have the calendars in-hand before the winter 2020 holiday season. Also, if this blows up, and we obtain 20,000 or 50,000 or 100,000+ supporters, that may delay the fulfillment and shipping. Rest assured, we are preparing for that blessing if it happens, but just in case delivery is delayed, please forgive us.We are committed to this printing. If for some reason we are unable to print the final product, you will be refunded. Contact anyone who has worked with us or endorsed us. We are upstanding guys and will take a loss ourselves if needed to make anyone whole.COVID repercussions? Who knows at this time. Our lives are changing daily and we have no idea what conditions will be in September during our planned time to print.  Will costs go up/down? Will we be able to print? Will there be significant delays? We will plan for those contingencies as best we can and deal with them as they arise. Worse comes to worse, we refund everything and we don't print. About Us (the people creating and selling the calendar)L-R: Don and JohnThe Seneca People honored William Pryor Letchworth with the name Hai-wa-ye-is-tah, "he who does the right thing." We aim to do the same. We certainly want to produce a wonderful product that promotes the region and put some US currency in our pocket, but we also want to give back in a large, meaningful way.PhotographerJohn Kucko - A 30-year TV sports anchor who traded one passion for another four years ago when he left sports to pursue digital photography. In a short time, John has been fortunate to capture several viral and iconic images ranging from Ice Houses seen across the world to Finger Lakes Region waterfalls and so much more. John treasures living so close to so many Finger Lakes Region landmarks and loves to showcase them on his digital Facebook page where his reach routinely tops the two million mark each month. John’s images capture the beauty of the Finger Lakes Region and surrounding counties as no other. His images elicit emotions of awe, pride, remembrance, and beauty. His captivating images and historical narrative have been used by regional, domestic and international media regularly. A viral sensation due to a love of the Finger Lakes beauty & history and a passion for photography & drone flying (both self-taught). John's images and descriptions tell a story - a story rich in beauty, history, and traditions of today and yesterday."John Kucko, as an ardent fan of Letchworth State Park, was an early supporter of The Autism Nature Trail (The ANT).  He believes -- as we do -- that natural beauty should be shared, which he accomplishes through his stunning photography. John shows integrity in his profession as a journalist, his visual story-telling as an influencer and his inclusive philanthropy as a human being.  We are so grateful for John's generosity in directing proceeds from the sale of his 2021 calendar to The ANT, a nature trail for all in the #1 state park in the country!"-Loren Penman, Co-Chair for The ANT, Genesee Region Parks CommissionFollow John:
Facebook (@JohnKuckoDigital)
Twitter (John_Kucko)
Instagram (#johnkuckodigital)
 Project Creator and ManagerDonald M Sirianni - Webster, NY born and raised. Lived and worked in Kuwait, Korea, New Zealand, England, China, Philippines, Mexico as a teacher, award-winning author, engineer, pilot, flight instructor, and entrepreneur. A thirst for learning, helping others and exploring. Why did we do this and why are we doing it again?Thousands of John’s followers asked for a calendar, book, etc. of his photos. So, what better way to answer the call than with a beautiful calendar? John and I formed Omnidon Productions, Inc., a NYS formed S-Corp designated company. Integral to this is the desire to give back to those in need. We were taught to share and help. We were very successful with our first run out of the gate ( donated $10,000 to United Way of Greater Rochester from 2020 calendar proceeds) and wanted to build on that and donate more this your with the 2021 calendar. Thanks. Together we'll support the building and maintenance of the Autism Nature Trail, and you get a heck of a nice looking calendar.

story:
My name is Roxana Petrean and I'm a professional photographer for over 8 years. I live in Cluj-Napoca (Romania), the largest city of Transylvania, also known as the capital of this region.

Three years ago I began taking and collecting images from Cluj and the surrounding areas. This summer I want to shoot some places I've never been before and complete the collection in order to print this album.

Why “Pieces of Transylvania”

It is very hard to cover all the region of Transylvania so I decided to focus mainly on the center part of it. The album will contain more than 100 incredible images with landscapes, medieval and modern buildings, castles, fortresses, churches, parks, amazing roads and other places from Transylvania.

Your contributions will help me travel to some amazing places and complete this awesome journey. You can make a small donation or you can buy one of the two available types of albums – a standard one or a premium one.

Albums specs

  1. Standard album
  • Format 20 cm x 30 cm (landscape)
  • Hardcover book
  • More than 100 images
  • High quality matte paper
  • Shipped worldwide
  1.  Premium album
  • Format 20 cm x 30 cm (landscape)
  • Eco leather cover
  • More than 100 images
  • High quality photo paper
  • Shipped worldwide
  • Limited edition

The shipping of the albums will begin in September.

I am very grateful for you trust and contribution. Thank you!

story:
What I am doing...

My name is Leah Beach and I am a photographer from Delaware in the US. I started photographing people with Alzheimer’s Disease in 2011 while I was still attending art school. My great grandmother, Treva Yohe, was a patient at Brandywine Assisted Living in Rehoboth Beach, Delaware and I thought I would photograph her to try to discover more about her disease. As I began my exploration of the disease, I thought my work would be photographing people waiting to die, but it became so much more. My work became photographing these amazing people as they lived with Alzheimer’s and Dementia. At that time, I also realized that I needed to show people around the world how different cultures treat this disease. Dementia is something that affects everyone. It could be affecting someone you love, or perhaps it is something you are terrified of developing in your golden years. 

I searched for many different avenues of funding over the last couple of years, applying for various grants and consistently being turned down for two reasons: lack of work or lack of experience. I’ve been told its a powerful idea but an idea is not quite enough to prove that I am worth investing in. So I figured that I should try to start this project on my own. I found Global Vision International in 2013 and worked to save funds to do a volunteer program with them in 2014, in rural Shimoni, Kenya with hopes of getting access to people with dementia within the community. I had no idea that that hope would become a reality. 

I spent a day on Wasini Island, in a very rural village called Mkwiro photographing undiagnosed people who showed signs of Dementia. I am not a doctor, so I can not say these people have the disease but after spending so much time in nursing homes in the US, I identified shocking similarities between the patients. They give you this look like they are looking through you, not at you. That's the best way I can describe it. I learned so much about the patients in the village from their families and those who would describe their lives. These experiences sparked an expanded mission to travel to rural villages and nations around the world to share these peoples stories.

  

My Goal of This Project

Currently, I have been working with the Alzheimer’s Association of Kenya to gain knowledge about work they are doing to help people living with this disease. If I can get the funding from this Indegogo page From Mid- March until Mid- May Im going to photograph in rural communities, facilities in Nairobi, and to live with a Masai Tribe to photograph within their village as well. With these photographs I will have a cohesive body of work showing both sides of my project, people living with Dementia in progressive and rural areas so that I can work on getting the funding to start the world wide project. By that point I will have the photographic work and experience to back this project.

After getting adequate funding, the overall goal is to travel the world to the most isolated villages and communities to photograph people with different forms of dementia. I would work with each countries Alzheimer’s Association (most countries have one) to receive all of the information and guidance that I could need. I also plan to photograph the most progressive treatment methods as well to juxtapose how people are living with dementia around the world.  


The Impact 

The current project in Kenya will be the platform of my overall project. With the work I will create, I am applying to be a sponsored by Blue Earth, an organization that will help me with applying for and receiving grants as well as marketing and public relations. With their help I will reach out for grants to fund this project.

After the overall project is completed I would exhibit this work, publish a book and provide all participating Alzheimer’s Associations free use of the images for their organizations. I also would work to create nursing outreach programs for these rural areas with proceeds from the project. 

The impact of this project is more than just creating pictures. It will change lives, helping people living with this disease until someday there is a cure.


Why I Need Help

I am currently in need of funding to do my work in Kenya, which is why I created this Indegogo account. The funds raised here will go to pay for my airfare, from Scotland to Nairobi and Nairobi to the United States, living and travel expense, as well as funding the Masai tribe so I have access to them. Though it will be a tight budget, I will need exactly this amount to make this time possible. 

If the fund of $5,000 is not achieved I will edit my time in Kenya to fit the budget of what I can raise. If for some reason I do not raise enough money to realistically and successfully finish my project, all money raised will be returned.

Other Ways You Can Help 

If you can not contribute to the fund, there are so many ways you can help. Just sharing this project with friends, relatives, businesses and organizations is a HUGE help. 

Thank you for your time,

Leah Beach

story:
The Short of it:

I shoot for the love of the art—not for money. That being said, photography equipment is incredibly expensive! I would really like to be able to expand the available services to my clients by having the ability to shoot unique head shots, stunning portraits as well as have the consistent availability to photograph the concept imagery that you might be used to seeing from me. Currently, I am renting all of the things I need to complete the paid sessions—which basically means I still shoot for close to nothing. I am currently using only one light for most of my images—and that has a great deal of limitations. Since I have rarely charged for my work in the past, I need your help to get the rest of the gear needed to bring these additional services to the clients of RWphotographics—and have them done RIGHT. These funds will allow me to purchase the equipment I need to provide not only better work, but more of it. 

Here is what I need:

(4)- Einstein Flash Heads: $500/each
(4)- 13' Heavy Duty Light Stands: $70/each
(4)- CyberSync Transeivers: $30/each
(2)- 10"x36" Foldable Strip Boxes with grids: $150/each
(2)- Vagabond Mini Lithium Power Packs: $240/each
(2)- Vagabond Mini Lithium Batteries: $90/each
(1)- CyberSync Commander: $180

(1)- InterFit Double-Sided Collapsable Background: $80
(1)- 22" Beauty Dish with grid: $130

(1)- 47" Foldable Octa Box with grid: $225
(1)- 15" MacBook Pro for image editing/client viewing (currently working on a mid-2007 iMac that just can't keep up): $2800


If I Hit My Goal:

I will do an incredibly embarrassing dance of joy, then lose sleep by shooting photos until I pass out. I will pick up all the gear on my list and book paid photo sessions (hopefully with relative ease).

What You Get

Seeing as this project is all about photography, I thought the perks should be as well!  In addition to making my dream come true to have a mobile studio so that I can provide an variety of options for my clients, take a look at the panel to the right to check out the perks by level of support! Are you in need professional head shots for work? Want to update your modeling portfolio? Always wanted to do a themed concept photo shoot? Among the other rewards for your donation, I am offering a 2-hour photo session and full editing of your top 5 picks for $350 (must be within a 90-mile radius of Orlando, FL). I will bring the studio to you!
 

Click here to check out my work on Facebook
Click here to check out my website

Other Ways You Can Help

Have you ever enjoyed stalking my facebook photos? Know of someone who has been talking about getting some photos done? Just want to be an all around awesome person? Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, etc. to help me reach those who would like to help out!

THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!!
- Russ Watkins

story:
!!!!!!!!!!   THE PROJECT IS HERE :        http://igg.me/at/rollnstef/x/3199951

                                    THANK YOU !!!!!

 
 
"Do not dream our lives, living our dreams"
 
 
"And if we went for a drive Photographic Road Trip of the most iconic U.S. highway to create a book with unique pictures!"
 
 
 
 
Route 66 is a dream, I want to tell in pictures!!
Pictures of places, characters, nooks and crannies and everything that makes the history of Route 66 .... pictures you have not seen .... all in a beautiful book with photos ROLLNSTEF KUSTOM ART PICS will you eyeful !!!!!
 
 
 My goal is to publish a limited edition book. To do this I need to raise at least 6,000 EUR. The more money I raise the nicer the book can be. Many details during printing and binding separate a good book from a great book and I want this to be a great book of THE ROUTE 66.
 


 
 
 
Stéphane photographer in the middle of the Kustom Kulture under the name "ROLLNSTEF". Passionate United States and more specifically the years pre-65's.
 
 
 
 
 
 
I was developing a personal technique in my photographic work, mixing photography, painting and Kustom Kulture.
 
 

 
 
My goal is to ask yourself if it is a photographic work, a painting, photomontage, etc. ....
 
 
 
 
You can find my photographic work and give you an idea of my world and what will be the imagine book project on Route 66! See here:

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Rollnstef-ART-Ku...

 

What we need and what you get

 

A budget of 6000 euros we've needed to fund:
   
 
- Travel autotour Route 66 (Flight A / R, hotels, rental car) for me and my other half will lead (so I could jump out of the car at every opportunity) and then she has a level of English better than mine !
   
 
 
 
-The creation of the book "ROLLNSTEF ART ROUTE 66" and
we have to make about 500 copies.
I found an amazing book printer right here . They specialize in beautiful photography books, and I will be working with them to create a high quality art book. It will be a hardcover gem that will really hold its own on bookshelves and coffee tables, and it will feature all of my favorite images from my road trip 66 .All books will be  personally signed and as a limited edition. I plan to publish the book after this crowdfunding project.
 

   
 
- All secondary expenses: travel expenses (gas / etc)
                                                      Photo equipment
                                                      production photos.
 

- And if you are very generous, there will be further contributions that you can see in the project news!

 

Your contribution will make the difference !!!!!!!

. If the 6,000 EUR goal is reached all rewards will be immediately sent at the end of road trip. All books will be sent  (during thethird quarter of the year 2013).

You can donate with your typical credit cards (Visa and Mastercard) or with PayPal account. So it is so easy for everyone :-) The Perks you get for your contribution are on the right side (6 grey rectangles).

I want to pay tribute to the MOTHER ROAD!
 
 
I want to travel, meet people, places, and make a photo book that makes you want people to come and discover.
 
 
 
So motivated as ever, I contacted the iconic characters of the ROUTE 66:
 
 - Mr DELGADILLO!! The latter fought for the survival of his hometown, which necessarily going through the preservation of Route 66. Having spent his entire life in his "barber shop" shaving indigenous and travelers, he founded with his brother, the first association of rehabilitation of Route 66 in 1987.
 

 
 
 - Mr Michael Wallis Specialist Route 66, Wallis wrote more than 14 books on the subject!
 
 
- Mr Ken TheLandrunner! It is the origin of Historic Route 66 Artwork Document.
 
 
You see, we just need your participation so that I can meet my idols !!!!!!!
 
 
 

Other ways to help

Some people can not help but that does not mean they can not help:

    - Spread the word and made the publicity surrounding this project.
        ( Facebook / Twitter / Blog / etc... )
        
       - Important: Use sharing tools Indiegogo!

 
And thank you !!!!!!!!!!!!!

I want to travel, meet people, places, and make a photo book that makes you want people to come and discover.
 
 
 
So motivated as ever, I contacted the iconic characters of the ROUTE 66: 

 - Mr DELGADILLO!! The latter fought for the survival of his hometown, which necessarily going through the preservation of Route 66. Having spent his entire life in his "barber shop" shaving indigenous and travelers, he founded with his brother, the first association of rehabilitation of Route 66 in 1987.

 
 
 
 - Mr Michael Wallis Specialist Route 66, Wallis wrote more than 14 books on the subject! 
 
- Mr Ken TheLandrunner! It is the origin of Historic Route 66 Artwork Document.



 
 
You see, we just need your participation so that I can meet my idols !!!!!!!
 
 
 

Other ways to help
Some people can not help but that does not mean they can not help:    - Spread the word and made the publicity surrounding this project.        ( Facebook / Twitter / Blog / etc... )

         
       - Important: Use sharing tools Indiegogo! 
And thank you !!!!!!!!!!!!!

story:
So why this appeal for cash? I mean, I’ve got the bike. Over the last 15 months, the Bandit and I have travelled 50,000km together, criss-crossing South Africa. Me and that bike, we’re an item.

As a way to regain my sanity after 10 years as the director of South Africa’s largest environmental justice NGO (Earthlife Africa Johannesburg), I’m doing a postdoc in philosophy at Stellenbosch University. My great, wonderful and way too kind boss doesn’t require me to be on campus for a while. So I’ve got the time.

A team of sound engineers, cinematographers and photographers are waiting for me to go off and return with raw content. They will then do their magic and put something together for you to watch. Two bike dealers, who despite their puzzlement over my choice of a motorcycle, are helping me out. A lawyer and accountant are donating their time. I’ve got the people.

Business Day (South Africa) has accredited me as a freelance journalist for the duration of the trip and the Johannesburg Art Gallery will exhibit my material as I travel. You’ll be able to laugh at me through social media. So, I have distribution networks for my articles and photographs.

I even have a bottle opener.

What I don’t have is a bloody carnet de passage. A carnet is a bureaucrat’s wet dream. Officialdom created this arcane document that says when you bring a vehicle into a country, you promise not to sell it. In order make sure that I don’t sell the Bandit, I have to leave a substantial deposit behind in South Africa. When I return the bike to South Africa, I get the deposit back.

No deposit, no carnet, no trip.

So here’s how you can help. I’m asking you to cover the deposit for the carnet. But since I’ll get the money when I return, it really isn’t my money. What I will do is donate the deposit to another Indiegogo project: probably an environmental cause or another travel documentary.

That’s right, your donation will make two projects happen. Two for the price of one. The deal of the century.

The figures:

Total Campaign Goal (ZAR): R21,840.00
Total Campaign Goal (USD): $1,680.00
Carnet Deposit (ZAR): R20,000.00
Carnet Deposit (USD): $1,538.00
Estimated Indiegogo Fees (ZAR): R1,840.00
Estimated Indiegogo Fees (USD): $142.00

If you’ve managed to make it this far, you might have some questions.

1. Where are you going? And when?

South Africa, Botswana, Zambia, Tanzania, Kenya, Uganda, Ethiopia, Sudan, Saudi Arabia, Jordan, Palestine, Israel, Greece, Bulgaria, Romania, Hungary, Austria, Germany, Belgium, Poland and Russia.

I aim to leave mid-August 2017 and return before Christmas 2017. Maybe.

2. What happens if you don’t get the bike back to South Africa?

I don’t get the deposit. That’s the risk we are taking together: I’m risking the bike and you’re risking your donation not being passed on to another project.

Trust me, I’m going to do everything I can to get the Bandit home. I wasn’t kidding when I said I love that bike. I do. Till catastrophic engine failure and associated fireball do us part.

3. This carnet sounds exciting. I want to know more.

You’re sick. But hey, you’re also a free and consenting adult: https://www.aa.co.za/services/travel-services/into-africa/carnet-requirements-pricing.html

4. What about perks and stuff?

You mean that warm fuzzy feeling you’ll get from helping out two projects? Or do you mean the sheer entertainment value of following my dumbass up Africa?

5. Okay, I need a laugh. Your social media details?

Facebook: tristen.taylor.351
Twitter: @kamahasanyi
Instagram: @kamahasanyi
YouTube: Tristen Taylor
Website: www.thanatos.co.za

6. Look, I just ain’t got the cash, sorry mate.

Blame capitalism. It sucks.

But please do share. Send my appeal to your entire address book and every Facebook friend, even those ones you have no clue who they are.

7. You’re insane.

I said I was recovering my sanity, not that I had found it. If you find it, keep it until I get back from the trip. Crazy is good in this context.

Thank you. Goodnight and good luck. You are awesome.

story:
Our Story

We are 36 students at the University of Derby, UK. We are the first graduates of the new BA (Hons) Commercial Photography and we are proud to take our work to London this June.

 

Our showcase is at the Rag Factory (just off Brick Lane) from 15 to 19 June 2011. The private viewing is on Wednesday 15 June and we will let you know what time it kicks off. We'd love to see you there!

 

You can then see for yourself that our our work is as diverse as we are, with a huge variety of specialisms on show, including food, architecture, animals, documentary, still-life, sports, portraiture, surrealism...the list goes on.

 

Come and meet us on the 15th June and be the first to sample Still.Raw, a specially-brewed ale kindly produced for our showcase by The Leadmill Brewery of Denby, Derby. Throughout the night there will also be entertainment from singer-songwriter Charlotte Carpenter and street magician Rob Gough. 

 

 

The Impact

 

As the next generation of talented commercial photographers, we want to introduce ourselves to the UK's creative industries and put Derby firmly on the nation's cultural map. We are now lucky to live in a time where technology allows us the opportunity to be based anywhere in the world, so we would appreciate the help of supporters, friends, collaborators and clients across the UK and further afield as we raise funds for our photographic showcase.


This is a huge opportunity for us, and we would like to thank you for your help as we take our first steps out of university and towards our future careers, whether they be as photographers, picture editors, retouchers, curators or any of the exciting opportunities open to us through our degree.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need 3100 pounds for gallery hire, and whilst we have done well and had a lot of fun with our three fund-rasing events (the 'Santa and the Grinch' Christmas party, a pub quiz and 'The Lost Chick' Easter party) there is still a long way to go to reach our total.


We will of course also require funds for printing, framing and then transporting our work from Derby to London, as well as advertising, marketing and all the little things needed to get an exhibition up and running.

 

What we can offer you varies from a big thankyou on Twitter and a hand-written note, to a print of your choice, and a private pet photo shoot if you live anywhere near Derby or Sheffield.

If you would like to help with any specific aspect of the fund-raising as a sponsor then please get in touch.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us on the road to London by posting our link on your Facebook profile, your blog or tweeting it to all your followers. Get the word out! Thank you for your donation - no matter how small.

story:
So, back here again! 

Basically what is happening is this: I am in Cape Town, South Africa with most of my project completed. 8 out of 10 stadiums have already been photographed, as well as the cities which host them: Bloemfontein, Pretoria, Rustenbeg, Johannesburg, Polokwane, Nelspriut, and Cape Town. The only two stadiums and cities I have left to visit are Port Elizabeth and Durban. Now, given that these 2 places are located quite some distance from Cape Town (660km and 1270km respectively), the ability to actually travel and photograph these 2 cities is dependent on the fiscal resources at my disposal. Which at the moment are close to being exhausted. 

This is where you can step in, a being enshrined in a savior light, mounted on kindness and cloaked in goodwill. The truth of the matter is that it would be a terrible shame to leave South Africa with this project only partially completed, especially after all the time, effort, and hope that not only I, but all the people who have helped to get me here in the first place, have put in. 

So to put it extremely bluntly, and with the utmost respect to the reader, I need the bare minimum of money to be able to take a bus to Durban, spend the night and photograph, and then travel to Port Elizabeth and do the same there. 

Any contribution of any kind would go a long way to ensuring that this project gets completed, and completed in the way that it was originally intended, and doesn't fall by the wayside. 

You can read more about me, the project, and what I am trying to achieve on the original Indie Go Go page i set up for this:
http://www.indiegogo.com/South-Africa-Post-Worl...

You can also read more about me, the project, and random shit i choose to post up on the "Post World Cup Tremors" blog page:
http://project-south-africa.blogspot.com/

Cheers Everyone!
Oskar 

As a note, Indie Go Go has a minimum goal of 500 USD that you can set, but according to my calculations the trip to Durban will cost between 300 and 350 USD, so I will put up the 150 USD difference from what is left of my funds, because I only want to ask for what is absolutely necessary.

story:
Short Summary

Hello,

My name is Tony.  I am a photographer from Joliet Illinois.  I am passionate about photography and what it does.  An image can speak a thousand words.  I want to use photography to raise awareness of forgotten people.  We see them everyday.  Walk past them on the street and never think twice.  They are somebody's brother, sister, mother, father, son, daughter, etc.  

I want to make a book of portraits that not only has images of the forgotten people, but interviews of their life story.  I want to learn how they got where they are, are they trying to get out of their situation, how will they do it. etc. 

Help me tell their story and raise awareness. On any given night, approximately 750,000 men, women, and children are homeless in the US.

What We Need & What You Get

My goal is to reach $10,000.   I own all the equipment that I need to take the photos, so I will not be purchasing new gear with the funds.  I will be using it for my travel expenses to different cities.  Some of the funds will go to the homeless people themselves to gain access to their stories, feed them etc.   I will also be using a huge portion of the fubds to make the books.  

By contributing to my goal you will get some perks. From a digital image from the book with the story of the person photographed, a 11x14 print of an image from the book, to a copy of the book itself.  

This book will be unique in many ways.  One way is the cover.  The title of the book is "Inside the Box" and the binding of the book will be a cardboard box.    

If I do not reach my goal, funding will still go towards the project.  I will just have to do less interviews and print less books.

The Impact

Do you want to help make a difference?

Help me raise awareness...  Your contribution will help tremendously in my quest to change the world.  If my book gets published I will donate a percentage of proceeds will go towardshomeless charities. (percentage and charity or charities have yet to be determined)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Spread the word about my project, share on facebook, twitter, etc.  Use the Indiegogo share tools.

Thank you for taking your time to read my campaign.

story:
We have managed to secure a contract with an aerial sign company to fly our #WhiteGenocide message over a major iconic city this Saturday for the March Against #WhiteGenocide.

We have $156.23 remaining from the March Against White Genocide fundraiser. We need to raise a further $578.77 for this banner plane activism on Saturday.

The banner will read - Bob Whitaker 4 VP - AFP - #WhiteGenocide

The more we raise, the more of these planes we could get in the sky.

story:
We are directional, diverse, and progressive. Our focus is not the fashion world, but the world that fashion can create. We invite you to come closer.

When we are young, we do not know the limits of our imaginations. Our curiosity sets the boundaries. We don’t mould dreams based on success or consider failure. We are fearless. We are un-imprinted. We are born tabula rasa – Sabrina Banta, Editor in Chief.


Principle

Using this same principle, we are creating a publication that serves as a blank slate. We want to return to the magic inherent in both fashion and photography: to evoke the wonder of the darkroom, an idea expressed and then transformed, emerging to fill an empty, white page; to recall the power of clothing to carry history or convey personal narratives; to give artists a more transparent presence in the work they envision and produce.

Commissioning a diverse group of 15–20 photographers for each issue, the resulting work will be highly personal, provocative, focusing on issues relevant to each contributor, tied together by an over-arching theme. We want photographers to produce the work they desire to make, without traditional limitations. Each issue will operate outside a producer–consumer relationship: no advertisements, open choice of models and clothing, free of constraints from current trends or seasons. We are erasing the blueprint that has been laid for fashion publications. And through that, we are transforming it.

Vision

We want photographers to define themselves through their vision and for readers to find themselves in this self-expression. We want to encourage this visual dialogue. Fashion goes beyond the clothes. It communicates; it inspires; it persuades, provokes, and self-defines. 

Issue I: The Identity Issue encourages photographers to explore their relationships with their own images from a fashion-based perspective. Whether addressing issues relevant to their personal and professional identities or the abstract concept of identity as whole, the result is as intimate as it is universal – bridging the gap between the creatives and the reader. 

For our first issue we have selected work from photographers we feel share and embrace the potential we see for fashion photography to convey a message beyond the clothes. Among the talent contributing to our first issue are Conan Thai, Daniel Scott, Daveyiphoto, Elena Montemurro, George Pitts, Ira Chernova, Irwin Barbé, Jake Sigl, Loyc Falque, Michael Donovan, Monet Lucki, Romain Le Cam, Sabrina Banta, Sergio Mejia, Su Mustecaplioglu, Therese + Joel, Trevor Little, and Zach Ranson.

We are pleased to be collaborating with The Avery Group at Shapco Printing Inc. for Issue I, which will be released in a limited run of 500 copies. An award-winning print company renowned for producing artbooks, Shapco's work represents the high quality, aesthetic, and artistry our publication aspires to achieve and maintain. 

Each issue will also include a supplement containing interviews with all the photographers, allowing them to engage in direct conversation with our readership beyond the image on the page.

We believe in the positive connotations of accessibility. Besides bringing the creator and reader closer through content, we are committed to making our first 100 issues free to the public. This is why we need your support.

Fundraising Goal

Our fundraising goal covers the expenses necessary to ensure we maintain the highest standards of quality and to support our contributors.

Our projection of $8,000 can be divided as follows:

–– $7,000 for printing and shipping costs.

–– $1,000 for photo production costs.

Any surplus funds will be used for production costs and future issues—not for profit.


Special thanks to Joe Avery of The Avery Group at Shapco Printing Inc. for their participation and support in our endeavor. Please visit www.theartofprinting.org for information on their work and collaborations.

––

Video Director: Sabrina Banta. Art Direction: Esther Kim. Text: Sabrina Tamar. Stylist: Louise Borchers. Music: Averos – Falit (courtesy of Theodor Clausen and Natal Zaks). Art & Cinematography: Todd Barrett and Tron Lennon.

––

For more information we encourage you to watch the following video:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JKjQ1Zp52Cw

And to have a look at the links below:

https://www.facebook.com/tabularasamagazine

http://instagram.com/tabularasamagazine

http://tabularasamagazine.com/

This is why we need your support.Fundraising GoalOur fundraising goal covers the expenses necessary to ensure we maintain the highest standards of quality and to support our contributors.Our projection of $8,000 can be divided as follows:–– $7,000 for printing and shipping costs.–– $1,000 for photo production costs.Any surplus funds will be used for production costs and future issues—not for profit.Special thanks to Joe Avery of The Avery Group at Shapco Printing Inc. for their participation and support in our endeavor. Please visit www.theartofprinting.org for information on their work and collaborations.––Video Director: Sabrina Banta. Art Direction: Esther Kim. Text: Sabrina Tamar. Stylist: Louise Borchers. Music: Averos – Falit (courtesy of Theodor Clausen and Natal Zaks). Art & Cinematography: Todd Barrett and Tron Lennon.––For more information we encourage you to watch the following video:http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JKjQ1Zp52CwAnd to have a look at the links below:https://www.facebook.com/tabularasamagazinehttp://instagram.com/tabularasamagazinehttp://tabularasamagazine.com/

story:
If you are fluent in English, recommend reading in it below!

My sites you can view work on http://ilva-r.deviantart.com/ , http://ilvarimicane.blogspot.se/ ,http://www.ilvarimicane.net/

________________________________________________________________

Sveicināti!

Vēlos lūgt jūsu palīdzību manā projektā. Mani sauc Ilva un man ir 19. Mana galvenā aizraušanās vienmēr ir bijusi fotografēšana, taču nopietni tai ķērties klāt nav sanācis, it īpaši, mācību dēļ. No sākuma aizrāvos ar dabasskatu foto un makro, bet vēlāk pārgāju uz cilvēku un portretu fotografēšanu.
Lai nu kā, dzīvoju mazā Baltijas valstī - Latvijā. Valsts nav no tām lielākajām, kā arī pie mums nav nedz augsto kalnu, vulkānu un citu dabas brīnumu, tomēr mēs esam īpaši ar to, ka esam viena maza nācija, kas spējusi izdzīvot uz šīs pasaules pēc visiem tiem daudzajiem kariem un tautām , kas nākušas un valdījušas pār mūsu zemi, piemēram, vācieši, krievi arī zviedri. Ikviens no tiem, kas te bijis, ir atstājis kādu piemiņu, vai tā būtu pils vai drupas. Industrializācijas procesā daudzas pazīstamas ainavas ir tikušas iznīcinātas (Staburags), abi Paules kari, kuros Latvija bija diezgan nopietns karalauks, nav gājuši secen. Taču arī šobaltdien ir atrodami visādi noslēpumi mūsu plašajos mežos, smilšainajā krastmalā, mazajās pilsētiņās- katrā no novadiem.

 

A road through the winter, 2010

Tādēļ es vēlētos veikt ceļojumu apkārt Latvijai un iemūžināt visus skaistos dabasskatus, vēsturiskās vietas, ko vien redzēšu ceļa laikā. Beigās apkopot to visu kalendārā un lielā fotogrāmatā.

Brauciens iekļauj visas labākās pilis, lielākās Latvijas pilsētas un arī interesantas vietas, kas ir apslēptas masu tūrismam. Šērsojot Kurzemi, Zemgali un Vidzemi, Latgali.

Fotografēt gribu visdažādākajos laikapstākļos, lai redzētu saullēktu un miglu, dienasgaismas spožumu, vakara zelta stundu un nakts mēnesgaismu.

 Vēlos vairumu no vietām apmeklēt šovasar, bet rudenī un ziemā to, ko nepaspēšu vai arī būs tā vērts gadalaika dēļ.

Kam vajadzīgi līdzekļi?

  • Automašīnas degvielai, sabiedriskajam transportam.
  • Ieejas biļētēm muzejos, nacionālajos parkos, visdažādākajās apskates vietās.
  • Lētai viesnīcai, kur pārlaist nakti, ja esmu kaut kur ļoti tālu.

Ja izdosies sasniegt mērķi:

  • Kā minēju mini aprakstā, man šobrīd ir parasta spoguļkamera Nikon D60, kuru lietoju jau kādus 4 gadus. Jau kādu laiku sapņoju par jaunu kameru, ir šis tas iekrāts, taču nepietiek. Arī naktīs nesanāk tik tīras bildes, kā vajadzētu, jo parādās troksnis. Jauna kamera noteikti palīdzētu arī turpmākai izaugsmei (taču man ir visai labas lēcas, statīvs utml. ).
  • Nopirktu arī ND filtrus, lai var padarīt krāsas labākas bez "fotošopa".

Kāpēc man tas ir svarīgi?

Šobrīd pavadu iespējams vienu no pēdējām sava mūža vasarām, kad nestrādāju. Vēlāk būs vienmēr vai nu mācības vai darbs un nebūs laika kam tādam. Vēlos radīt ko paliekošu priekš tiem, kas aizbraukuši no Latvijas darba meklējumos. Kā arī daudzi tūrsti ir labākajā gadījumā redzējuši tikai daļiņu Rīgas. Ar attēlu palīdzību varētu piesasitīt lielāku interesi par citām pilsētām un dabu aiz Latvijas centra.

Jūsu ieguldījums

Noteikti palīdzēsiet nest Latvijas vārdu pasaulē un parādīt iecienītos tūristu apskates objektus jaunā gaismā, kā arī, kas to lai zina, iespējams radīt jaunas tūrsma vietas! Arī palīdzēsiet man izveidot jaunu fotogrāmatu un kalendāru ar labākajām bildēm, kuras uzņemšu savās gaitās.

No tā, ko esmu redzējusi Latvijā, zinu, ka arī šajā valstī ir nenovērtētas vietas!

Kā vēl varat palīdzēt?

  • Dalieties ar indiegogo share podziņām par šo projektu, varbūt kāds no paziņām varēs kaut kā palīdzēt!
  • Varbūt jūsu apkaimē ir kāda jauka vieta, kura ir vērta iemūžināšanai?
  • Varbūt ir kāds labs padoms, kas man jāņem vērā?

________________________________________________________________

Hello! 

I would like to ask for your help in my campaign. My name is Ilva and I am 19 years old. My main hobby has always been photography, though previously I have never had time to seriously do anything due to studies. I strated as nature photographer, but later evolved more into portraiture.

Dim woods, 2009

I live in a small Baltic country named Latvia(Lettland, Латвия). Though, country is small and we don't have epic landscapes like high mountains, gaisers, volcanoes and so on, we are special as beeing a one small nation, which could survive on this Earth even after we have been conquired and ruled by many nations such as Germans, Russians and Swedes. Everyone have left some memorable landmarks and shaped Latvia as it is now. Though, a lot of interesting sights have been destroyed by industrialising process and by both WW, when Latvia was one of the main battlefields. There is still a lot to see and tell, for example, secrets that lay in dense forests, totally walkable by foot sand coastline, famous art-noveau Old town in Riga etc.

Sunrays, 2009

I would like to make a photographic journey around my motherland and capture all the nature's beauty and historical sights that I can find.

My trip includes traveling around all mayor cities in Latvia, castles, national parks and interesting, hidden to mass tourism landscapes. Starting from Kurzeme to Zemgale, later Vidzeme and Latgale regions.

Will be shooting at all kind of times to see morning dawn and fog, daylight brightness, evening's golden hour and night's moonlight.

Road trip is going to start this summer and last until end of year with some breaks. To get the most out of each season.

 

For what I need the funds?

  • For car fuel, public transport tickets.
  • Entrance tickets to some national parks, castles and such places. 
  • Food, might take a long time until I get home.
  • Cheap accomodation, if going to stay overnight.
  • If I reach my goal then probably also equipment upgrade. At the moment I am using my Nikon D60 for some 4 years. But I have tripod and flashlight + nice lenses. I would like to upgrade my camera to full frame and buy ND filters for better scenery shots and also extra memory cards.

  • I have made some savings towards new camera, however it's not enough. I would definetly fancy a better one, because this one can't make high quality, low noise images at low light conditions, when usually you can get the best shots.

Poppy field, 2009

Why it is important to me?

This summer might be my last free one. Probably later I will have studies and work and then I will have no time for this kind of trips. Also want to leave something forever lasting for those who have left this country in order to find better payed work abroad. Probably you agree that most tourist who have been here at bast case have seen only a glipse of Riga. Some nice shots might inrigue them to check out what's happening outside the centre of Latvia.

Your involvement

Will definetly help me to promote Latvia and maybe even make new tourist destinations or make existing one's more popular. Also your contribution will greatly help to achieve one persons' dream and put together a book and a calendar.

 Because from what I have seen by living here, there must be more to tell in images about our land

How else you can help?

Firstly, if you can the please share this project using indiegogo buttons or sending links to anyone, who could contribute.

Secondly, maybe you can help with suggesting any interesting areas around your home?

Thirdly, maybe you want to be as a guide or provide a couch to sleep on?

If anything else is bothering you or have suggestions write down here!

 _______________________________________________________________

There is always a new beginning, 2013

 

Keep in mind that a lot of the doation % goes to your perks and as indiegogo tax.

story:
Hi I'm Desiree, I love God, visiting Coffee Houses,I love small dogs and I sing loud and off-key. I'm a Children's  Right Activist and I'm a serious thrift shopper. I’m obsessed with birthdays  and I love remembering people's special days. I'm a small town girl from Long Island, New York with a WORLD SIZE Vision to start a  photography  business  in 2016 which will spread hope, encourage, inspire and give back to people in need. Through photography, I will  help others tell their story.  I need your help starting. I've been using my iPhone to capture beautiful treasures and I need a DSLR Camera to learn more of the art of photography. I'm determined and driven to use photography to help others.  Read more below. 


QUESTION: What do you need $1,000 for? 

ANSWER: To purchase the Nikon D5300 & lens.  

QUESTION: How will you give back through your photography? 

ANSWER: Now you're asking great questions. Every client - big or small - will have an opportunity to choose one of the following to give back to:

1.  Portraits for survivors of Domestic violence 

2. Send a birthday box to a child in foster care 

3. Send a photo of encouragement to a person battling mental health issues, suicidal thoughts or the survivor of an attempt.

4. Family portraits for families in need 

And much more as business grows... 

QUESTION:That sounds great. Why is this important? More details please... 

ANSWER: You got it!

Foster Care: For many children in foster care, their birthdays are often forgotten. We want to let them know we are happy that they are alive and celebrating another year of life.   Wouldn't you want a birthday box mailed especially for YOU?






Domestic Violence: A photo shoot won't erase all the pain, but it would be encouraging to see beautiful photos of yourself with inspirational quotes to keep on striving. 



Family Portraits: Every family deserves to walk into their home and see their family portraits. I would love to help some families in need capture some special moments. 


Photo Encouragement how would you feel if you were down in the dumps and got a photo with some cool encouraging words in the mail. Everyone needs love and HOPE! 


QUESTION: I would love to support you, but I am on a limited budget. Is there another way that I can still support you? 

ANSWER: Of course! Money isn't everything. Please pray for my vision and please share this page with family and friends. Thank you so much. 

QUESTION: How long will you fund-raise for? 

QUESTION: Could I donate an  camera 

ANSWER: Of course if you have an Dlsr and you would love to donate that would be awesome please email me 

ANSWER: From now until December 10th

If you have any questions or comments, please email me at:God'slittletreasures27@gmail.com. Thank you. Stay Awesome! 

Please feel free to visit some of my social media platforms 

Tumblr: http://godslittletreasures.tumblr.com/

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Gods-Little-Treasures-Photography/171808753026285?ref=hl

Instagram: God'sLitteTreasures
