credit for referring themselves. Of two contributors, only one can be 
the 'referrer' and receive campaign credit for the other's 
contribution.  Refunds will be made and credits applied once the 
campaign is over.How to participate in the referral program:It’s
 simple. Log in to your Indiegogo account . Be sure to use the same 
account you used when you contributed your Remote Studio Package. Then, 
look below our main video at the top of this page for buttons to share 
and copy your unique URL. Start sharing!Need more information?  We have created detailed instructions here.


WHAT WE ALREADY HAVE

Software:
1.  We have already developed the program code to control Pan-Tilt heads
and vertical/horizontal motorized sliders from computer.
2. We have the tethering code to remotely set camera settings, obtain a live-view
from the camera, release camera shutter, download files, etc. For both Canon
and Nikon.
3. We have a streaming server and browser client to perform a low-latency streaming of the
camera's live view to your browser through the web, and control the camera. It is reliable and proven to work with a very low latency even if you're in USA or Australia when the studio is in Europe.
Hardware:
1. We have already tested third-party pan-tilt heads for this system. They work
fine, they are reliable and not expensive.
2. We performed some testing for vertical/horizontal sliding of the entire
system (will be mounted on vertical and horizontal rails). Not ideal yet, but
OK.
3. All devices (motors, lighting) are interfaced with Raspberry Pi via Arduino (single-board microcontroller, intended to make building interactive objects or environments more accessible). 


Human:
1. We very well know how to manage the development of the technical part of the
project, as we have experience in managing software development and
microcontroller/robotic development.
2. At the same time, being modeling agents we have the full understanding of
working with photo models.
3. Finally, we have top class photo models ready to work for affordable rates.
This will allow us to keep prices stated above for the Pro studio, and even
provide free access to the Lite studio. See more information about this below,
in the Q&A section.
WHAT WE NEED
Software:
1. We need to implement a web interface to flawlessly control the local code mentioned
above (both positioning and tethering) via the web.
2. We need to build the website: designing the layout, managing user accounts,
managing access permissions to different studios, queuing and scheduling access
to free studios, priority access for contributors, etc. This is possibly the
most trivial part, but at the same time the most boring and expensive stage of
the software part of the project.
Hardware:
As said above, we still need some working over the horizontal/vertical sliding
system. 
Other:
We need a photo studio itself including:

 Placement - we are going to acquire ownership of the estate property to get
rid of rental fees, because this will significantly reduce the price of the service
for end users. Therefore it will also be more profitable to us, so this is a
win-win solution.
 Equipment for the studios.



QUESTIONS & ANSWERS

1.  How many photo studios are planned?
At first,
we will start with four photo studios located in the adjacent rooms of the same
building. If we’ll see the service is demanded, we will increase the number of
studios, as we don’t feel lack of photo models.
2. 
The life
cycle of the shutter of a camera is limited. How often will you replace cameras
in a studio? This might be costly. 
While testing
our business model, we revealed that the most active and tireless photographers
take about 10 shots per minute during a 30-minutes photo session. The production
cost of one shot in terms of the resource of a shutter is calculated as $0.016
per shot (the average market price of Canon 5D Mk3, $2400, divided by the life
cycle of a shutter claimed by the company - 150,000 actuations). For Nikon D800
costs are even lower. Therefore, in terms of camera’s resources the cost of production
of one hour of the most intensive shooting is 10*60*0.016=$9.6. This sum pays
off by additional paid services. Also, we carry on negotiations with potential
sponsors - photo equipment vendors interested in supporting the project if it
proves to be demanded.
3.  Professional models working in two
free photo studios and two low-cost ones – sounds good, but how you are going
to pay them? What is the source of the funds?
We are the
founders of the TopModelGroup.com portal, model agents recruiting and training
models. Among other countries, we also work in several developing economies
where hourly rates are much lower (several and even dozens of times) than in
US, Europe and other developed countries. Such countries are Moldova, Ukraine,
Byelorussia, which is geographically located in Europe, but are actually
developing economies with average monthly salary about $400. 
After finishing
training and before signing an international contract (that means earning real money), our every model must
complete a 6-month probation. During this period they get a salary typical to
the country they live in. At the same time, they are already top-class models
passed through our hard training and possessing stunning looks. Due to the same
reason we don’t have to overpay to such specialists as make up artists and hair
stylists. Our first photo studio will be opened in one of such countries, and
further in other countries too.
4.  Ok, hiring even the best models is
not expensive for you. But what about rental fees for a photo studio? They are
still high. How can you keep prices low and even more – offer free services as
well?
We plan to acquire
ownership of the photo studio, because this will allow us to get rid of monthly
rental fees and therefore minimize prices for end users. Thanks God, real
estate costs are low in the countries we are talking about comparing with USA
or Europe.
Free studios
are funded by paid studios.
5.  What if you won’t receive backing in
full?
All promised
bonuses for our backers will remain valid. Partial funding means we will embody
our idea step by step. Instead of four studios, we will stop on just two (one
Lite and one Pro). The entire process may slow down, but we'll complete it anyway.
6.  What if you will see more backing
than you ask?
In that case
we will equip more photo studios, not just four, in proportion to received funding
in order to supply the demand and grant our bonuses to all contributors faster.

story:
Personal Ties: Bed-Stuy, Brooklyn

Of all the neighborhoods I’ve lived in since I moved to New York City in 1997, none have affected me like Bed-Stuy, Brooklyn. I felt it immediately. Before the moving truck even left the curb I’d made a portrait. That year, in 2015, I started making street portraits of people in Bed-Stuy with my Rolleiflex film camera. At that time, I had no idea how extensive the series would become, or that I would have the opportunity to share it with people in the form of this beautiful book. Although all of my photography projects derive from a personal endearment, these photographs, set in the streets I call home, feel even more so. 

from Personal Ties: Bed-Stuy, Brooklyn

 

Published by Schilt Publishing, Amsterdam

I’m looking for people who also feel a connection to these photographs. I have already successfully fundraised to cover the cost of manufacturing the book on Kickstarter. Now, I would love to keep the option open for people to help me share the book with the Bed-Stuy community. I’m fortunate to partner with Schilt Publishing, a publisher based in in Amsterdam, the Netherlands, with worldwide distribution and an excellent reputation. Throughout the past several months, as we have been working on this project, owner Maarten Schilt and his team have demonstrated a strong commitment to both this book and me as a photographer, and I feel very confident these portraits are in the right hands.

 

About the Book

Personal Ties: Bed-Stuy, Brooklyn is a fine art book of street portraits made in Bedford-Stuyvesant, Brooklyn, with a Rolleiflex film camera from 2015-2018 by Amy Touchette. The approximately 124-page book is 22cm by 26cm and includes roughly 60 color photographs. The foreword was written by legendary photographer Larry Fink and the afterword by third-generation Bed-Stuy resident C. Joi Sanchez. Also included is text I wrote explaining my process and experience making the photographs. Personal Ties: Bed-Stuy, Brooklyn will be released in November 2021 by Schilt Publishing.

 

Fundraising Details

As you might imagine, street photography is not a terribly lucrative pursuit. Every project is a labor of love. Up until a month ago, these photographs were personally financed. I just completed a successful Kickstarter campaign to cover the costs of manufacturing the book. It is such an honor to be surrounded by so much support! But because part of my aim with this book is to share it with the community—Bed-Stuy schools, libraries, and residents—I started this Indiegogo campaign to allow people to continue to donate copies for this very designation.

from Personal Ties: Bed-Stuy, Brooklyn

 

Why This Book

I have always used photography to shine the light on others. Eye contact is a gateway to empathy, and I really believe the more we look at each other, the more likely we are to realize that we are all in this together. Whether I am photographing in Hawaii, Japan, Malaysia, Vietnam, the American South, or in my own adopted backyard in Bed-Stuy Brooklyn, that has always been the goal of my photography projects. I hope we never stop looking at one another, acknowledging one another, and wishing one another the very best. 

from Personal Ties: Bed-Stuy, Brooklyn

 

Praise for Personal Ties: Bed-Stuy, Brooklyn

"Amy Touchette's loving portraits remind us that Brooklyn is still a multi-generational neo-African village in places, and optically Thriving While Black with transparent soul power."

—Greg Tate, Writer and musician

"Amy Touchette has the rarest of gifts, she adores people and photography as much as life itself. People trust her because she is a bright, charming, gentle soul who is as timid as she is brave. Her eye doesn't judge, but while understanding our similarities, she celebrates our differences. Her images may seem as straightforward as she is, but they explore relationships that are fraught with imperfections. Looking at her pictures you will find all the joys and pain of the cards we are dealt."

—Amy Arbus, Photographer

"Amy Touchette represents the new generation of documentary photographers who are contributing to preserving a very important history and culture in this 21st century. Arming herself with a camera and a compassionate heart, she photographed ordinary people in her Bedford-Stuyvesant community, creating intimate portraits of personal ties, kinship, and individuality that are now frozen moments in time."

—Jamel Shabazz, Photographer

from Personal Ties: Bed-Stuy, Brooklyn

 

Publishing & Printing

Personal Ties: Bed-Stuy, Brooklyn will be published this fall by Schilt Publishing, a deliberately small, discerning publishing house based in Amsterdam, the Netherlands. I met owner Maarten Schilt in 2012 at a photo festival, and we have kept in touch ever since. In August 2020, I received an email from Maarten asking if I would like to collaborate on a book. I had been waiting for a special way to present these portraits of Bed-Stuy, which I had made between 2015 and 2018, and was thrilled when Maarten agreed the series would make a wonderful book. It's rare as a photographer to be contacted by a publisher (it's much more common for photographers to proposition publishers), so it is a great honor to have this opportunity. 

 

 

Personal Ties: Bed-Stuy, Brooklyn will be printed at Offizin Scheufele, a state-of-the-art facility in Stuttgart, Germany, that Schilt Publishing uses almost exclusively for their high-quality printing press. Established in 1808, Offizin Scheufele is a family-run business with a tradition of deep enthusiasm for printing that is committed to operating with the least greenhouse gas emissions possible.

Offizin Scheufele printing press in Stuttgart, Germany

 

Recently on View

This portrait from Personal Ties: Bed-Stuy, Brooklyn exhibited in "The Flag Project," a public art installation of images made into 8'x5' flags flown on the iconic flagpoles of Rockefeller Center. A celebration of the spirit of New York City, "The Flag Project" was made in partnership with Aperture Foundation and exhibited March-April 2021. Watch the video to see it in action!

from Personal Ties: Bed-Stuy, Brooklyn

 

Exhibitions

Three photographs from Personal Ties: Bed-Stuy, Brooklyn exhibited at the National Portrait Gallery in London, England, November 2019-February 2020 as part of the Taylor Wessing Photographic Portrait Prize Exhibition.

from Personal Ties: Bed-Stuy, Brooklyn

 

About the Photographer

Amy Touchette is a photographer based in Bed-Stuy, Brooklyn, who specializes in street portraits. Trained at the International Center of Photography, she began her artistic career as a writer and painter, earning a BA in Literature and Studio Art and an MA in Literature. Amy’s first monograph, Shoot the Arrow: A Portrait of The World Famous *BOB*, was published by Un-Gyve Press in 2013. Other book publications include Women Street Photographers (Prestel, 2021) and Brooklyn Photographs Now (Rizzoli, 2018). BuzzFeed called her "a master of street photography in the busiest of concrete jungles, New York City." She’s represented by ClampArt in New York City and Little Big Galerie in Paris, France. For a more extensive bio, please visit www.amytouchette.com. 

A boy in Bed-Stuy photographs Amy Touchette with her Rolleiflex 

 

—PERKS—

$50: DONATION OF SIGNED, FIRST-EDITION BOOK TO BED-STUY COMMUNITY

Donate a first-edition copy of the book to a NYC school library, public library, or to the Bed-Stuy community.

 

$75: PERSONAL DONATION OF SIGNED, FIRST-EDITION BOOK TO BED-STUY COMMUNITY

Personally designate where a donated book should go: to a specific NYC school or library, or to the Bed-Stuy community. Your name will be inscribed inside the book after "kindly donated by."

story:
A Little Bit of Alaska for You

About a year ago, I began writing a few hiking guides to some less traveled areas in the state. Now, with your help, I am greatly expanding my online Alaska hiking and travel guide at lwpetersen.com.

Aurora borealis over Angel Rocks near Fairbanks - See the Angel Rocks Hiking Guide here

Here are a few aspects this site includes:

  • Alaska hiking and travel guide
  • Aurora borealis photography and general photography guides and tutorials
  • Alaska wildflower identification guide
  • Science, aurora, atmospheric optics, and geology information about Alaska

 

My goal is to keep all of this information free and accessible to anyone. However, it's also quite expensive and time-consuming. I make a trickle of money from advertising and photo sales, but right now, it's far from break-even. Additionally, I have many side projects on the website that I'm also trying to start or expand on. This campaign aims to raise money to help with web hosting fees, equipment, and travel costs. Ultimately, your support helps me have the time to sit down and add more content quickly!

I've lived in Alaska for almost eleven years now. This is my way of sharing the experience with you and help you find your own experiences here!

Hiking Guide and Travel Info

Right now, the guide includes about 30 hikes and destinations, all including maps with route info and detailed information about the area. Currently, I have 50 more on the drawing board or in draft, and plenty more destinations in mind over just the next year.

I try to focus on the less popular "tourist" destinations. Difficulty and risks are highlighted in each description, and I heavily advocate for traveling responsibly and following Leave No Trace principles. I hope to publish a physical guidebook in about 3 years.

View of the Exit Glacier from the Harding Icefield Trail in Kenai Fjords National Park

Alaska Wildflower Guide

This has been one of the most rewarding side-projects to grow out of the guide. I've been photographing and compiling an informative identification guide for flowers in Alaska. Users can browse flowers by color to help with identification, and currently, there are over 400 photos in the guide.

The information contained with identifying photos includes classification, uses or edibility, description of flower, leaves, stem, roots, and information on the plant's distribution and habitat. 

Photography Tutorials - Aurora Borealis

I've been photographing the northern lights here in Fairbanks for 10 years now, so I'm taking the opportunity to share what I've learned over that time with my Learn Page. Right now, I have covered camera settings with examples, focus and setup, and post-processing information. I'm hoping that I will be able to add some tutorial videos over the next year!

Science - Aurora, Optics, Geology, and More

Science is the newest addition to the website. I find this funny now because when I started this website, it was originally called "Physics in Alaska," and it was a blog about living in Alaska while going to graduate school for physics. Well, with my physics background and previous glaciology fieldwork, I'd like to share some of what I've learned over the years. Most of the articles are naturally going to be Alaska-themed. Some examples are ice crystal formations in glacier caves, what causes the aurora borealis, and how our unique atmospheric (cold) conditions create all sorts of optical effects like light pillars.

A light pillar display over the city of Fairbanks

What I Need & What You Get

I'm looking to raise enough money for website registration fees for 3 years at the bare minimum. Paying for three years of registration up-front saves me well over $200/year, and I don't have to worry about the looming bill every month. That will only take roughly $2500 in fundraising, and I will be ecstatic if I can hit that. Beyond that, every little bit counts. Equipment expenses (camera, outdoor, safety), GPS upgrades for mapping ($600 one-time), Garmin InReach subscription fees ($600/year), park passes ($150/year annual passes), park fees and other fees (approx. $500/year), gas money, and all the little things really add up. Also, every dollar raised helps me afford the time to sit down and write more!

I'm offering a number of prints and wall art from my website at Lee Petersen Photography as perks for helping me out. These are all printed by Bay Photo and shipped directly to you. I have paper prints, float metal prints, and acrylic prints available here. You can also opt for a postcard which I will send with a bit of info and GPS coordinates of the location so you can find it if you visit Alaska.

Risks & Challenges

As far as rewards go for you, there are no risks. I already operate an online shop selling prints. My biggest challenge is finding people willing to donate for content they can easily view for free. Of course, even if I raise nothing, I'll keep making guides because I enjoy doing it, and I want them to be accessible to everyone. However, creation will be much slower.

Other Ways You Can Help

Oh man, there are so many ways you can help. The number one thing you can do is by word of mouth! Encourage others to follow me on social media:

  • Facebook
  • Instagram
  • Twitter

I also have a donation or subscription page on Ko-fi where you can make a single payment donation or pay a monthly subscription price that you set.

I have many print products and wall art available to order directly on my website Lee Petersen Photography. Photo sales don't just support me financially, but they are enormously encouraging and even help direct future projects!

You can subscribe to my e-mail newsletter (like 2 or 3 times a month tops - usually less).

If you know anyone planning on travel to Alaska, be sure to send them to my website!

story:
The book is now available in our webshop: http://www.ohaapala.com/shop

Kirja on nyt saatavilla verkkokaupastamme: http://www.ohaapala.com/shop

 

(Tiivistelmä suomeksi sivun lopussa – Summary in Finnish below)
 

Realising our dream

10 years of photography in one beautiful book
 

We are portrait photographers Saara Salmi and Marco Melander. Together we formed the Neo-Victorian Photo Studio Atelieri O. Haapala, which was active between the years 2008–2016. We shot over 7,000 portraits, attending dozens of vintage events and burlesque parties.

Making a book out of these portraits was our plan from the very beginning. Now that Atelieri O. Haapala is nearing its tenth birthday in late 2018, we believe it is the perfect time to make that dream a reality. Finally!

Now we are getting together for the very last time to make this book. We are only going to have one shot at this. If we can't make this book now, it will never be done. Please help us!

We have managed to gather an amazing, super-qualified team to help us with this book. The book will be edited by curator Maria Faarinen (The Finnish Museum of Photography) and Lassi Patokorpi (International Committee of Museums Finland), a specialist in material culture. The visual appearance will be made by the super-talented graphic designer Paula Laitinen. What's more, apart from our team being top-notch in what they do, they have participated in our project in different ways during the years. That is to say: they know our project, our style and what we want to accomplish. We believe this will ensure we get the finest end product imaginable, truly done with passion and commitment.

The book will be out in September 2018.

What We Need

Your backing will help us cover the following expenditures (calculated according to an edition of 1000):

  • Printing 13,000€
    • Superb paper and print quality
    • Proper colour balancing
    • Embossing and gilding for the cover – to make it look like a cabinet card!
    • Quality control
  • Design 6,000€
    • Outrageously exquisite graphic design true to our Neo-Victorian aesthetic by graphic designer Paula Laitinen
  • Writing and editing 4,000€
    • Professional curating and editing of the content by Maria Faarinen and Lassi Patokorpi
    • Two in-depth essays on Atelieri O. Haapala
  • Translations 1,500€
    • Professional proof reading and translations
  • Packaging, marketing, operating costs, fees 1,000€

The Finnish Arts Council is supporting our project with an additional 8,000€. The grant is aimed at ensuring the best possible print quality for a photographic publication. We are very thankful for the support. This will definitely help us achieve the best results!

Altogether we are using 25,500€, with hopefully 17,500€ coming from you guys!

The book will be printed in August 2018 and it is ready in September 2018. We start to ship them around this time.

What You Get

Atelieri O. Haapala – Neo-Victorian Photography is going to be an exclusive, hard-cover photo book of 250 pages. It will feature a carefully curated selection of 200 full-colour pictures as well as two professionally written essays 5 pages each. The edition will be 1,000 – unless we exceed our goal and we get to make more. We would love to make more!

YOU can help US make our dream of the Atelieri O. Haapala book a reality – and in return YOU get a gorgeous, amazing coffee-table book to show for it. We strive passionately above all for beauty and quality. This is going to be no ordinary book but a luxurious tome of impeccable visual splendour!

To support us, we have a selection of perks for you to choose from:

POSTCARD 5€
When did you last receive a card? Get that nostalgic feeling again with this perk. Saara and Marco will send you a postcard with a hand written personal thanks and greetings.

PRINT 25€
Don't want a book but love our work? Pledge this for an A4-sized archival quality print. Choose from five different pictures (link to selection in the story section).
VIEW SELECTION

THE BOOK 50€
A copy of the book, no more, no less! Atelieri O. Haapala – Neo-Victorian Photography. Hardcover. 250 pages.

THE BOOK, SIGNED 60€
This is what it's all about! A copy of our book, individually signed by yours truly, Saara and Marco. Atelieri O. Haapala – Neo-Victorian Photography. Hardcover. 250 pages.

2 x THE BOOK, SIGNED 110€
Get one for yourself, gift the other! Two copies of the book, both signed by Saara and Marco. Atelieri O. Haapala – Neo-Victorian Photography. Hardcover. 250 pages.

3 x THE BOOK, SIGNED 150€
Gifts Galore! Three books, all signed by Saara and Marco! Atelieri O. Haapala – Neo-Victorian Photography. Hardcover. 250 pages.

PRIVATE PHOTOSHOOT 550€
A rare opportunity. Your very own private photoshoot at our studio in Helsinki. Includes 3 edited photographs digital + print (15x20cm) + signed book. We don't do these anymore, it's your final chance! Contact us for more details.

LIMITED EDITION PRINT 2000€
A limited edition, museum quality, framed print ~60x90cm (approx. 23x35'') that has toured in four exhibitions. The prints are limited to an edition of 5. Includes international shipping and a signed book. See the link to details in the story section where all our perks are featured! Please contact for shipping and more information!
VIEW SELECTION

PHOTO BOOTH (FINLAND) 3000€
A service we are known for the best. A four-hour-long, exclusive photoshoot for your party or event. The perfect way to immortalise your guests. Choose your backdrop. We don't do these anymore, so get yours now! Contact for more details!

PHOTO BOOTH (ABROAD) 4000€
A service we are known for the best. A four-hour-long, exclusive photoshoot for your party or event. The perfect way to immortalise your guests. Choose your backdrop. We don't do these anymore, so get yours now! Contact for more details!

 

 Our Dream Team

We have a great collective track record for the manifold projects we have taken part in over the years. Get to know our team below!

Marco Melander is a professional photographer, graduated as Master of Arts from Aalto University in Photography in 2006. He was the picture editor of the book Himo, rakkaus ja raivo, which won the Most Beautiful Book of the Year award in 2006. Apart from Atelieri O. Haapala, he is best known for his photographic work with Finnish design icons such as Stefan Lindfors, Yrjö Kukkapuro and Harri Koskinen. Marco's strong professional history formed the backbone of Atelieri's ouvre.

 

Saara Salmi is a visual artist and photographer, graduated from Tampere School of Art and Media in Visual Design in 2006. She has designed and photographed advertisements for The Finnish National Opera & Ballet and she has been represented in over a dozen exhibitions all over the world. Her manifold artistic talents, whether traditional or digital, have been essential to Atelieri O. Haapala's success.

 

Maria Faarinen works as a curator at The Finnish Museum of Photography. Maria received her M.A. in Art History from the University of Jyväskylä. Over the years her writings have appeared in many different publications. In 2012 she delivered a book based on archival research about the documentary photographer, photojournalist K-G Roos (1937-1976). At the moment she takes a part in the international exchanges and mentorships program Parallel - European photo based platform as an emerging curator.

 

Lassi Patokorpi is the foremost expert on vintage culture in Finland. He has a Master's degree in English Philology with minors in History and Museology. He has produced swaths of lectures, articles, public events, costume designs, translations and exhibitions since 2010. He is currently a Board Member and Project Manager at the International Committee of Museums Finland. Lassi has been collaborating with Atelieri O. Haapala since 2011, doing mostly translations and costuming.

 

Paula Laitinen is a graphic designer (B.A.) who has designed books, magazine layouts and poster illustrations. With a day job as a designer and an over 10-year career as a burlesque performer she has a passion for typography, glittery things and old time glamour. Paula has also modelled for Atelieri O. Haapala in a number of works over the years.

 

 

Shortly about the Challenges

We are going to publish the book ourselves (through our own publisher we founded), and that is not a cakewalk! In fact, at the very beginning we went to talk to a few established publishers. Very soon we realised, though, that in order to achieve the best quality and to make the book just like we want it, we would have to commit more money and more effort in the project than what the publisher was prepared for. And that is why we need you.

Publishing a book on our own is not going to be without its drawbacks. For example:

  • No distribution channels apart from Indiegogo and our own contacts
  • No contracts with parcel companies means somewhat higher shipping rates
  • Countless hours of work to keep everything running accordingly

Our dream will keep us going, and in spite of the challenges, we know we can do it – with your help!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to pledge, you can still help! Please spread the word by sharing the campaign on social media and talking about it with your friends. Thank you!

 

 

***

 

Lyhyesti suomeksi:

Unelmista totta – kymmenen vuoden kuvat yksissä lumoavissa kansissa

 

Olemme muotokuvaajat Saara Salmi ja Marco Melander. Yhdessä muodostimme uusviktoriaanisen valokuvaamon nimeltä Atelieri O. Haapala, joka oli aktiivinen vuosina 2008–2017. Näiden vuosien aikana kuvasimme yli 7 000 muotokuvaa sekä otimme osaa kymmeniin erilaisiin vintage- ja burleskitapahtumiin.

Kirjan tekeminen näistä kuvista kuului suunnitelmiimme jo alusta pitäen. Kun Atelieri O. Haapalan kymmenvuotissyntymäpäivät lähenevät, uskomme ajan olevan kypsä kirjan toteuttamiselle. Vihdoinkin!

Yhdistämme voimamme vielä yhden kerran – nyt – tehdäksemme tämän kirjan. Meillä on vain yksi mahdollisuuus tehdä tästä totta. Jos kirjaa ei saada nyt aikaiseksi, sitä tullaan tuskin koskaan tekemään. Auta meitä siis toteuttamaan unelmamme!

Tehdäksemme kirjan...

… tarvitsemme teidän apuanne! Tukenne menee seuraavien, alla listattujen kulujen kattamiseen (painosmäärä 1000 kappaletta):

  • Painotyö 13 000€
  • Suunnittelu 6 000€
  • Toimitus- ja kirjoitustyö 4 000€
  • Käännökset 1 500€
  • Paketointi, markkinointi ja toimistokulut 1 000€

Teidän lisäksenne Taiteen edistämiskeskus TAIKE tukee projektiamme 8 000 euron summalla. Meille myönnetty valokuvataiteen laatutuki on tarkoitettu valokuvakirjojen painolaadun takaamiseen. Olemme hyvin kiitollisia saamastamme luottamuksesta ja laatutuki tulee varmasti takaamaan teoksen korkean tason.

Yhteensä olemme käyttämässä kirjaan 25 500€, josta noin 17 500€ saadaan kasaan teidän tuellanne!

Vastalahjana teille...

… on tuleva tietysti kirja! Atelieri O. Haapala – Neo-Victorian Photography. Kirjasta tulee korumaisen upea kahvipöytäkirja, kaksikielinen (suomi/englanti) ja siinä tulee olemaan 250 sivua. Sivut tulee täyttämään tarkoin valitut 200 täysvärikuvaa sekä kaksi viisisivuista esseetä Atelieri O. Haapalan maailmasta. Kirjoja painetaan 1 000 kappaletta ellemme ylitä tavoitettamme, jolloin tietysti kasvatamme painosmäärää!

Kirjan ohella on sinulla myös mahdollisuus hankkia muita etuja, kuten printtejä, vedoksia tai kuvauksia. Näihin voit tutustua sivun oikeassa laidassa (perks).

Sinulla on nyt mahdollisuus auttaa meitä toteuttamaan unelmamme Atelieri O. Haapala -kirjasta. Vastalahjaksi saat lumoavan kauniin ja erittäin laadukkaan kahvipöytäkirjan. Pyrkimyksemme on tehdä opuksesta Suomen kaunein kirja 2018 – ja vain sinä voit auttaa!

Jos jokin asia jäi vielä askarruttamaan, niin ota meihin rohkeasti yhteyttä suoraan sähköpostiimme info@ohaapala.com. 

Ystävällisin terveisin,

Saara ja Marco

story:
Tony's Camera needs your help.  I am working on  a collection of photos.  It will include some of my previous work and some shoots I currently have planned.  


 I am raising funds to pay for my upcoming shoots and to have the collection professionally printed for a gallery showing.  In exchange  for  contributions to my campaign I am offering prints of my photos and my services as a photographer. I would appreciate your contributions. I would also appreciate any help spreading the word about my campaign. Please share this with anyone else that you think might be  interested.
story_txt: Tony's Camera needs your help.  I am working on  a collection of photos.  It will include some of my previous work and some shoots I currently have planned.   I am raising funds to pay for my upcoming shoots and to have the collection professionally printed for a gallery showing.  In exchange  for  contributions to my campaign I am offering prints of my photos and my services as a photographer. I would appreciate your contributions. I would also appreciate any help spreading the word about my campaign. Please share this with anyone else that you think might be  interested.

story:
APPARITIONS

apparition |ˌapəˈri sh ən|

noun

• a ghost or ghostlike image of a person.

• the appearance of something remarkable or unexpected

UPDATE...We've surpassed the goal! Thank you to all my supporters!!! But, It isn't over till it's over, and I still really need you. Every dollar that comes in goes to enhance the book, and support my work. The price of the book may rise when it hits the streets, and pre-ordering now with your contribution ensures that you'll receive it at the best price, and before the holiday season. Thanks again. —Reuben Radding

I always remember my first year of living in New York City, back in 1988. I was a few months from turning 22, and it was like stepping into an intense, bewildering movie, after an endless childhood in suburbia. The show was non-stop, 24-7. Every time I walked out my door something remarkable seemed to happen. I fell completely in love with the city, even when I hated it. I fed on its energy and variety. I felt like I was finally someplace real, and yet, the appartions around me were so unreal.

For the past several years I have been photographing life on the streets of New York City, almost daily. At first I just wanted to capture the oddities and outrageous sights I encountered in my daily routines, but as my dedication increased I began going out specifically to find and photograph the unlikely moments, memorable faces, and unexpected phenomenon that make life here so special to me. At this point, shooting the streets is the central focus of my life, an obsession like no other, and I'm ready to put the best of the work I've been doing into the form of a book: APPARITIONS.

In the past I have had photos of mine see publication on blogs like The Huffington Post, Gothamist, and NPR.org, and I've had work in group shows in Los Angeles, and at the Miami Street Photography Festival. Over the course of the last couple years, commenters on my photos on Flickr and Facebook have urged me to make a book, but until recently I wasn't ready. Now that I have a lot more photos to choose from, and the requests for a book have been growing louder and more frequent, I've decided the time is now.

I'll be publishing APPARITIONS myself in November of 2013, with an afterward by the transcendent writer & musician Keir Neuringer. 

CAMPAIGN

I'm completely committed to making this book. To do it right I need your collaboration. If I can raise my goal of $5000, it will provide me with much needed resources for the final shooting, editing and printing of APPARITIONS, and allow me to develop and scan a backlog of exposed film. Your financial support will enable me to make a better book, one that we all will enjoy sharing with others for a long time. It's very exciting to me to make an actual physical book that you can hold in your hands. It's my favorite way to experience the photography I admire, and it's the way I've always imagined sharing what I do.

PERKS FOR YOU

For anyone who contributes at least $10 I have small prints of my work to offer you, and contributors of $30 or more receive an advance copy of the book itself. At other levels of contribution I'm offering more prints, portrait sessions, and even one-on-one lessons in shooting on the streets of NYC. This summer I created the curriculum on street photography for the New York Institute of Photography as part of their new photojournalism intensive. I have a lot to share with you.

SPREAD THE WORD

Please help me get the word out about this project. Indiegogo provides some easy tools for sharing. If you know people you think will be interested in seeing APPARITIONS see the light of day, please let them know about this campaign. It would mean a great deal to me.

UPDATE...We've surpassed the goal! Thank you to all my supporters!!! But, It isn't over till it's over, and I still really need you. Every dollar that comes in goes to enhance the book, and support my work. The price of the book may rise when it hits the streets, and pre-ordering now with your contribution ensures that you'll receive it at the best price, and before the holiday season. Thanks again. —Reuben Radding
I always remember my first year of living in New York City, back in 1988. I was a few months from turning 22, and it was like stepping into an intense, bewildering movie, after an endless childhood in suburbia. The show was non-stop, 24-7. Every time I walked out my door something remarkable seemed to happen. I fell completely in love with the city, even when I hated it. I fed on its energy and variety. I felt like I was finally someplace real, and yet, the appartions around me were so unreal.
For the past several years I have been photographing life on the streets of New York City, almost daily. At first I just wanted to capture the oddities and outrageous sights I encountered in my daily routines, but as my dedication increased I began going out specifically to find and photograph the unlikely moments, memorable faces, and unexpected phenomenon that make life here so special to me. At this point, shooting the streets is the central focus of my life, an obsession like no other, and I'm ready to put the best of the work I've been doing into the form of a book: APPARITIONS.
In the past I have had photos of mine see publication on blogs like The Huffington Post, Gothamist, and NPR.org, and I've had work in group shows in Los Angeles, and at the Miami Street Photography Festival. Over the course of the last couple years, commenters on my photos on Flickr and Facebook have urged me to make a book, but until recently I wasn't ready. Now that I have a lot more photos to choose from, and the requests for a book have been growing louder and more frequent, I've decided the time is now.
I'll be publishing APPARITIONS myself in November of 2013, with an afterward by the transcendent writer & musician Keir Neuringer. 
CAMPAIGN



I'm completely committed to making this book. To do it right I need your collaboration. If I can raise my goal of $5000, it will provide me with much needed resources for the final shooting, editing and printing of APPARITIONS, and allow me to develop and scan a backlog of exposed film. Your financial support will enable me to make a better book, one that we all will enjoy sharing with others for a long time. It's very exciting to me to make an actual physical book that you can hold in your hands. It's my favorite way to experience the photography I admire, and it's the way I've always imagined sharing what I do.



PERKS FOR YOU
For anyone who contributes at least $10 I have small prints of my work to offer you, and contributors of $30 or more receive an advance copy of the book itself. At other levels of contribution I'm offering more prints, portrait sessions, and even one-on-one lessons in shooting on the streets of NYC. This summer I created the curriculum on street photography for the New York Institute of Photography as part of their new photojournalism intensive. I have a lot to share with you.



SPREAD THE WORD
Please help me get the word out about this project. Indiegogo provides some easy tools for sharing. If you know people you think will be interested in seeing APPARITIONS see the light of day, please let them know about this campaign. It would mean a great deal to me.

story:
‘Interim’ is a photography collective of seven photographers currently completing our third year BA (Hons) Photography degree at Edinburgh Napier University. We have come together to showcase our individual styles and skills within the over-arching theme of ‘in-between’. To the creative such a theme offers a wide spectrum of possibilities, which will result in a diverse and thought-provoking collection of work.

As newcomers to the photography industry, this will be our first full self-organised exhibition from conception to execution.

The funds raised will allow us to cover expenses involved in the running costs of our exhibition.

Collective members:

Megan McCrystal // www.facebook.com/meganmccrystalphotography 

Kelly Muir // www.facebook.com/KellyMuirPhotography

Ailsa Kerr // www.facebook.com/ailsakerrphotography

Cameron MacDonald // www.cameronmacdonaldimaging.wordpress.com

Hannah Burt // www.facebook.com/HannahBurtPhotography

Hayley Buyers // www.facebook.com/hayleybuyersphotography

Louise Augusta // www.eyeym.com/u/augustamoen

To keep up to date on our progress or to contact us, please visit our Facebook, Instagram or email us at interim2017@hotmail.com

www.facebook.com/interimcollective

www.instagram.com/interim_collective

What We Need & What You Get

We are aiming to raise a total of £800. This money will go towards costs involved in venue hire, printing, framing, advertising and much more.

In order to thank you for any donations, we are offering a variety of different perks for you to choose from.

Other Ways You Can Help

Although donations are much appreciated, we would also be grateful if you could take the time and spread the word about our exhibition. You can do this by sharing our IndieGoGo page and our Facebook page, following us on Instagram and bringing your friends along with you to our event

story:
THE PHOTOGRAPHY PROJECT

P721K is a Brooklyn Special Education High School. The Student Council of 721K is looking forward to providing P721K students and staff with a professional photography experience. Through The Photography Project, 721K students will build the skills necessary to operate a digital photography studio. The objective of The Photography Project is to introduce students to a professional operational environment that will help develop skills and knowledge. The Photography Project will be successful at providing the students with work experience as well as insight to possible career options. The students will develop skills to follow task, pay attention to detail, and the importance of working on a team. 

This year we have held two photography events in the building, both of which were very successful. We have seen a growth in interest from both students and staff in the field of photography. We as a school would love the opportunity to explore this field further. With The Photography Program we can help students develop the skills necessary to working in a photography studio, while teaching them the importance of visual documentation. 

We have seen the success and now we are seeking to expand The Photography Project to provide the opportunity to all the students at P721K. Our proposal requests $4000 in funding to obtain a professional camera, hardware, software, and the appropriate computer to keep The Photography Project going. With the equipment we are requesting The Photography Project will be able to function more efficiently. 

The Impact

The Photography Project is seeking funding to expand. The objectives of The Photography Project provide our students with skills that stem further then just photography. They will attain skills in working with computers, navigating software, working on team projects, leading, and directing various tasks. They will start to develop work experience and gain information that can later be added to a resume. Our proposal is influenced by our previous experience with out photography events in the school building. Funding in the amount of $4000 is requested for proper equipment and hardware that will remain reserved for student council members and various students at P721K.

 

Please help make our project possible. 

Thanks!

story:
We are a group of graduation exhibition students who are passionate about their photography. This is our first show.

We are also passionate about the Heartfelt organisation who are volunteer photographers supporting grieving families. 

Visit http://www.heartfelt.org.au find out more about the fabulous work that they do.

Not only will the funds we raise go towards launching our exhibition, but part proceeds will go a long way to supporting Heartfelt and raising their profile amongst the community in South Australia. When our exhibition has finished, your contribution will still be continuing by supporting the magnificent work that Heartfelt accomplish.

Even if you can’t contribute financially, please spread and share the word of what we’re wanting to accomplish for Heartfelt, remember, they are making an incredible difference in our community and your support will ensure that their work continues. Voluntary organisations need volunteers!

We hope to sell a lot of our work because we are also donating part of these proceeds to Heartfelt and any money we raise above our goal, will be donated in full to Heartfelt. 

Not only does your money go to support the arts but your donation also goes back into your community.

story:
My Project:

Hi! My name is Mathea Millman and I am a senior Cinema & Photography major at Ithaca College. This semester I am in the Photo Workshop class which is the capstone photo class for my major. The goal of the course is to explore a photographic project over the entire semester and at the end create an exhibition to display the work. My photo class is having our group exhibition on December 14th, 2012 from 6pm-9pm at the Ithaca Business Campus (across the street from the main entrance of IC on Route 96B).

My project is based around the idea of feminine identity of adolescents as explored through portraiture. I am working with a group of high school girls to photograph and observe how they interact with each other and how they individually present themselves in front of a lens. Their self-awareness when being photographed is constantly in flux depending on who they are with, where they are, and how the photographer/subject relationship develops over time. 

I am shooting large format film (my negatives are 4 inches by 5 inches) and hope to exhibit my pictures printed large and framed. Shooting large format is a relatively slow process and each image takes a lot of consideration. By photographing portraits in this medium, each subject becomes very self-aware that they are having their picture taken. This creates an interesting dynamic in the collaborative process that makes the portrait unique to this specific type of photography. 

 

Artist's Statement (work in progress):

Adolescent girls are constantly confronted with images of model ideals and the perfect woman in contemporary media. Because of this, new conceptions of representation emerge out of a constant need or compulsion to self-curate. They become hyper-aware of how they are presented to the world and how others are presented based on unattainable ideals. These external standards and pressures are influencing factors on the development of self-awareness. 

 

The Impact:

This project is truly the culmination of a semester-long collaborative endeavor. The girls that I have been working with have given up countless hours to photograph and to explore these themes with me. I hope to encourage and inspire these girls as well as other young adolescent girls to open up a dialogue with each other about self presentation and a positive self-awareness that is based on affirmations of each other rather than an affirmation of adhering to societal standards. 

 

Your contribution helps fund the purchase of...

-The 4x5 film

-The print. Each image has to be printed individually on a special large inkjet printer. This covers the cost of the paper and ink. 

-The Frame. Each print has to be framed. This covers the cost of matting each image as well as the frame itself, which is the largest expense of the project. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

Help spread the word about my project! Share the link on facebook, twitter, tumblr or email! 

Come show your support at the exhibition on December 14th! Can't wait to see you there!

story:
My name is Jay Belloli.  I have been a contemporary art curator or director at a number of museums in the United States.  In 1984 I was director of a gallery at Caltech.  I went to NASA's nearby Jet Propulsion Laboratory with ideas for an exhibition, saw the photographs sent back from JPL spacecraft, and my life completely changed.

I have now organized four international astronomy exhibitions.  My interest has kept coming back to Mars, because it is the only other planet in our solar system that could support human life.  And the more spacecraft go to the Red Planet, the more fascinating it becomes.   The existence of former streams and lakes have been discovered, maybe even a former ocean.

It was very important to me that people understand what amazing discoveries have been made about Mars, from astronomy drawings as early as 1659 through photographs coming in now from the Curiosity Rover.  And that people see the great Mars videos.  

And it was important to me that people understand Mars has impacted popular culture.  The astronomer Percival Lowell in the late 19th century thought he saw canals on Mars, which meant a past or present civilization.  Famous writer H.G. Wells took that idea and wrote the classic "The War of the Worlds," and Mars became part of pop culture. Many more wonderful Mars science fiction novels followed, numerous popular press articles, and finally the great Mars science fiction films starting in the 1950s.  These pop culture materials are also in the exhibition.

As a contributor, you will literally will make the exhibition possible: the printing, matting, and framing of the photographs, drawings, and film posters; the research assistant for the show; and the editing, design, and printing for the exhibition catalogue. The catalogue will have fascinating interviews with two JPL scientists and a world expert on Mars science fiction.  The budget for the exhibition is below.

"Mars; Astronomy and Culture" is part of the Pasadena Arts Council Fiscal Sponsorship Program, so all donations are tax-deductible.  If you contribute $25, I'll send you a color Mars photograph.  $50, two color Mars photographs; $100, a signed copy of the catalogue; $250, two astronomy exhibition catalogues; $500, the two catalogues and a matted Mars photo; $1,000 the two catalogues, and a framed Mars photo, and your name will be listed in the catalogue; $2,500, all of that plus a private tour of the exhibition with me, and lunch; $5,000, all of that, and a JPL scientist involved with Mars will join us for lunch;  $10,000 all of that, and I will fly you to Pasadena at my expense for the tour and lunch with the scientist and me. 

The exhibition will be at the Williamson Gallery at Art Center College of Design in Pasadena, California, close to JPL.  It will open Friday October 13, 2017, 6-10 p.m. and be on view through mid-January.  If you don't live far away, you will be able to see the show yourself.  Art Center will cover all the on-site expenses for the exhibition.

MARS: ASTRONOMY AND CULTURE EXHIBITION BUDGET

Mars exhibition assistant (independent Curatorial Assistant Jennifer Gunlock,

Curatorial Assistant on The History of Space Photography exhibition)                                      $3,000

Printing, matting and framing of Mars astronomical photographs and drawings,

and science fiction film posters                                                                                                                  $9,000

Mars exhibition catalogue design (free-lance graphic designer Sabina Dinsmoor,

who designed The History of Space Photography exhibition catalogue)                                   $5,000

Mars catalogue editing (Karen Jacobson, well-respected free-lance Art Editor

In Southern California)                                                                                                                                   $3,200

Mars catalogue printing, initial run of 200 copies

(Create Space, publication printing division of Amazon)                                                                $3,000                     

TOTAL FUNDS NEED TO BE RAISED                                                                                                     $23,200

Art Center College of Design covers installation, P.R., invitation, opening,

and security for the exhibition

TOTAL PAID BY ART CENTER COLLEGE OF DESIGN                                                                      $22,700

TOTAL MARS: ASTRONOMY AND CULTURE BUDGET                                                                   $45,900

If "Mars: Astronomy and Culture" doesn't meet its $23,200 goal, all funds will be refunded to contributors. 

You can help the exhibition happen even if you can't contribute.  Get the word out and make some noise about "Mars: Astronomy and Culture." Use the Indiegogo share tools!

I hope you will join with me to bring Mars astronomy and Mars pop culture to the public.

Much thanks and best regards,

Jay Belloli, Mars Exhibition Curator

jaybelloli@yahoo.com

story:
Are you passionate about Africa? Do you want to see the narrative of African stories change from negative to positive? Do you want to read these stories from an African Journalist? This is the right campaign to support!! 

My name is Maureen Agena, I am from Africa, a Ugandan by nationality but currently working and living in the Netherlands.

This campaign is to help one of Africa's top photojournalist Edward Echwalu recover all his camera gear valued at approximately ($20,000) that was stolen from him on 20th June 2013 in Kampala the capital city of Uganda amidst riots by Uganda taxi operators, protesting increased operation fees. Stolen amidst the chaotic event was Canon; 1D Mark IV, Canon 5D Mark II, Canon 16-35mm f2.8, Canon 24-70mm f2.8, Canon 70-200mm f2.8, Two hard drives, MacBook Pro 15 Inch, Two Pairs of  Sandisks 8GB memory Cards, Batteries for the cameras and other accessories.

 Edward has been at the fore-front of nearly every major story in Uganda for the past five  years. Edward Echwalu is a Ugandan freelance professional photojournalist with Reuters, Irin News and The Observer (Uganda).  He was 1st Runner-Up, CNN Multichoice African Journalist of the Year Awards 2012 (Muhammed Amin Photographic Award - http://edition.cnn.com/WORLD/africa/africanawards/finalists_2012.html ). He’s also the winner of Uganda's prestigious Cranimer Mugerwa Photojournalism Award 2009 (http://www.newvision.co.ug/D/8/13/687819 ) and a top 10 finalist in the Africa Caribbean Pacific (ACP) Courier Photo Competition 2010. This is his blog: http://echwaluphotography.wordpress.com/

Your Contribution towards this noble cause will encourage him to continue documenting the African stories through powerful documentary photography and to remind him of the thousands who appreciate his amazing work. Africa as a continent has very few professional photographers, a statistic that is worse in Uganda. Uganda, composed of a largely illiterate population consume their news through radio and visual platform in which Edward Echwalu comes in handy. For as long as he remains without his working tools, potentially a population of 34 million is denied a chance to be informed, to be educated and a chance to be part of the democratic process of their country.

We need to raise $15,000 to contribute to Echwalu and enable him replace his stolen gear but also purchase better quality one. He is willing to top up whatever cannot be raised here but he will be greatful to have it all raised. We need to purchase Canon 1D Mark IV and Canon 5D Mark II as well as lenses: Canon 24-70mm f2.8, Canon 16-35mm f2.8 and 70-200mm f2.8.

We aso have special and unique perks for you among which include: A framed and signed portrait from one of Africa’s finest photographers, A free photo shoot when you visit Uganda, A CD with a collection of 10 of the pictures taken by Echwalu around Africa. Signed Soft Copy of your favourite picture on his blog.

This project is so valuable because for many reason; the African narrative has been characterized by pictures of disease, war, starvation and crime yet there is a positive side to the life on this continent. Helping a photojournalist like Edward tell the positive side to the story will help in educating many more about Africa but also tell the African story as an African Journalist.

This is the very first online campaign we are engaging in as most of them have been offline and successful. An example was fundraising for Landslide victims in Eastern Uganda in 2012 and also fundraising for the Nodding Disease children in Northern Uganda. I hope this will be a success.

We are aware that not each one of you is able to contribute money but we appreciate other ways of contribution like sharing this cause with your networks and encouraging others to contribute. Whatever the contribution, we shall appreciate. Indiegogo has a number of share tools that you can use.

Are you passionate about Africa? Do you want to see the narrative of African stories change from negative to positive? Do you want to read these stories from an African Journalist? This is the right campaign to support!! 
My name is Maureen Agena, I am from Africa, a Ugandan by nationality but currently working and living in the Netherlands. 
This campaign is to help one of Africa's top photojournalist Edward Echwalu recover all his camera gear valued at approximately ($20,000) that was stolen from him on 20th June 2013 in Kampala the capital city of Uganda amidst riots by Uganda taxi operators, protesting increased operation fees. Stolen amidst the chaotic event was Canon; 1D Mark IV, Canon 5D Mark II, Canon 16-35mm f2.8, Canon 24-70mm f2.8, Canon 70-200mm f2.8, Two hard drives, MacBook Pro 15 Inch, Two Pairs of  Sandisks 8GB memory Cards, Batteries for the cameras and other accessories.
 Edward has been at the fore-front of nearly every major story in Uganda for the past five  years. Edward Echwalu is a Ugandan freelance professional photojournalist with Reuters, Irin News and The Observer (Uganda).  He was 1st Runner-Up, CNN Multichoice African Journalist of the Year Awards 2012 (Muhammed Amin Photographic Award - http://edition.cnn.com/WORLD/africa/africanawards/finalists_2012.html ). He’s also the winner of Uganda's prestigious Cranimer Mugerwa Photojournalism Award 2009 (http://www.newvision.co.ug/D/8/13/687819 ) and a top 10 finalist in the Africa Caribbean Pacific (ACP) Courier Photo Competition 2010. This is his blog: http://echwaluphotography.wordpress.com/
Your Contribution towards this noble cause will encourage him to continue documenting the African stories through powerful documentary photography and to remind him of the thousands who appreciate his amazing work. Africa as a continent has very few professional photographers, a statistic that is worse in Uganda. Uganda, composed of a largely illiterate population consume their news through radio and visual platform in which Edward Echwalu comes in handy. For as long as he remains without his working tools, potentially a population of 34 million is denied a chance to be informed, to be educated and a chance to be part of the democratic process of their country.
We need to raise $15,000 to contribute to Echwalu and enable him replace his stolen gear but also purchase better quality one. He is willing to top up whatever cannot be raised here but he will be greatful to have it all raised. We need to purchase Canon 1D Mark IV and Canon 5D Mark II as well as lenses: Canon 24-70mm f2.8, Canon 16-35mm f2.8 and 70-200mm f2.8.
We aso have special and unique perks for you among which include: A framed and signed portrait from one of Africa’s finest photographers, A free photo shoot when you visit Uganda, A CD with a collection of 10 of the pictures taken by Echwalu around Africa. Signed Soft Copy of your favourite picture on his blog.
This project is so valuable because for many reason; the African narrative has been characterized by pictures of disease, war, starvation and crime yet there is a positive side to the life on this continent. Helping a photojournalist like Edward tell the positive side to the story will help in educating many more about Africa but also tell the African story as an African Journalist.
This is the very first online campaign we are engaging in as most of them have been offline and successful. An example was fundraising for Landslide victims in Eastern Uganda in 2012 and also fundraising for the Nodding Disease children in Northern Uganda. I hope this will be a success.
We are aware that not each one of you is able to contribute money but we appreciate other ways of contribution like sharing this cause with your networks and encouraging others to contribute. Whatever the contribution, we shall appreciate. Indiegogo has a number of share tools that you can use.

story:
First, some things you should know: I am donating 25% of donations to the ARK for Youth Shelter here in Kalamazoo!!!! PLEASE ACKNOWLEDGE: If you pay Via PayPal I will be able to process your perk almost immediately (1-2 days shipment and processing after). HOWEVER if you pay via Credit/Debit Card directly I won't be able to process your perk until the 60 day limit is up or until funding is reached.

       Hello, my name is William, I am 21 year old guy working 35 hours a week at a part time job to pay my bills. I am however not too good at doing this, asking for money that is; that feels like what I am doing. But I LOVE taking photos: photos of nature, photos of people, photos of homes. Basically, photos of anything that captures my interest and moves me. But sadly, I am realizing that between medical bills, car insurance, gas and food, I am not making nearly enough to take the classes that I so desperately want and need to further my passion. Especially since I do not find the need to charge people for portraits. I just can't bring myself to charge somebody for something that is honestly bettering me by helping hon my craft. I have always been rather self sufficient, having made it this far on my own, and have always put others before myself, but now I myself am turning for help. 

      All of your funding will go towards classes, a macro lens, photo ink & other lenses I have been looking at to bring  a better quality to the portraits I will be doing in the future. If there is any way at all that you have even 5 dollars to spare to help me do what I love, I can't even begin to tell you how thankful I am for your effort to somebody, that as far as I know, is a complete stranger to you.  

Here is a listing of what your money will be going towards:

Cost of Backdrop: $40

Cost of Classes: $250

Cost of Macro lens: $300

Cost of Portrait Lens: $450

Photo Ink: $50

It means the world to me and so does photography. Thank you.


Sincerely, 

William/Mishka


p.s. Please feel free to go check out my Facebook photography page: Mishka Metzgers Photography (linked on here)

story:
Short Summary

I have had a passion for aviation since I was very young, attending airshows where I watched through an airport or airbase fence for hours in awe. In late 2009 I was looking at some aviation photos and thought I would give it a try. In 2010 I had enough savings to pick up my first DSLR, a Canon XS. Shortly after that I got together with a local group who shared my passion for shooting aviation and there I gained a lot of knowledge and talent. From this experience I have learned everything I know about photography. My Canon broke while shooting an airshow in 2011 and I ended up with a Nikon D200 sold to me by a friend. I loved this camera as much as my Nikon so I am confident with both brands. All was going great and I was even working on a website to sell my work. A few weeks ago there was a tragedy at my house and I lost everything but my dogs and my computer. My photography was the thing that kept me going and I feel empty without a camera.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Before I lost my gear I was working on expanding my subjects. I had done work for Phoenix Comicon, a friends engagement party and I also had a small wedding booked all the while borrowing gear since mine was not up to par. 
  • Right now I have a large collection of photos, I'm not one to say it's the best but I have been published and have sold prints, if you contribute to my fund I will make sure you get high quality copies of your choice whether it be framed, canvas or a disc of high resolution wallpapers.
  • With the money I raise I hope to regain as much gear as possible and if possible to expand on what equipment I had so I can shoot a wider variety of situations and subjects.

The Impact

Indiegogo wants me to describe the impact this funding will have. Well to put it simply photography is my passion and I could not imagine going a day without it. I get huge gratification from being able to share my work and at no time in my life have I had a hobby that I put so much effort into and loved every minute of it. People tell me it's only pictures but I wish they could experience the feeling of getting the perfect shot or better yet being in pursuit of that perfect shot. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  •  I am in need of any kind of equipment since I am starting with zero but on top of that I could use anything from editing software,or a hard drive (3.5 SATA or external).
  •  I could really use some help getting a website going maybe even getting some campaigns started on there to start raise additional money on top of my Indiegogo campaign.
  • If donating is not something you are able to do at this time I understand however another you could help me would be sharing my campaign. It would mean the world to me!
